loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 53 años, es padre de un hijo en edad escolar y vive con su esposa quien lo apoya en todo. Desde hace 10 años brinda el servicio de transportes de pasajeros con un motocarro que compró gracias a la buena administracion de sus ganancias. Lo más le gusta de su trabajo es que no tiene la presión de un jefe y es independiente, además considera que su actividad es rentable porque sus ingresos son diarios. Para un futuro cercano, Antonio desea tener más motocarros para incrementar sus ganancias, contratando a un chofer que trabaje para él. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFPy lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes se conocen y se apoyan entre sí en alguna circunstancia adversa. Con el dinero solicitado comprará repuestos y un motor para mandar a reparar su motocarro y pueda trabajar tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Antonio is 53 years old and the father of a school aged child. He lives with his wife who supports him in everything. For 10 years, he has been providing passenger transport services using a motorcar that he bought as a result of managing his money well. What he enjoys most about his work is that he is independent and does not have the pressure of a boss. He also considers this line of work to be more profitable because he generates a daily income. In the near future, Antonio would like to acquire additional motorcars and hire another driver so that he can increase his earnings.

This is his 4th loan with MFP and he enjoys working with his communal bank group. All of the members know each other and support one another whenever there are difficult circumstances. With the money he is requesting, he will purchase a replacement motor for his motorcar so that it can run quietly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcar repairs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate A. is 56 years old and she is married with seven children. She sells garri (roasted cassava) and snails.

Kate hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more snails and garri to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri and snails to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia I. is 36 years old and she is married with five children. She sells tubers of yams.

Patricia hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more tubers of yams to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee vive con su esposo, quien se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte en su motocarro, ella a sus 34 años, es madre de 4 hijos que aun están estudiando. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, productos comestibles y bebidas, en un  espacio que acondicionó en su casa para su pequeña tienda. Para esta labor cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes cuando están libres de sus tareas escolares, la ayudan con la atención de los clientes. Para ella es muy importante dar una muy buena atención a las personas que visitan su bodega para comprar sus productos, además esta actividad la hace sentirse útil ante la sociedad. Asimismo, Aydee está muy satisfecha con su tienda porque le está generando buenos ingresos, los cuales están incrementando su nivel económico para poder vivir tranquila y sin preocupaciones. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está a gusto con su banco comunal porque sus compañeros son personas responsables y el grupo es muy unido. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más abarrotes, gaseosas y productos de primera necesidad para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Aydee lives with her husband, who works in public transport. She is 34 years old and a mother of 4 children that are schoolaged. For 2 years she has been working selling groceries, food and drinks, in a space that she set up in her house for the small store. Her children help her with the store when they don't have schoolwork. To her it is very important to provide the customers that visit her store with good service; in addition, having the store makes her feel useful in the community. Aydee, is very satisfied with her store because it is generating good income, which is increasing her economic ability to live tranquility and without worries. This is her second loan with MFP and she likes her communal bank because the other members are responsible people and the group is very united. With the money that she is requesting she will purchase more groceries, sodas and necessity products to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her store merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo G. est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. elle est revendeuse de poissons à Assahoun depuis 8 ans. Ce commerce est très florissant à cause de la très forte demande.  Elle souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce en payant des marchandises pour la revente.
texts.en:
Adzo G. is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has been a retailer of fish in Assahoun for 8 years. This business is flourishing thanks to very high demand. With this loan, she hopes to increase the size of her business by buying merchandise for resale.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, trabaja como seguridad física y tiene una pensión donde atiende cenas de lunes a domingo, es una forma de poder solventarse todos los gastos además que le ayuda a su madre con la alimentación.
Vive en la Zona de obrajes de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado la compra de insumos (Arroz, fideo, aceite, verduras y carne) para su negocio de venta de comida..
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Israel works as a security guard and also operates a boarding house where he serves dinner Monday through Sunday. This enables him to pay all of his expenses and also help his mother with the food bill. He lives with his parents in the Obrajes district of the city of La Paz.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies (rice, noodles, oil, vegetables and meat) for his food business. This is his third loan with IMPRO. His payment history qualifies him as a good client capable of making his installments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his food business

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en:
Abiola is 36 years old and married with two children. She lives in Lagos State. She sells tailoring materials and has been in her business for the past four years.

Abiola hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase of more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola sells clothes and she is also a fashion designer. She has been in this business for the past twelve years. Bola is 49 years old and married with four children.

Bola has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. She has been investing the loans in her clothes business and this has increased her profitability. She is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase of more clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes, tiene una pensión donde atiende almuerzos y platos extras, es una gran ayuda para su esposo ya que con su pensión puede solventar los gastos de alimentación de su familia.
Vive en la Zona de obrajes de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa de sus suegros
El crédito será destinado para la compra de insumos (papa, verduras. Aceite arroz fideo y otros).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lourdes runs a boarding house where she serves breakfast and snacks. Her business is a great help to her husband because she is in charge of the food expenses for the family. She and her family live with her in-laws in the Obrajes district of the city of La Paz.

Her loan will be used to buy supplies (potatoes, vegetables, oil, rice, noodles and other products). This is her third loan with IMPRO. Her payment history qualifies her as a good client capable of making her installments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her food business

loans.name: Yensi Beatriz

texts.es: Yensi Beatriz A. A. de 27 años de edad vive en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán  con sus padres y dos hermanas. Yensi posee un negocio el cual ha montado hace dos años es una venta de medicina popular, es decir no se necesita prescripción médica para comprarla y  también ofrece productos de consumo diario, el negocio de Yensi se encuentra ubicado en el mercado municipal de Atiquizaya una zona con mucha afluencia de personas, el crédito que Yensi solicita es para la compra de productos para surtir su negocio, ya que por tener poco tiempo de tenerlo aun no maneja márgenes grandes de existencia en mercadería, lo cual le afecta cuando sus clientes quieren comprar al por mayor de sus productos.
texts.en:
Yensi Beatriz A. A. is 27 years old and lives with her parents and two sisters in Atiquizaya, which is in the Ahuachapán district. For two years, Yensi has been operating her business selling traditional medicines. She says these medicines do not require a prescription and her store also offers products for daily consumption. Her business is situated in the Atiquizaya City Market, which is located in a highly populated district.

Yensi’s requested loan will be used to buy products to increase her business inventory. She doesn’t have time to maintain large margins on her existing merchandise, which affects her whenever her customers want to buy products wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to increase her inventory

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: Doña Maria Elsa es una mujer que a logrado tener su propio negocio ha mucho esfuerzo y apoyo de su familia. Su negocio es la elaboración de espejo y cuadros decorados, que son muy conocidos por los nicaragüenses, los estilo pata de león. Ella tiene 59 años de edad, reside en el barrio Carlos Aguirre en la capital de Managua,  sus dos hijos son mayores de edad casados, su esposo es agente vendedor que le ayuda a distribuir la mercancía en  los diferentes departamento. Con este crédito va a comprar materiales para elaborar los espejos y poder vender a sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios por la inversión de su negocio a través de sus préstamos con accesibles plazo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elsa is a woman who has succeeded in having her own business through a lot of effort and the support of her family. She makes decorative mirrors and frames, which are very well-known by Nicaraguans, in the style of lion’s legs. She is 59 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Carlos Aguirre in the capital of Managua. Her two children are adults and are married. Her husband is vendor, who helps her distribute the merchandise to different departments. With this loan, she is going to buy materials to make the mirrors so that she can sell them to her clients. She thanks Afodenic for the benefits that she has from the investments in her business because of the loans she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make mirrors

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como Radio taxi, y es una fuente para la subsistencia de un hijo que tiene y solventar los gastos de alimentación y educación.
Vive en la Zona de ovejuyo de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado capital de inversión (mantenimiento y reparación completa de su vehiculo).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Oscar has a vehicle and works as a radio dispatched taxi driver. It serves as a means for him to sustain his son and to provide for the food and educational expenses.

He lives in his parents’ house in the Ovejuyo area of the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used for investment capital (the maintenance and complete repair of his vehicle).

This is his third loan with Impro. His good payment history makes him a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Bertilia

texts.es: Bertila tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes ya tienen sus propias familias. Desde hace 30 años se viene dedicando a la venta de ropa, la cual lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Gracias a la demanda de sus prendas, Bertila puede comprar mercadería variada según la temporada y las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que la mantiene activa y se siente una persona útil para la sociedad. Ella considera que su negocio es rentable porque obtiene ganancias diarias con las que puede solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Adicionalmente a las prendas de vestir, Bertilia también vende cubrecamas, sabanas y otros de este tipo, con los que incrementa sus ganancias. Y para un futuro cercano no descarta la posibilidad de tener una tienda de ropa, pero para ello hay que trabajar muy duro, menciona. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas buenas, se entienden entre sí y trabajan con mucha responsabilidad. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará cubrecamas, colchas y las prendas que le han pedido sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bertila is 53 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children, who already have their own families. She has been selling clothing for 30 years and brings the clothing to different places in her area to sell. She has the help of her husband.

Thanks to the demand for her pieces of clothing, Bertila can purchase a variety of merchandise according to the season and the needs of each one of her customers. What she likes about her job is that it keeps her active and she feels like a useful person for society. She considers her business to be profitable because she has daily earnings that she can put towards household needs. In addition to pieces of clothing, Bertila also sells bedspreads, sheets, and other similar items that she uses to increase her earnings.

For the near future, she hasn’t ruled out the possibility of having a clothing shop, but to have one requires hard work, she mentions. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she likes her community bank. Her fellow members are very good people, they understand one another, and they work very responsibly. With the loan she is asking for she will purchase bedspreads, blankets, and the pieces of clothing that her customers have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah sells drinks and wine. she has been in this business for the past 28 years. Deborah is 51 years old and married with 4 children. She is very determine and ambitious about the speedy growth of her business and that of her family. 

She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. Deborah is requesting a loan of N140, 000 to purchase more drinks and wine to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more wine and drinks to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia se dedica a la venta de perfumes cosméticos y joyas de las líneas de Esita, yambal, Avon, y otros.
Vende sus productos a crédito para cobrar cada día a la semana, quincenal y mensualmente
Vive en la Zona de Achumani de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de perfumes, cosméticos, joyas y otros).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Julia sells perfumes, cosmetics, and jewelry from Esita, Yambal, Avon, and other lines. She sells her products on credit, which she collects weekly, bimonthly, and monthly.

She lives in a rented house in the Achumani area of the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used for working capital (purchase of perfumes, cosmetics, jewelry, and other items).

This is her third loan with Impro. Her good payment history makes her a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes, cosmetics, and jewelry for her sales on credit to her customers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 40 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos que la apoyan en todo lo posible. Desde hace 3 años de dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso en un puesto del mercado de su localidad. Gracias a esta labor puede solventar los gastos y la educación de sus hijos, a quienes espera ver, más adelante, buenos profesionales. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede relacionarse con varias personas y sobre todo que cada día aprende más sobre el comercio y cómo mejorar sus ventas. Carmen considera que su negocio es rentable porque los precios de las prendas que vende son accesibles para todas las personas y para un futuro cercano le gustaría establecerse en un local estable. Este es su 6to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas confiables y responsables. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa de segundo uso.
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old and a single mother. She lives with her 2 children who support her in every way possible. She has been selling second-hand clothing at a market stand in her area. Thanks to her work, she is able to cover the expenses and education of her children, who she hopes will be professionals in the future. What she likes about her job is that she can interact with a variety of people and above all, she learns more about business and how to improve her sales each day. Carmen considers her business to be profitable because the prices of the pieces of clothing that she sells are affordable for everyone. In the near future, she would like to establish herself in a stable site.

This is her sixth loan with MFP and she likes that her fellow members are trustworthy and responsible people. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of more second-hand clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aicha

texts.fr: Cette femme originaire de sokodé est mariée. Elle a venu à Lomé  en 2006 avec son époux où afin de subvenir aux charges  a commencé le commerce de charbons et de bois de chauffage. Elle a tout suite attiré beaucoup de gens car ses prix sont abordables. Voulant agrandir son commerce elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 7 sacs de charbons et des bois pour le chauffage.
texts.en:
This woman, originally from Sokodé, is married. She came to Lomé in 2006 with her husband, and in order to meet her household's needs, began a business selling charcoal and firewood here. She immediately drew lots of customers because her prices are affordable. Wanting to enlarge her business, she is seeking her second loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners), which will allow her to buy 7 bags of charcoal and firewood.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Salaou

texts.fr: Salaou I. est âgé de 43 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. il est propriétaire d’une boutique de pièces détachées à Assahoun. il détient ce commerce depuis 8 ans. Avec ce crédit, il souhaite accroître la capacité de son entreprise en approvisionnant son magasin de nouveaux produits. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Salaou I. is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children. He is the owner of a spare parts shop in Assahoun. He has run this business for 8 years. With this loan, he hopes to increase the capacity of his business by supplying his store with new products. He is counting on this opportunity to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat is business oriented and sells shoes. She has been in this business for the past 9 years. Kudirat is 49 years old and married with 4 children. Kudirat lives in Lagos and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. Kudirat hopes to obtain a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more shoes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Ismael López  de 51 años de edad, es integrante del grupo “Nueva Esperanza” y tiene el negocio de elaboración de muebles (bancos, sillas, mesas, cómodas, estantes), se unió al grupo hace un año y necesita el préstamo para  comprar  madera, él espera seguir con el grupo hasta obtener un crédito mayor. Al igual que Ismael las demás integrantes del grupo cuentan con diferentes negocios como la venta de zapatos, comida, otras se dedican a la confección de mantas, chamarras y algunas cuentan con tienda de barrio y necesitan el crédito para la comprar  mercadería (zapatos, arroz, fideo) y compra de materia prima (tela, lana y forro). A todas las integrantes de “Nueva Esperanza” les gusta confraternizar así que todas se preparan par compartir un apthapi (cada persona prepara comida y trae para compartir con el grupo).
texts.en:
Ismael López, 51, is a member of the Nueva Esperanza group. He makes furniture (benches, chairs, tables, dressers, shelves). He joined the group a year ago. He needs a loan to buy wood. He hopes to continue with the group and even get a larger loan. Just like Ismael, the rest of the group members have different businesses like selling shoes, food and other things. Some make blankets and jackets. Some have neighborhood stores. They need a loan to buy merchandise (shoes, rice, noodles) and to buy raw material (fabric, wool, and lining). All of the members of Nueva Esperanza like to get together with each other. They share potluck meals together.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material (wood, fabric, wool, and lining) and merchandise (shoes, rice, noodles)

loans.name: Nouroudine

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et père de 02 enfants. Il réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè logopé. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Voulant rehausser son stock qui s’épuise, il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 06 cartons de conserves, 5 cartons de savons, 4sacs de riz, 2 bidons d’huile et divers.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and has 2 children. He lives with his family in the Agoè Logopé district. The revenue-generating business he runs, and which allows him to provide for his family, is the sale of general food products. Wanting to raise his stock, which is dwindling, he is seeking his first loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 6 boxes of canned food, 5 boxes of soap, 4 bags of rice, 2 cans of oil, and other goods.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos. Su esposo trabaja en el comercio de verduras, mientras ella tiene un servicio de lavado de motos, motocarros y autos en un local que alquiló y está ubicado a media hora de su casa. Para obtener ganancias extras, en su negocio vende debidas, las cuales consumen sus clientes entre tanto esperan el lavado de sus vehículos. Esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 3 años y se siente muy a gusto porque se mantiene ocupada y le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una zona comercial. Para un futuro cercano, a Elizabeth le gustaría tener un pequeño bar para incrementar sus ganancias. Este es su 4to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es porque existe mucha comunicación entre sus compañeros y son puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mangueras para su lavadero, porque las que tiene se encuentran deterioradas debido al constante uso. También comprará bebidas para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 27 years old and lives with her partner, who is the father of her two children. Her husband sells vegetables, while she operates a vehicle cleaning service for motorcycles, motorcars and automobiles. She operates her business in a rented space located a half hour from her house. To earn extra money, she also sells cold beverages which customers drink while they are waiting for their vehicles to be washed. She has been operating for 3 years and feels quite comfortable because her business is profitable since it is located in a commercial area. In the near future, Elizabeth would like to open a small bar to increase her earnings.

This is her 4th loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her group because the members always communicate with each other and make their payments on time. With the money she is requesting, she will buy hoses for her vehicle wash business because the ones she has now are deteriorating due to constant use. She would also like to purchase more beverages to sell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hoses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Néhémie Plus Group

texts.fr: Déborah B. a comme activité commerciale, une boutique qu’elle gère elle-même. Elle a débuté son affaire en 2002 en vendant de l’eau pure. Malgré les difficultés rencontrées, son courage et sa détermination de réaliser son ambition d’ouvrir un dépôt des boissons sucrées l’ont motivée à persévérer en se joignant dans un groupe de Hope RDC dénommé « Néhémie » pour bénéficier des crédits. Sa boutique a prospéré grâce aux bénéfices accumulés réinvestis et une bonne gestion. Elle a obtenu trois fois les prêts qui l’ont renforcée et qu’elle a remboursés totalement à temps. Elle achètera avec le prochain crédit des sacs du sucre, du lait et autres articles pour renforcer le stock et revendre en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Sa boutique se situe sur une montagne à l’est de Kinshasa. Déborah est mariée, âgée de 45 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 12 et 19 ans. Cinq d’entre eux sont à l’école secondaire.
texts.en:
Déborah B.'s main commercial activity is a shop that she manages herself. She began her business in 2002 selling purified water. Despite the difficulties she encountered, her courage and determination to realize her dream of opening a shop selling sweet drinks motivated her to persevere by joining a Hope RDC group named "Néhémie" to benefit from loans. Her shop has prospered thanks to the reinvestment of her profits and her good management. She has obtained three loans, which strengthened her business and which she repaid completely on time. With the next loan, she will buy bags of sugar, milk, and other items to boost her stock and resell with the aim of increasing her income. Her shop is located on a mountain to the east of Kinshasa. Déborah is married, 45 years old, and has 6 children whose ages vary from 12 to 19. Five of her children are in secondary school.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar, milk, and other items to resell in order to increase income

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su esposa Martha y con sus 2 hijos que son solteros, pero trabajan para solventar sus gastos propios y apoyar en su hogar. Guillermo se dedica a la preparación y venta de dulces caseros; como rosquillas, biscochos, biscochuelos, etc., estos deliciosos postres los elabora con la ayuda de su esposa, para luego llevarlos al horno que él mismo construyó en su casa. Para la comercialización de estos dulces, cuenta con 3 personas quienes se dedican a venderlos por los diferentes lugares de su zona. A Guillermo le gusta su trabajo porque de esa manera se siente útil, ya que hace 8 años atrás sufrió un accidente que no le permitió seguir laborando regularmente. Pero ahora con su propio negocio, está obtiendo ganancias muy satisfactorias, las cuales está ahorrando poco a poco para llegar a tener una panadería. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que sus compañers le inspiranron confianza desde el primer momento que empezó a trabajar con ellos, además que todos son muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará grandes cantidades de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus dulces; como harina, almidón, aceite, huevos, azúcar, entre otros.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 57 years old and lives with his wife Martha and two children, who are single and work to pay their own expenses and provide support at home. Guillermo prepares and sells homemade sweets – such as donuts, cookies, cakes, etc. These delicious pastries are made with the help of his wife and then baked in the oven he built in his home. In order to market his products, he hired three people to sell them in different parts of the district. Guillermo enjoys his work because he feels useful. Eight years ago, he suffered an accident and was not able to work on a regular basis. He began saving money a little bit at a time until he had enough to start a bakery. Now that he has his own business, he is able to earn a decent income.

This is his 4th loan with MFP. He enjoys working with his communal bank group, in whom he has had great confidence from the first moment he began working with them. All of them have been responsible with their payments. With the money he is requesting, Guillermo will buy large quantities of ingredients needed to prepare his sweets – flour, starch, oil, eggs, sugar and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Klugbo

texts.fr: Klugbo J. est une jeune femme de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle tient une baraque sur laquelle elle étale divers articles. J. souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en louant un magasin et l’approvisionner. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour sauver sa famille de la misère.
texts.en:
Klugbo Jeanna is a married young woman, 34 years old, with 2 children. She has a stall where she displays and sells various items. With this loan, J. hopes to increase the size of her business by renting out a store and supplying it. She is counting on this opportunity to rescue her family from poverty.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent out a store and supply it

loans.name: José Luciano

texts.es: José Luciano R. R. de 31 años de edad reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán ubicado en el occidente del país. José es soltero vive con sus madre doña Catalina de 84 años de edad, y su hermana y un sobrino. A pesar que la hermana y sobrino de José trabajan es él quien absorbe la mayor parte de los gastos familiares, José posee una carpintería ubicada en su casa donde lleva ya diez años de funcionar, el destino del crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima para elaboración de muebles para vender   ya que desea producir muestras físicas de su trabajo y a la vez tenerlo en venta, de esta manera el lograría obtener más clientes y mas ventas si pudiesen ver sus productos.
texts.en:
José Luciano R. R., 31 years old, lives in the province of Ahuachapán, in the western part of the country. José is single and lives with his mother, Catalina, who is 84 years old, his sister, and a nephew. Although his sister and nephew also work, José is the one who is primarily responsible for supporting the family. For the past ten years José has run a carpentry business from his home. The purpose of this loan is to finance the purchase of raw materials to be used to make furniture to be sold. By having examples of his work for people to see and buy, he will be able to obtain more customers and more sales.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for furniture making

loans.name: Guirmen

texts.es: Guirmen tiene 38 años, vive junto a su esposa  y sus 2 hijos, quienes son su inspiración para salir adelante. Desde hace 5 años vende comida por las noches en una esquina a 2 cuadras de su casa, prepara platillos rápidos como salchipapas, salchipolllos, anticuchos y choncholines. Para este negocio cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien es la  encargada de atender a los clientes que  acuden a su puesto para probar de estos ricos platillos al paso. Sin embargo, no es la única actividad a la que se dedica, ya que también tiene un motocarro con el que brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros durante las mañanas, este oficio lo ejerce desde hace 10 años. Lo que le gusta de ambos negocios es que los mantienen activo, no trabaja presionado y le son muy rentables, ya que los ingresos son diarios y con ellos está solventando los estudios de sus hijos. Con MFP ya tiene 4 préstamos y lo que le gusta de ser parte de un banco comunal es que sus compañeros son muy responsables y trabajadores. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará en la compra de mesas y sillas, porque las que tiene no abastecen a sus clientes que día a día siguen aumentando.  También comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Guirmen is 38 years old, and lives with his wife and their two children, who are his inspiration to get ahead. For the past 5 years he has sold food in the evening on a street corner two blocks from his house. He makes typical local street food such as french fries with sausages, french fries with fried chicken and eggs, and grilled skewers of meat. His wife supports him in this business, waiting on the customers who come to his stall to try the delicious dishes. This is not the only activity he has, though - he also has a motorized three-wheel cart that he uses to transport passengers in the mornings, something that he has done for the past 10 years. What he likes about both businesses is that they keep him active, he is not under a lot of pressure, and the businesses are profitable, producing daily income that allows him to pay for his children's education. He has already had 4 loans with MFP, and what he enjoys about being in a community bank is that his fellow members are very responsible and hard-working. The money that he is requesting now will be used to buy tables and chairs, because the ones he has now are not enough for his growing number of customers. He will also buy parts that he needs to get his vehicle repaired.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs; repair motorized cart

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 34 años, tiene 3 hijas que cursan estudios primarios y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposa. Desde hace 3 años es socio y trabaja en un restaurante especializado en pollo a la brasa, junto con su hermana, él es el encargado de azar los pollos y freír las papas, mientras que su  hermana atiende a los clientes. Jorge se siente muy satisfecho con este trabajo porque es un negocio independiente y seguro. Además le gusta mucho ver a los comensales degustar los pollos dorados y las papas crocantes que elabora. Por otro lado, le es muy rentable porque este tipo de restaurante, conocido como “pollería” es muy concurrido en cualquier zona de su ciudad. El deseo de Jorge para el futuro es tener su propia pollería, donde todas las ganancias sean para él y su familia. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos son muy unidos y cumplidos con sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo usará para incrementar su capital de inversión para su negocio y también comprará materiales de construcción para reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jorge is 34 years old and, together with his very supportive wife, has three daughters in elementary school. For the last three years he has been a part-owner of a restaurant that specializes in roast chicken, also working in the restaurant with his sister. He is responsible for roasting the chickens and frying the potatoes while she waits on the customers. Jorge is very satisfied with this work because the business is independent and stable. He also really likes to see his customers enjoy the golden chicken and crispy potatoes that he makes. The business is very profitable, since this kind of chicken restaurant is very popular in any neighborhood in his town. Jorge's dream for the future is to own his own chicken restaurant, where all of the profits will go to him and his family. This is his fifth loan with MFP. What he enjoys about working with his community bank is that everyone is very united and responsible with their payments. The money that he is requesting will be used to increase his capital share in the business and also to purchase construction materials to repair his home.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital investment in restaurant; home repairs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sédivé Plus Group

texts.fr: Boyoko Kanyonda a comme activités commerciales, une boutique et une cabine téléphonique qu’il a ouvertes en 2006. Son esprit d’entreprenariat le pousse toujours à imaginer la diversification de son affaire. Il est devenu membre d’un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé «  Sédivé Plus » depuis 2008. Le soutien financier permanent qu’il bénéficie à travers des prêts, l’aidera à concrétiser son ambition d’acheter un véhicule. Boyoko utilisera le crédit prochain pour acheter des jeux d’enfants tant  sollicités dans son quartier dans le but d’accroitre le revenu. Actuellement, ses activités lui génèrent un bénéfice de $10 par jour. Boyoko est célibataire âgé de 24 ans. Ses activités se situent dans une zone montagneuse à l’est de Kinshasa.
texts.en:
Boyoko Kanyonda has, as his main commercial activities, a shop and a telephone booth, which he opened in 2006. His entrepreneurial spirit has always pushed him to imagine diversifying his businesses. He has been a member of one of the groups of Hope RDC named "Sédivé Plus" since 2008. The standing financial support he benefits from through loans will help him make his dream of buying a vehicle a reality. Boyoko will use his next loan to buy children's toys, which are much sought after in his area, with the goal of increasing his income. Currently, his businesses generate a profit of $10 a day. Boyoko is unmarried and 24 years old. His businesses are located in a mountainous area east of Kinshasa.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's toys with the goal of raising profits

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Massolomani

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè. Elle exerce comme activité le commerce de céréales, les clients achètent plus le maïs que les autres céréales parce qu’il est très utilisé dans la cuisine togolaise pour préparer la pâte et divers autres aliments. Le stock de céréales a diminué, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 7 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
This woman is married with 2 children, and lives with her family in the Agoè district. She runs a business selling cereals. Her customers buy more maize than any other cereal because it is commonly used in Togolese cuisine to prepare paste and various other foods. Her stock of cereals has diminished, so she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 7 sacks of maize.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 29-year-old lady who is married to Patrick Kariuki.  Together they have been blessed with two children.

She has been in the men's clothing business for the past three years. Hellen's business is situated in the busy Nairobi city center. She travels regularly to Turkey to restock her business.

Before joining KADET, she was able to get a bank loan which she paid off.  Then she was introduced to KADET by her friend, and this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings will be her first.

Hellen's current income bracket is 80,000 Kenyan shillings per month. She hopes to open two more shops and create job opportunities for other people as her employees.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more stock for a men's clothing shop.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme commerce la vente en détail de matelas et d’oreillers, elle est la seule à exercer ce commerce dans son quartier  ce qui lui permet de mieux vendre et de réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices. Son stock étant en baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 17 matelas et 26 oreillers.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman runs a business retailing mattresses and pillows. She is the only person engaged in this business in her area, which allows her to sell better and to realize large profits. Her stock being low, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 17 mattresses and 26 pillows. She is married and has 3 children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mattresses, pillows, and sheets

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba H. sells smoked fish at Abura. Aba has received a junior high school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. Aba has been selling smoked fish since 1979. She buys smoked fish from the fish mongers and resells them.  Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish from the fishermen and then smoke it for sale. She is responsible with paying her bills. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to finance the building of a store.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en:
Adelaide A. M. is 35 years old and is a native of the capital city of Mozambique, Maputo. She has moved around the Southern part of the country quit frequently. In 1990 she left Maputo for Xai-Xai. She then returned to Maputo from 1994 to 1998 before spending time in Chimoio and Xaixai from 1999 to 2002. Since 2002 she has been living in Boane with her family. She is married and the mother of two children, ages three and seven. Adelaide is currently pursuing her bachelors degree in psychology at the public university in Maputo. 

Adeliade has requested this loan to help finance construction of her home. She has taken out three loans previously for the same reason and has successfully concluded the first phases of her home construction. Adeliade and her husband are both employed as teachers at local elementary schools in Boane. She was originally trained by the Mozambican Institute of Education and has been teaching for the last 10 years. 

Adeliade's dream is to finish her bachelors degree. When she has completed her degree she intends on taking out further loans to finance personal projects.

About housing loans in Mozambique: In rural Mozambique many people still do not live in proper homes. Years of civil war and economic shocks have inhibited residents from accessing capital and buying building materials for their homes. The last several years have been relatively prosperous and many residents are using microfinance as a means to commence construction of their home.

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Grace Nduta

texts.en:
Grace N. is a 51-year-old lady who is married to Elijah Muigai N.. Together they have been blessed with five children, with four of the children still attending school.

Grace has been in the grocery business for the last two years and this business has been sustaining both her and her family. Since her business is situated in the open air market at Githurai, she is able to sell quite an amount of her stock each day and the money from those sales enable her to get fresh stock for the next day.  She gets her supplies directly from the farmers and she sells to others in wholesale and retail. Sometimes she does this business in other markets within Githurai and nearby towns like Thika. 

Grace was introduced to KADET through her church and she has been able to access and repay three loans without delay. This is her fourth loan, which she hopes will enable her buy and own a plot which she can build her own house and others for rental purposes. 

In future, she hopes to get enough land to start dairy and poultry farming to increase her income. Her current income is about 9,300 Kenyan shillings ($120 U.S.) per month.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a fruit and vegetable stand, and to buy a plot of land to build a house.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah W. is a 46-year-old single mother of four children. She lives in Magongo, a densely populated town near Changamwe, a mainland town on the Nairobi-Mombasa highway on the outskirts of Mombasa.

Teresiah operates a clothing boutique mainly dealing with tie-dyed clothes, and has been in the business for the last four years. She has previously taken out two loans from KADET to finance her business, and with this third loan she plans to increase her clothes stock and also buy more tie-dye materials.

Teresiah supplements her income through poultry farming and sale of chickens.  In the future she hopes to own a permanent building and expand her business to wholesale status.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock and tie-dye materials for a clothing boutique.

loans.name: Libana

texts.es: Libaña tiene 24 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres y sus 5 hermanos. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida por las noches en la puerta de su casa, pero no le fue muy bien por lo que prefirió cambiar de actividad económica. Entonces desde hace 6 meses instaló en su casa unos módulos para ofrecer el servicio de llamadas telefónias, el cual es denominado “locutorio”. Libaña se preocupa por dar una buena atención a sus clientes y está muy contenta porque sus ganancias se están incrementando de a pocos y su negocio está siendo visitado por más personas. Una vez consolidado su locutorio, Libaña quiere implementar algunas computadoras para también ofrecer internet. Este es su 5to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que hay mucha comunicación y todos son personas responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita mandará a construir una cabina adicional para su locutorio, lo que le costará aproximadamente 200 soles, con lo restante y aumentando parte de sus ahorros comprará un motocarro para aumentar sus ganancias realizando taxi.
texts.en:
Libaña is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents and her 5 siblings. She used to work selling food at night from the doorway of her house, but it was not going very well so she decided to change. Six months ago she installed telephone booths in her house to start a phone call center. Libaña works hard to provide good services to her customers and she is pleased to see that her income is growing and that more customers are coming. Once her call center is established, Libaña wants to set up some computers so that she can also offer internet services. This is her fifth loan with MFP and what she enjoys about working with her group is that there is a lot of communication and all of the members are responsible with their payments. With the money that she is requesting now, she will have another booth built for the telephone center, which will cost about 200 PEN. With the rest of the money and her own savings she will buy a motorcycle taxi to start earning money that way.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of another telephone booth; purchase of a motorcycle taxi

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. in a 38-year-old married mother of four children. She lives with her family in Shanzu, Mombasa where she runs a primary school. The school has been in operation for the last four years.  In the future she plans to expand it into a high school.

Elizabeth is accessing her first loan from KADET. With this 80,000 Kenya shilling loan, she plans to purchase school teaching materials and also repair some furniture in the school.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase school teaching materials, and to repair furniture in the school.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina T. has been a longtime resident of Namaacha. She has  spent the majority of her 41 years there. Rosalina studied through the 6th grade, at which point her family could no longer afford to send her to school and she was forced to abandon her studies. She is married and is the mother of five children. Rosalina supports all of her children as well as 2 nephews that live with her. 

Rosalina intends on using her loan to continue construction of her home. This will be the third loan she has taken out with Hluvuku for this purpose. The other loans have been successfully paid back and were used to finance the initial stages of her construction. 

Since 1983 Rosalina has been working as a maid. She earns around MT 3,356.00 per month and is able to save a little bit each month. Her dream is to finish construction of her home so that her family can be more comfortable.  

About housing loans in Mozambique: In rural Mozambique many people still do not live in proper homes. Years of civil war and economic shocks have inhibited residents from accessing capital and buying building materials for their homes. The last several years have been relatively prosperous and many residents are using microfinance as a means to commence construction of their home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Ysolida

texts.es: Ysolida tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y con el menor de sus 4 hijos que aun es estudiante. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de “juanes” (plato típico de la región a base de arroz y carne de pollo) y bebidas en la puerta de su casa, la cual está ubicada frente a un centro educativo, teniendo a los alumnos como sus princiapales clientes. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que la mantienen ocupada y se siente útil, además de agradarle mucho conversar con sus clientes. Por otro lado, su negocio le es muy rentable, porque el platillo que vende es muy demandado y las bebidas se venden constantemente debido al intenso calor de la región. Para un futuro cercano, Ysolinda quiere mandar a construir un kiosco adecuado para vender con mayor comodidad. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros se comprenden, son personas tranquilas y demuestran mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ingredientes para la preparación de sus “juanes” y también adquirira materiales de construcción para arreglar su vivienda, ya que le faltan algunas estructuras y teme que le puedan robar.
texts.en:
Ysolida is 50 years old and lives with her husband and the youngest of her 4 children, who is still a student. For the last 8 years she has sold "juanes" (a typical regional chicken and rice dish) and beverages from the doorway of her house, which is across the street from a school, which means that the students are her main customers. What she likes about her business is that it keeps her busy and she feels useful, and she enjoys talking with her customers. Also, the business is very profitable, because the food that she serves is very popular and she sells a lot of beverages due to the intense heat in the area. In the near future Ysolida would like to build a kiosk so that she could sell food more comfortably. This is her 7th loan with MFP and what she likes about working with her community bank is that the members understand each other well, are pleasant people, and are very responsible with their payments. With the money that she is requesting she will buy more ingredients for the food that she prepares and will also buy construction materials to fix up her house, because she is concerned that she can be robbed the way the house is now.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tshatchibara

texts.fr: Tshatchibara K. est une jeune femme de 25 ans, mariée et mère d’un petit garçon. Elle détient de puis 3 ans, une boutique d’alimentation générale à Adeta. Ce commerce est très prospère et Kandé souhaite créer une deuxième boutique dans un village environnant. Elle compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Tshatchibara Kandé is a married young woman aged 25, and is the mother of one young boy. For 3 years, she has run a general food store in Adeta. This business is very prosperous, and Kandé hopes to set up a second shop in a neighbouring village. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a second shop

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda F. C. is 35 years old and currently lives in Boane. She is a single mother with a 10 year old daughter. She also supports two nieces that live with her. Fernanda studied through the twelfth grade, at which point she stopped her studies in order to begin working. 

Fernanda is requesting this loan to continue construction of her home. This well be the second loan she has taken out with Hluvuku for this reason. It is very important for her to finish construction so that her and her daughter have adequate living space. 

Fernanda has been teaching at a local elementary school in Boane for the past 10 years. She was trained to be a teacher by the Mozambican Institute of Education in Matola. She earns around MT 4,627 per month and is able to save a bit each month. Fernanda's dream is to finish the construction of her home and to get married. 

About housing loans in Mozambique: In rural Mozambique many people still do not live in proper homes. Years of civil war and economic shocks have inhibited residents from accessing capital and buying building materials for their homes. The last several years have been relatively prosperous and many residents are using microfinance as a means to commence construction of their home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Ayub Kinuthia's Group

texts.en:
Ayub N. is married with one son. He runs a building and construction materials business at Kikuyu where he has lived for the past five years. His expected monthly profit is about 20,000 Kenyan shillings ($250 U.S.).  His construction supplies business is his only source of income.

Ayub was introduced to KADET by a friend who is already a KADET client.  With this loan, he intends to buy more supplies for his construction supply shop.

Ayub hopes to expand his business to a include more hardware, and to buy a plot of land to build a new store. He also wants to buy a pickup truck to deliver goods to his customers, and later venture into the freight business. Ayub also dreams of opening a home for needy children.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for a construction supply shop.

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
La señora Marcia Emma natural D. tarma,tiene 25 años D. edad, conviviente,  tiene 02 hijos D. 7 y 3 años,  todos a su cargo, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía comunal “Las Maravillas”.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad, recientemente desD. unos días, su alcancía comunal esta conformada por 10 socios  los cuales realizan actividades como comercio y servicio. Maria se dedica a la venta D. comida jugos ambulatorio en el M. productores, desD. hace 4 años y en los fines D. semana se dedica a al venta D. salchipollos.
Con el préstamo D. S/.400.00  Nuevos soles, le servirá para acondicionar a  sus clientes comprando una carreta y sillas para su negocio.
Maria anhela para su futuro comprarse un puesto en el M. para que pueda vender su comida y comprarse su terreno.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Emma is a native of Tarma. She is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children (ages 7 and 3). She serves as president of the communal bank group “Las Maravillas”.

She works with the Prosperidad branch of EDAPROSPO. Her communal bank group recently formed a few days ago. It consists of 10 members who engage in various retail and service businesses. Maria sells food and juices on foot through the farmers market. Within the past four years, she has been selling salchipollos (chicken & potatoes) on the weekends.

With her loan of 400 soles, she will purchase a vending cart and chairs for her business. This will equip her to serve her customers. Maria hopes that in the future she can buy her own vending stall at the market to sell her foods and also purchase a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vending cart & chairs

loans.name: Cucilda

texts.en:
Cucilda B. is 38 years old and has been an elementary school teacher for the past 16 years. She has spent the majority of her life in Boane, Mozambique. After the 12th grade Cucilda was forced to stop studying and begin working. She was trained to be a teacher at the Mozambican Institute of Education. As a teacher Cucilda makes MT 4,627 a month and is able to save a little bit each month. 

Cucida is requesting this loan to help finance the construction of her home. This will be the second loan she has taken out with Hluvuku for this reason. She successfully paid back her previous loan and has begun construction on her home.

Cucilda is the married and is the mother of two children. She also supports two  nieces that live with her. Her dream is to finish construction of her home and to take out another loan to start a small business. 

About housing loans in Mozambique: In rural Mozambique many people still do not live in proper homes. Years of civil war and economic shocks have inhibited residents from accessing capital and buying building materials for their homes. The last several years have been relatively prosperous and many residents are using microfinance as a means to commence construction of their home.

loans.use: Construction Materials

loans.name: Cecily

texts.en:
Cecily W. is a married lady with one child. She runs a new clothes shop in the city of Nairobi. Some of her clients are walk-in customers, and others are regulars.

Cecily has been in this business for the past two-and-a-half years and has never borrowed from any financial institution before. This will be her first loan from KADET, to which she was introduced by a friend.  She will use this loan as working capital to buy more new clothes to resell.

In the future, Cecily hopes to expand her business to a larger shop and open others within the city center.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more stock of new clothes to resell.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo D. est un jeune homme de 33 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. il désire avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son magasin en l’approvisionnant de nouveaux produits.
texts.en:
Kodzo D. is a 33 year old young man, married and father of two children. He owns a general store in Adeta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He wishes to increase the size of his store by stocking up on new goods.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for his store

loans.name: Mary Njeri

texts.en:
Mary K. is a 36-year-old single mother who has one son. Her son is 12 years old and he is in the sixth grade at school.  Mary lives in Uthiru Village, which is a peri-urban estate.

Mary operates a beauty salon at Uthiru, a business she has had for the last nine years.  She got to know about KADET through a friend who was also a member in one of its borrowing groups.  Since Mary joined KADET she has taken out  two other loans, and this will be her third one.

Mary has plans to use this loan to equip her saloon with modern equipment so that she will be able to meet her clients' needs.  Likewise, she also intends to buy hair treatment and hair accessories which she can supply to other businesses or beauty salons.  In the future, she hopes to become a supplier of such products in the area of Uthiru.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dryer for a salon, and hair treatment and chemicals to resell.

loans.name: Nashon

texts.en:
Nashon O. is 57 years old and is married to Lilian, age 46. They have four children and they live with in Shanzu, Mombasa.

Nashon runs a home products business from a temporary stall where he sells different goods for household use.  He has been in this business for nine years.  This will be Nashon's first loan from KADET, and with it he plans to buy more stock for his business and also to start a poultry raising project.

In the future, Nashon hopes to open a big shop, and relocate from the temporary stall where he currently does business to a permanent building.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase more home products to resell, and to finance a poultry raising project.

loans.name: Nicholas Mutuku

texts.en:
Mutuku K. is a single man. He distributes packaged food and other household goods to other small traders in the Kibera slums and neighboring areas. The Kibera slums are the biggest in Nairobi with a population estimated at more than one million people. Besides food distribution, he also does photography as a secondary business.

Mutuku learned about KADET from his friends and other businessmen in his line of work. Before borrowing from KADET, he never borrowed money from any other microfinance institution. This will be Mutuku's third loan from KADET. In the future, Mutuku hopes to be able to buy a motorcycle to distribute his products and, some day, to buy a van.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To increase inventory of packaged food and other household goods

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia A. is married and has three children. Her husband is a teacher. She has received schooling through junior high school.

Cynthia sells kenkey at Abura, which she has done since 1999. Kenkey is a Ghanaian dish which is prepared from fermented corn dough that is cooked and wrapped in the corn husk and eaten with hot pepper.

Cynthia uses her income to pay school fees and clothing for the children. She will use the loan to buy maize to prepare more kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy maize to prepare more kenkey for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply his shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is a 29-year-old married lady with one child. She sells new clothes in Nairobi city where some of her clients are walk-in customers and others are regulars.

Mary was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. She has been in the business of selling clothes for two and a half years. Mary plans to use the funds from this loan as working capital and will buy more inventory for her clothes shop. In the future, Mary hopes to expand her business by opening more shops in the city and she wants to buy a plot of land.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more new clothes to resell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah P. is a single parent and has two children. Her husband is a trader. Hannah has received junior high school education.

Hannah has a grocery store at Abura where she sells a variety of items. She has been selling groceries like milk, canned drinks, etc. since 2002 and is responsible for paying fees and house-keeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy provision for resale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business and re-invest.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Q. sells fried fish at Abura, which she has done since 1979. She is married and has four dependants. Her husband is a plumber. She received schooling through junior high school. Comfort uses her income to help the children at school. Comfort will use this loan to buy fresh fish from the fishermen and fry them to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to finance the building of a store.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish from the fishermen to fry for sale

loans.name: Seremos El Triunfo Del Mañana Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal se denomina “SEREMOS EL TRIUNFO DEL MAÑANA”, y está conformado por 12 socios, ellos pertenecen al barrio de Huancaro.

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ellos timen sus diferentes puestos de ventas de frutas en el mercado Virgen Asunta de Huancaro, ellos recepcionan las frutas que son traídas desde la zona selva de de Perú, en camiones y los venden al por mayor a nuestros socios, que son los que posteriormente la venden al por menor, hay todo tipo de frutas, siendo las más comunes, las naranjas, las mandarinas, los plátanos, los duraznos, blanquillos, manzanas, pomelos, limas, y según la época varían los tipos de diversidad de frutas, para seguir con su comercio estos socios piden un préstamo, de este modo ellos seguirán comprando al por mayor sus frutas y los venderán en sus stand.

Nuestros socios se encuentran muy agradecidos por el apoyo otorgado y valoran este préstamo, comprometiéndose a cumplir con el pago respectivo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "Seremos el Triunfo del Mañana" (We will be Tomorrow's Triumph) and is made up of 12 members from the Huancaro neighborhood. Our members alternate their home activities with retail business; they have different stands selling fruit in the Virgen Asunta de Huancaro market. They purchase wholesale fruit trucked in from the jungle regions of Perú and later sell them retail. They sell all kinds of fruit, the most common are oranges, tangerines, bananas, peaches, blanquillos, apples, grapefruit, and limes. The variety of fruit available depends on the season. To continue their businesses these members request a loan that will allow them to keep buying fruit in bulk at wholesale prices to sell from their stands. Our members are very grateful for the support provided and value this loan, committing themselves to make their respective repayments during the time scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale fruit.

loans.name: George Kimondiu

texts.en: George K. is married to Agnes Mueni and they have been blessed with three children who are all going to school. George has been in the grocery business for the last ten years and, together with his wife, he also runs a tailoring shop and a bread distribution business. George's business is situated in Waruku, which is a highly populated area near Nairobi where he also supplies bread and milk to other small traders within the area. His current profit is about 20,000 Kenyan shillings ($250 U.S.) per month. George had a need to find money to grow his business and was introduced to KADET by friends. This loan will be George's first one from KADET. He plans to use the money from this loan to to buy inventory for his grocery store. In future, he wants to expand his tailoring business, diversify into the transportation business, and be able to add more stock to his bread and milk distribution business. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his grocery store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth L. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through vocational school. Ruth has a small store where she sells clothes in Abura. She also keeps some in a big bowl and moves from customer to customer to sell, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is a trader. Ruth uses her income to pay for house-keeping. Ruth will use the loan to purchase more of the goods for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ruth plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba E. is married and has three children. She has received no formal education. Aba sells smoked fish at Abura, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a mason. Aba uses her income to support the family. Aba will use the loan to buy more fish for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to build a store.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace D. is a single parent and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Grace has a small boutique where she sells shoes, panties and clothing at Abura, which she has done since 2002. Grace uses her income to pay house-keeping expenses. Grace will use the loan to buy more shoes, panties and clothing. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to save and re-invest.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to buy shoes, panties and clothing.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac O. sells top up cards for mobile phones at Abura. Isaac has received senior high school education. He is single and has no dependants. Isaac has been selling top up cards since 2005. He is responsible for paying for fees and clothing. His loan will be used to buy more top up cards for sale. He hopes to save the new profits from his business and re-invest.

loans.use: To buy more top up cards for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply his shop

loans.name: Grace Esi

texts.en: Grace Esi O. sells kenkey at Abura. Grace Esi has received junior high school education. She is married and has 4 dependants. Her husband is a cleaner at UCC. Grace Esi has been selling kenkey since 1989. She is responsible for paying for fees and clothing. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare the kenkey in a large quantity. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and re-invest.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare the kenkey in a large quantity.

loans.name: Ekuah

texts.en: Ekuah G. sells food stuffs and fruits at Abura. Ekuah has received junior high school education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a carpenter. Ekuah has been selling food stuffs and fruits since 2005. She is responsible for helping the children to attend school. Her loan will be used to supply more food stuffs and fruits to customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To supply more food stuffs and fruits to customers.

loans.name: Alaza

texts.fr: Alaza W. est un jeune homme très ambitieux. Agé de 32 ans, il est marié et père d’un petit garçon. Il est revendeur de l’huile à moteur au bord de la route à Adeta. Son commerce consiste à payer le carburant auprès des stations à essence et il vient faire son exposition avec une marge bénéficière conclut avec la station. Il compte sur cette chance pour donner à son commerce une nouvelle orientation.
texts.en:
Alaza W. is a very ambitious young man. He is 32 years old, married, and the father of a young boy. He is a retailer of motor oil on the roadside in Adeta. His business involves buying fuel from gas stations, and he offers it with a profit margin agreed upon with the gas station. He is counting on this chance to give his commerce a new direction.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the size of his business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is married and has three children. She has received no formal education. Comfort has a small grocery store where she sells milk, Milo and tinned fish at Amisanu in Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a farmer. Comfort uses her income to pay fees and bills. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more provisions for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to invest.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret N. owns a small spot where she cooks and sells oats, rice and beans at Amsisanu in Elmina. Margaret has received primary education. She is divorced and has 6 dependants. Margaret has been selling oats, rice and beans since 2000. She is responsible for paying fees and bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice to be cooked for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to raise money to support her children.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice to be cooked for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. has a small boutique where she sells ladies' underwear and panties in Elmina. She is also involved in selling food items. Elizabeth has received junior high school education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a prison officer. Elizabeth has been selling ladies' underwear and food supplies since 2006. She is responsible for paying fees and bills. Her loan will be used to buy more stock for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. is married and has three children. She has received no formal education. Mary sells kenkey at Amissanu in Elmina, which she has done since 2001. Her husband is an ex-civil servant. Mary uses her income to pay for rent and other bills. Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize to increase production of the kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to build a provision store.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to increase production of the kenkey.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina A. is a food vender at Amissanu in Elmina. She has a small shed in which she sells. Regina has received primary education. She is married and has 5 dependants. Her husband is a teacher. Regina has been selling food since 2001. She is responsible for paying bills. Her loan will be used to buy more meat and foodstuffs to increase her food production and sales. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and help children to further their education.

loans.use: To buy more meat and food stuffs to increase her food production and sales.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received no formal education. Mary sells food at Amissanu in Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Her husband works at KEEA District Assembly. Mary uses her income to pay bills. Mary will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. sells banku at Amissano. She prepares banku from maize. Banku is mostly eaten with okro soup, so she prepares okro and other soups. Mary has received no formal education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a teacher. Mary has been selling banku since 2002. She is responsible for paying school fees. Her loan will be used to buy maize and okro and other ingredients for the preparation of the food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy maize and okro and other ingredients for the preparation of the food for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is a baker and sells bread at Amissano. Cecilia has received junior high school education. She is a single parent and has three children.
