Cecilia has been selling bread since 1988. She is responsible for paying bills. Her loan will be used to buy baking powder and other ingredients for the baking of the bread. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand the business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy baking powder and other ingredients for the baking of the bread.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina O. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received schooling through senior high school. Regina sells banku and fish at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 2008. Her husband is a porter. Regina uses her income to pay bills and other household expenses. Regina will use the loan to purchase bags of maize and other food stuffs for the preparation of the food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Regina plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize and other food stuffs for the preparation of the food for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice B. is a baker and sells bread at Amissano in Elmina. Beatrice has received junior high school education. She is married and has 5 dependants. Her husband is a teacher. Beatrice has been selling bread since 2006. She is responsible for buying books for the children. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and margarine and other ingredients for the baking of the bread. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and margarine and other ingredients for the baking of the bread.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda D. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received no formal education. Hilda sells provisions and mineral water at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Her husband is a cleaner. Hilda uses her income to pay bills. Hilda will use the loan to purchase more provisions for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hilda plans to reinvest.

loans.use: Hilda will use the loan to purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine E. M. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received schooling through senior high school. Josephine E. makes and sells palm and coconut oil at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 1997. Her husband is a farmer. Josephine E. uses her income to pay bills. She will use the loan to buy more beans and plantain to add to what she trades in. With the new profits from her expanded business, Josephine E. plans to further the children's education.

loans.use: To buy more beans and plantain to add to what she trades in.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth E. has a small salon where she sells weave-on hair products and also makes a variety of hairstyles for her customers at Amissano in Elmina. Elizabeth has received tertiary education. She is a single parent and has two children. Elizabeth has been selling weave-on hair products since 2008. She is responsible for paying fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy creams, weave-on and other hair products. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a store.

loans.use: To buy creams, weave-on and other hair products.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica A. is divorced and has 9 dependants. She has received schooling through senior high school. Monica sells meat at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Monica uses her income to pay fees and utility bills. Monica will use the loan to buy more meat for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Monica plans to help educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more meat for resale.

loans.name: Herber Noe

texts.es:
Herber Noe C. Ruiz es un joven señor de 26 años de edad, quien vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de un  año de edad,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Desde hace 4 años Herber se dedica a la siembra de tiquisque, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Cosa Rica como en otros países.

Herber considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida, logrando ser actores en el desarrollo de la comunidad, la cual se ve frecuentemente azotada por las inclemencias del tiempo y el desempleo.

Actualmente Herber desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢300,000 (Trescientos mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del tiquisque. 

Herber es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Herber Noe C. is 26 years old, lives with his wife and small one year old son in a small rural community in Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala, located in Alajuela province. There they work in business having cattle (beef and dairy) and agriculture growing basic grains such as rice, beans, corn and more. 4 years ago Herber began growing “tiquisque” or corms of taro, a tuber with a pleasant flavor, rich in nutrients, widely grown and in high demand in Costa Rica as well as other countries. Herber believes that thanks to this project, he and his family have little by little improved their quality of life, becoming active in community development, which frequently is impacted by bad weather and unemployment. Today Herber wishes a loan for ¢300,000 colones, to help prepare his fields, buy seeds, fertilizers, manure among other items needed to guarantee an optimal crop of corms of taro. Herber is a member of the Datraban Communal Bank, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and economically in addition to actively participating in the microloan organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farming supplies

loans.name: Consentidas Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales más alejados  de Pro Mujer, “Collpani” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Consentidas”, con doce integrantes  que se organizan para llevar a delante su reunión, liderizadas por su presidenta Maribel A., esperan estar juntas mucho tiempo hasta lograr ahorros considerables que les permita capitalizarse y no depender de un préstamo en un futuro. Algunas  tienen negocios de comercialización  como la venta de repuestos de auto, verduras, ropa, tapiz, joyas y otras se dedican a negocios de producción, como  la confección de chamarras, faldas y panadería. Las que se dedican a la comercialización necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y las que producen necesitan comprar  tela, forro, hilo y harina.

Eustaquia V. tiene una cerrajería y antes pertenecía a otro grupo en otro Centro Focal y por el cambio de domicilio se unió a  un nuevo grupo, ella menciona que los préstamos obtenidos le han sido de mucha ayuda porque ha podido comprarse herramientas de trabajo como el tanque de oxigeno, taladro, amuladora y ahora necesita  el préstamo para la compra de  una compresora.
texts.en:
In one of the most remote Pro Mujer Focal Centres, "Collpani", you find the Communal Association "Consentidas". With twelve members who organise themselves to help their meetings move forward, they are lead by their president Maribel A. and they hope to be together for a long time until they have enough savings to allow them to grow bigger and not depend upon loans in the future. Some of them have commercial businesses like selling car parts, vegetables, clothes, tapestries and jewellery, and others have production businesses like making jackets, skirts and pastries. Those that dedicate themselves to commercial businesses need a loan to buy merchandise and those that have production businesses need to buy fabric, lining, thread and flour.

Eustaquia V. has a locksmith and she used to belong to another group in another Focal Centre, and because of moving house she joined a new group. She mentions that the loans she has obtained have helped her a lot because she has been able to buy work tools like an oxygen tank, a drill and a sander, and now she needs a loan to buy a compressor.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (flashlight, turnip, sweaters, tapestries), and basic materials (fabric, lining, thread and flour)/ COMPRA DE MERCADERIA (focos, nabo, chompas, tapiz) Y MATERIA PRIMA (tela, forro, hilo y harina)

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan Alberto C. M. es un señor de 63 años de edad, quien vive,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Debido a las pocas fuentes de empleo que ofrece la  comunidad, don Juan  se propuso  incursionar como microempresario en el área de la agricultura especializándose en el cultivo de tiquisque, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Cosa Rica como en otros países.

Don Juan  ya tiene experiencia en el cuidado y el mantenimiento que se requiere para esta clase de cultivo, ya que ha sembrado tiquisque anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio su calidad de vida ha mejorado.

En estos momentos don Juan desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del tiquisque.
 
Don Juan es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad
texts.en:
Juan Alberto C. M. is 63 years old and lives in a small rural community in Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala, located in the Alajuela province. There they have businesses, raise cattle (meat and dairy), and grow basic grains such as rice, beans, corn, etc. Because there are few jobs in his community, Juan began as a microbusinessman in agriculture specializing in growing taro, a tuber with a pleasant flavor, rich in nutrients, widely grown and in great demand in Costa Rica as well as other countries. Juan is experienced in the care and maintenance that is required to grow this crop, as he has grown taro before and has had good results at harvest so he wishes to expand his farm. Thanks to this business his quality of life has improved. Today Juan wishes to obtain a loan for ¢300,000 colones to help prepare his land, buy seeds, fertilizer, manure an dother items needed to guarantee an optimum crop of taro. Juan is a member of the Datraban communal bank, onr of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing personally and economically in addition to actively participating in the microloan organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farming supplies

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor 1-3 Group

texts.en:
Dernita J. is a Haitian immigrant who lives in La Caleta, a town in the outskirts of Boca Chica. Boca Chica is known for having white soft sand, and the water is calm, clear and shallow. But tourists don’t normally see those that are trying to survive in the nearby communities. Especially now in the down-turning economy many are left without employment because businesses keep on shutting their doors. Dernita has been able to survive because 13 years ago she started her own business. She sells clothes and basic food products from her house. Currently her colmado sells rice, beans, sugar and flour, but does not sell fruits and vegetables. With this loan she hopes to attract new customers by expanding to also sell fruits and vegetables. 

Prior to 2006, when she was still not an Esperanza client, Dernita realized that a lot of the time when she found herself out of money to re-stock she would borrow money from local lenders. The local lenders charge a 20% interest rate per week! Esperanza charges a 2% declining-balance interest rate every two weeks, 4% a month. Esperanza also helps its clients with complimentary services such as savings account, medical and life insurance, literacy courses, and business management training, just to name a few. 

Please strongly consider loaning to Dernita and her group. She deserves a fair interest rate and an opportunity to grow her business. Esperanza thanks you for your time and consideration.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for home grocery store

loans.name: Carmen Yuli

texts.es:
CARMEN F. M., pertenece  al  Banco  Comunal  “EL ARENAL” su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Ucayali 4ta cuadra Galería “Gran Vía”, su negocio tiene como nombre “ Elisa fashion”, ubicado  en el distrito de Calleria, tiene 46 años, 02 hijos, y su esposo vende repuestos de motos.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos.  La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles (hace 10 años), con éste crédito compró cosméticos que luego vendió a sus vecinos. 

Con este préstamo de S/.2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de pantalones, carteras, blusas, etc.

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, ayudar a su esposo e hijos, y en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the “El Arenal” cooperative bank. Her business is located in the fourth block of the Galeria “Gran Via”. The name of her business is “Elisa Fashion”. It is located in the Calleria district. Carmen is 46 years old. She has two children and her husband sells spare parts for motorcycles. Carmen sells clothes and cosmetics at her shop. The first loan she had was a loan for 300 soles (ten years ago). With this loan she bought cosmetics that she then sold to her neighbors. With this loan of 2,500 New Soles she will buy pants, purses, blouses, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy inventory for her clothing store.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Adilia tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo, quien es comerciante, y con su hija que está estudiando en la universidad. Desde muy joven se involucró en la venta de comida porque apoyaba a su madre en esta actividad, y al fallecer ella, Adilia heredó el puesto en el mercado. Desde entonces, hace 40 años, viene ejerciendo el mismo oficio de su madre, de lo que se siente muy orgullosa. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque dice que “nació para esto”, además tiene una exquisita sazón, pues sus clientes la visitan constantemente para saborear las comidas típicas de su región. Con MFP ya tiene 10 préstamos y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque entre todos sus compañeros se comprenden y pagan sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas regionales y también mandará a ampliar y ambientar adecuadamente su puesto.
texts.en:
Adilia is 55 years old. Her husband is a merchant and her daughter is a university student. Since she was a young woman, Adilia has been selling food because she helped her mother in this line of work. After her mother passed away, Adilia inherited her vending location in the market. She is very proud to have been doing the same work as her mother for 40 years. She enjoys her work because, in her words, she was “born to do this”. She also has a wonderful time being with her customers, who visit her frequently to taste her traditional regional foods.

She has already had 10 previous loans with MFP. Adilia enjoys working with her communal bank group because the members understand each other and pay their installments responsibly. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase the necessary ingredients for making her regional dishes. She also would like to expand her business and create a pleasant environment for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing meals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elia

texts.es:
ELIA C. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “EL ARENAL” vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 34 años de edad, 1 hijo, y su pareja trabaja en el banco de la nación.

Se inició en el negocio de artículos para belleza y perfumes, y la venta por catálogos, y el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró productos para poder mostrarlos.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de perfumes, cosméticos y ropas, que luego venderá  a sus vecinos y amistades.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños prestamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar, o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Elia C. G. is a member of the Community Bank "El Arenal". She lives in the city of Pucallpa. She is 34 years old and has a son. Her partner works at the "La Nacion" bank.

She set out in the business of selling beauty products and perfumes and catalogue sales. Her first loan was in the amont of S/.300 nuevos soles which was invested in the purchase of product samples.

This loan of S/.2000 neuvos soles will be invested in the purchase of perfumes, cosmetics and clothing which will then be resold to her neighbours and friends.

She says, "Manuela Ramos is an NGO that supports a large number of families. Small loans grant women in this region with the ability to start up or improve their businesses. I am so pleased with the support."

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 35 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Para exhibir sus productos tiene una caja de madera donde coloca las golosinas que vende y cada tarde la saca en la parte de afuera de su casa para atraer a sus clientes. Su casa se encuentra frente a un parque, por lo que la concurrencia no le falta y tiene buenas ventas. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 3 años y lo que más le gusta es que se entretiene mientras vende. Adicionalmente, vende bebidas gaseosas y refrescos, y los fines de semana algunos platos de comida, de esta manera logra reunir el dinero necesario para solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Este es su 9no crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que sus compañeros son muy unidos y responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más golosinas y bebidas, también mandará a construir un kiosco para vender con mayor comodidad, que es lo que más quiere.
texts.en:
Betty is 35 years old, she is married and she has 3 children. To exhibit her products she has a wooden box where she places the snacks that she sells. In the afternoons she brings the box out of her the house to attract her clients. Her house faces a park so she has many clients and produces good sales. She has been running her business for the past 3 years, and her favorite part is that she has fun while she carries out her sales. She also sells soft drinks and juices and on the weekends she sells prepared foods. Thsi way she manages to collect enough money to cover the household expenses. This is her 9th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and says that she enjoys working with her group. Her colleagues are a team and they are very responsible. With the funds that she is requesting she will purchase more snacks and drinks. She will also have a kiosk made to better accomodate her business, which is what she wants most.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To resupply her merchandise and to build a kiosk.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 33 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace 10 años compró un motocarro, desde entonces se dedica al transporte de pasajeros por las distintas zonas de su localidad. Adicionalmente, desde hace 2 años tiene un bote a motor, donde cada fin de semana se dedica a la pesca. Carlos está muy contento con sus actividades porque le permiten mantenerse activo, además de administrar sus ganancias diarias para solventar los gastos de su familia. Para un futuro cercano, Carlos quiere tener un taller de mecánica, pues también es aficionado de esta actividad y la considera muy rentable, especialmente en la reparación de motos y motocarros, que son los vehículos que abundan en su región. Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos y a pesar de que algunas veces tiene diferencias con sus compañeros de banco comunal, Carlos permanece con su grupo porque sabe que esas pequeñas discusiones pasan, pero el deseo de progreso de él y de su grupo permanece. Con el dinero que solicita ahora comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro, también adquirirá materiales de pesca para implementar su bote.
texts.en:
Carlos is 33 years old and he lives with his partner and mother of his 3 children. They live in their own home. Ten years ago he purchase a motorcycle car and since then he has been providing taxi services in the different areas of his region. Also, two years ago he got a motorboat and every weekend he fishes. Carlos is very happy with his businesses because they keep him busy and they give him the means to provide for his family. In the near future Carlos wants to set up a mechanic shop because he loves that kind of work and finds it very profitable. He is mostly interested in repairing motorcycles and motorcycle cars, being the most common type of transportation in his region. With MFP (Kiva Field Partner) has has had 3 loans and even though there have been some difference of opinion with his colleages at the Community Bank, Carlos remains with the same gruop because he knows these types of discussions happen. His will for self improvement and the success of the group remains. The funds that he is requesting will be used to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle car. He will also invest in the purchase of fishing gear to use with his boat.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle car and to purchase fishing gear.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
ELIZABETH V. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “EL ARENAL” vive en el Jr. Ricardo Palma en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 43 años de edad, 3 hijos, y su esposo es profesor.

Inició el negocio de comidas por las tardes y noches, tales como Juanes, tacacho, y pescado asado y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, se implemento con una parrilla, e insumos.

La buena atención y carisma que la caracteriza ha hecho que tenga muchos clientes y ha sido necesario incrementar su préstamo.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en ampliar su negocio, y comprará mesas, sillas e insumos para la elaboración de alimentos y todo lo necesario para que su negocio se vea muy bien.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es la única Institución con la que trabaja por los bajos intereses que tiene, y la facilidad que les da al obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth V. D. belongs to the “El Arenal” Communal Bank. She lives on Jr. Ricardo Palma in the city of Pucallpa. She is 43 years old, has three children and her husband is a professor.
She started the business selling meals, such as juanes, tacacho, and pescado asado, in the afternoons and evenings. With her first 300 PEN loan, she set herself up with a grill and ingredients.
Her good service and charisma have attracted many customers and she has had to increase her loan amount. With this 1,700 PEN loan, she will expand her business and purchase tables, chairs, cooking ingredients and everything she needs to make her business look good.
She says that Manuela Ramos is the only institution she works with because they offer low interest rates and make it easy to obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients, tables, chairs and plates.

loans.name: Dianora

texts.es: Dianora tiene 30 años, es soltera y madre de una niña en edad escolar, la casa donde vive es alquilada. Anteriormente vendía golosinas en su casa, pero no tenía buenas ventas por encontrarse en una zona no muy transitada. Sin embargo, hace 2 años, gracias al apoyo de su hermana quien vive a 4 horas de su casa, en un caserío llamado Curimana, Dianora ha mejorado en su negocio. Ahora se dedica a enviar las golosinas a su hermana, quien se encarga de venderlas en su localidad, teniendo ambas un porcentaje de ganancia. Adicionalmente, desde hace 5 años Dianora también vende productos de medicina natural de una marca muy reconocida y por ser éstos muy demandados, puede obtener buenos ingresos económicos. Con este, ya serían 5 los préstamos que viene teniendo con MFP y considera que lo que más le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes son coordinados y muy solidarios. Con el dinero que ahora solicita invertirá en el incremento de la mercadería de sus dos negocios.
texts.en:
Dianora, 30, is a single mother, and she has a school-aged daughter. They live in a rented house. She previously sold sweets in her house, but sales were not good because she does not live in a busy area. Two years ago she received help from her sister, who lives four hours from her house in a village called Curimana. Thanks to this help, Dianora has improved her business. Now she sends the sweets to her sister, who sells them in her area. Both of them get a percentage of the earnings. Also, for the past five years Dianora has also been selling a very well know brand of natural medicines. These are in much demand, and she is able to get good income from them. This will be her fifth loan with MFP. What she likes best about working with her community bank is that all of the members are very supportive, and they work well together. She will use the money she is now asking for to increase the merchandise in both of her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo quien trabaja como mecánico en una empresa maderera, con su hijo de 22 años que es soltero y trabaja, y con su hija menor de 14 años que está estudiando todavía. Ella mandó a construir un pozo en el terreno frente a su casa para contar con agua potable y de donde brinda el servicio de agua por medio de una red tubular a más de 30 familias de su localidad. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 7 años atrás y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta es que no tiene que hacer esfuerzo alguno y solo debe velara por el mantenimiento del pozo. Sus ingresos son mensuales, por cada familia. Posteriormente, Julia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes porque en su zona no cuentan con una. Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP y le gusta trabajar con banco comunal porque no tienen problemas y todos se apoyan ante cualquier problema. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más tubos para abastecer de agua a más familias, lo que le costará 1500 soles, con lo restante adquirirá materiales de construcción para reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julia is 46 years old. She lives with her husband, who works as a mechanic in a lumber business, her 22-year-old son who is single and employed, and her 14-year-old daughter, who is still in school. Julia constructed a well in the area in front of her house in order to obtain potable water. The well functions as a water main and provides service to over 30 local families. One thing she likes about her work is that she doesn't have to exert herself physically; she only needs to oversee the well's maintenance. She is paid monthly per family, and this business has gone well for the past seven years. In the future, Julia hopes to run a grocery store since her area doesn't have one. This is Julia's seventh loan with MFP and she enjoys working with her loan group since they don't have problems with each other and support each other whenever problems do arise. With this loan Julia will buy 1500 soles' worth of tubes to supply more families with water. With the rest she will obtain construction materials to repair her home.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tubes for her well

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
ELOISA O. B., pertenece  al  Banco  Comunal   “LAS CARIBEÑAS” su domicilio esta ubicado en el, Distrito de Calleria, tiene 34 años de edad, 2 hijos, y su esposo es albañil.

Ella  tiene una bodega, el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra de algunos abarrotes, para surtir su bodega.  Desde que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha ido creciendo su negocio cada vez y por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en compra de abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Eloisa O. B. is a member of the communal bank “Las Caribeñas.” She lives in the Calleria district and is the 34-year-old mother of two children. She has a small grocery store and her husband works in construction. Eloisa bought groceries to stock her store with the money from her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300 soles. Her business has been growing since she started working with Manuela Ramos, which is why she now needs a larger loan. She again plans to buy groceries to stock her store with the 2,000 soles she's requesting. Eloisa is grateful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and helps the women of her region.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Flor De Retama Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Flor D. Retama es parte del proyecto Wari, El Banco Comunal inicia su Quinto ciclo con 17 socias. Las socias son del distrito D. Pomacocha, Provincia Acobamba, Departamento D. Huancavelica. Las actividades principales son L. agricultura D. trigo, cebada, arveja y crianza D. animales,
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. abarrotes en general, cereales, animales menores, frutas, comida.

Como es el caso D. Sandra que es L. presidenta del Banco Comunal, Sandra es conviviente tiene 26 años, Sandra tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además prepara chupetes, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 400 soles, 500 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 5,900 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. trigo, cebada, arroz, azúcar, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Flor D. Retama” is part of the Wari project. The bank is starting its fifth cycle and has seventeen members who come from the Pomacocha district, in the Acobamba province of Huancavelica. They mostly make a living by farming wheat, barely, peas, and raising animals. The group’s members have various businesses like: selling groceries, cereals, small animals, fruits, and food. Sandra is the communal bank’s president. She lives with her partner, is 26 years old, and has a small grocery store in her house. She also makes lollipops every day. The members of the group need various loan amounts like 300 soles, 400 soles, 500 soles, and 1000 soles making a total of 5,900 soles. They will invest the loans in buying wheat, barely, rice, sugar, and small animals. The group’s members would like to grow their businesses and hope for their children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat, barely, rice, sugar, and small animals.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia G., de 37 años  de edad, Originaria del Municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, Casada con Octaviano T., tiene 6 hijos solteros, Ella Juntamente con su esposo, están trabajando para el sustento diario, y la superación de sus hijos se dedican a la venta de trajecitos de bebes, en diferentes tallas, lo distribuyen en diferentes talla, lo distribuyen en diferentes mercados municipales, desde hace 5 años, ha venido trabajando, con un capital, muy pequeño durante este año, a podido incrementar su venta en un 20%, por eso necesita, un refinanciamiento.  El sueño es seguir creciendo su negocio, mantener a su familia contentas, y seguir aprovechando, su buena salud, y cuando sea edad avanzada pueda autosostenerse.
texts.en:
Patricia G. is 37 years old and from the the municipality of Tecpan, Guatemala. She is married to Octaviano T. and has 6 sons who are still unmarried. Patricia, together with her husband, is working for her daily livelihood and support of her family in the sale of baby clothes, in different sizes, distributing them in different municipal markets. For the last 5 years she has been working with little capital, although this year she has increased her sales by 20% and because of this she needs refinancing. Her dream is to continue growing her business, keep her family happy, and continue to take advantage of her good health so that when she is older she will be able to sustain herself.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the sale of baby clothes

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús tiene 32 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Su sentido de responsabilidad y ansias de progreso, lo llevaron hace de 5 años a implementar su propia granja de cuyes para tener ingresos adicionales a sus actividades agrícolas. Su esposa es quien está siempre a su lado para ayudarlo en todas estas tareas, ellos crían estos animales para luego venderlos en las ferias ganaderas de su región. Por otro lado, cada 6 meses venden los productos que obtuvieron de su cosecha a los principales mercados de su zona, guardando siempre en su almacén para su consumo personal. Estas arduas labores han hecho que la economía de Jesús sea más sólida y vea con grandes expectativas su futuro, ya que quiere brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación e incrementar las extensiones de sus terrenos y su granja. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito en MFP, le recomendaron trabajar con esta modalidad de préstamos en un banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser una persona responsable en la devolución de su crédito. El monto que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de madera para ampliar su granja de cuyes. También adquirirá productos de primera necesidad, ya que abrirá en su misma casa una tienda de comestibles que estará a cargo de su esposa.
texts.en:
Jesús is 32 years old, and lives with his wife and their 2 children in their own home. Five years ago, his sense of responsibility and anxiety to progress led him to implement his own guinea pig farm to bring in extra income and supplement his farming activities. His wife is always at his side to help with the various tasks. They breed animals and then sell them at the region's livestock fairs. In addition, every 6 months they sell goods from their harvest to major markets in the area, and always keep a portion for their own consumption. Such arduous work has improved Jesús' personal economy, and Jesús sees his future with great expectations. He wants to give his children a good education and increase the area of his land and farm. This is Jesús' first loan with MFP; people recommended that he work with a community bank. Jesús is committed to being a responsible person in the repayment of his debt. The loan he requests will be invested in the purchase of wood to expand his guinea pig farm. He will also acquire essential goods, as he will soon open a grocery store inside his house that his wife will manage.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his guinea pig farm

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Hormiguitas es parte del proyecto Wari, El Banco Comunal inicia su Tercer ciclo con 10 socias. Las socias son de la comunidad de Rumichaca, distrito de Pillpichaca, Provincia de Huaytara, Departamento de Huancavelica. Las actividades principales son la crianza de animales como la alpaca, llama, ovino y actividades de comercio por estar ubicada en la Vía Libertadores – Wari.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de golosinas, ropa, jugos, comidas, joyas, pesado, abarrotes y servicio de hospedaje.

Como es el caso de Lourdes que es casada, tiene 4 hijos, es presidenta del Banco Comunal, Lourdes vende comida, bebidas, golosinas en el puesto de Rumichaka, Además Lourdes tiene un pequeño alojamiento.

Mientras que Mónica es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, Mónica tiene un cafetín en donde vende bebidas, golosinas, además trabaja como cocinera en una institución. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 200 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total de 6,700 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de galletas, chicles, gaseosas, arroz, azucar, leche, aceite.

Los sueños de las socias son mejorar su casa, tener casa propia, sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Hormiguitas" is part of the Wari project. The bank is beginning its 3rd cycle with 10 members. The members come from the Rumichaca community, Pillpichaca district, in the Huaytara Province of the Huancavelica Department. The principal activities are raising animals, such as llamas and sheep, and conducting commercial business in Via Libertadores - Wari. The members each conduct different business, such as hospitality, and selling sweets, clothes, juice, jewelry, fish, and groceries. Such is the case of Lourdes, who is married with 4 children. Lourdes is the president of the communal bank, and sells food, drinks, and sweets at a post in Rumichaka. On the other hand, Monica is a single mother with 3 children. She has a small cafeteria where she sells drinks and sweets. She also works as a cook at an institution. The members need different loan amounts. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of crackers, gum, soft drinks, rice, sugar, milk, and oil. The members' dreams are to improve their houses, or buy their own house, help their children become professional, and improve their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase crackers, gum, soft drinks, rice, sugar, milk, and oil

loans.name: Señor De Ricra Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Señor D. Ricra es parte del proyecto Wari, El Banco Comunal inicia su Sexto ciclo con 18 socias. Las socias son del distrito D. Vinchos, Provincia D. Huamanga, Departamento D. Ayacucho. Las actividades principales son la agricultura y ganadería.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D.  cereales, abarrotes en general, animales menores, pescado y comida

Como es el caso D. Maria Nieves que es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Maria tiene un molino D. granos en donD. brinda servicio D. molienda.

Mientras que Gregoria es conviviente, se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales menores, los animales los compra en las diferentes comunidades y lo comercializa en las ferias D. la región.  

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 400 soles, 800 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 13,800 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. queso, verduras, arroz, azúcar, papa, gaseosas.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The communal bank Señor D. Ricra is part of the Wari project. The bank is beginning its 6th cycle with 18 members. The members come from the Vinchos district of Huamanga Province, in the Ayacucho Departament. Their principal activities are agriculture and livestock. The members have different businesses, such as selling grains, groceries, small animals, fish, and food. Such is the case of Maria Nieves, who is married with 4 children. Maria has a restaurant in her house, where she works every day. She also has a grain mill, where she mills grain for customers. On the other hand, Gregoria lives with her significant other, and buys/sells small animals. She buys the animals in different communities and sells them at regional markets. The members need different loan amounts - such as 300, 400, 800, and 1000 soles - combining for a grand totatl of 13,000 soles. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of cheese, vegetables, rice, sugar, potatoes, and soft drinks. The members' dream are to increase and improve their businesses, and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheese, vegetables, rice, sugar, potatoes, and soft drinks

loans.name: Luisa Eugenia

texts.es:
LUISA F. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS CARIBEÑAS” su negocio esta ubicado dentro del Hospital Amazónico, del distrito de Yarinacocha, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 34 años de edad, 4 hijos, y su esposo es obrero.

Ella se dedica a la venta de libros.  El primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con él adquirió pocos libros y los vendió a precio cómodo, con un margen de ganancia baja, pero eso le ayudo a conseguir muchos clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la  compra de más libros, que está adquiriendo directamente de Lima. 

La ONG. Manuela Ramos me ha apoyado a generar un ingreso más para mi familia, me ha permitido ampliar mi negocio y seguir creciendo y desarrollándome - comentó.
texts.en:
Luisa F. M. belongs to the communal bank "Las Caribenas". Her business is located inside of Amazonico Hospital, in the Yarinacocha district of Pucallpa city. She is 34 years old, and has 4 children with her husband, who is a manual laborer. Luisa sells books for a living. With her first loan of 300 soles, Luisa purchased and re-sold some books, with a low profit margin. However, this helped her attract many clients. With this new loan, Luisa will buy more books directly from Lima. "The NGO Manuela Ramos supported me to generate income for my family, permitted me to increase my business, and helped me grow and develop myself," Luisa commented.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase books

loans.name: Rosa Evila

texts.es:
ROSA B. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS CARIBEÑAS”, con domicilio ubicado en el pasaje 8 de Febrero San Fernando costado del mercado Nº5, en el distrito de Manantay, tiene 43 años de edad, 

                   Ella  tiene 4 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser y poder seguir desarrollando su pequeño negocio. 

                   Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en el arreglo de una máquina de coser y comprará materiales para confeccionar y diseñar todo tipo de ropa.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque nunca alguna entidad financiera le otorgó un crédito; mientras que Manuela Ramos sin tanto papeleo,  confió en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Rosa B. D. belongs to the communal bank "Las Caribenas", with her home located at Passage 8th of February San Fernando, next to Market Nº5, in the Manantay district. Rosa is 43 years old, and has been a member of Manuela Ramos for the past 4 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to maintain her sewing machine, so that Rosa could continue developing her business. With this loan, Rosa will fix another sewing machine, and purchase materials to design and make all types of clothing. Manuela is grateful for Manuela Ramos, because no other financial institution offered her a loan. Manuela Ramos offered her a loan without too much paperwork, and by believing in her, motivated Rosa to be responsible in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials, and repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra G. started selling fish eleven years ago. She lives in the coastal town of Sabana de la Mar in the eastern province of the Dominican Republic and travels an hour and a half on public transportation to sell her fish in the nearest large town of Hato Mayor. She has been selling so much that recently she has been running out of supplies, so she is seeking a loan to increase her inventory so she can sell more. Right now she sells her fish in the streets and it is her dream to run her business from her very own store. 

Help make her dream a reality!

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier G. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP lo cuales fuero para mejorar su vivienda y los pago puntual mente. En esté momento desea poner la losa de concreto al frente de su casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario, para poder comprar el material ya que el se dedica a la construcción en horario adicional a su emplea realizara la mejorar.
      Es por es que está solicitando un préstamo,porque quiere que su familia tengo mejor lugar y seguro donde vivir.
      La persona que nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Agdelina Ortiz quien es la persona que aparece en la foto, ya que el señor Francisco se encontraba trabajando.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Javier G. has already had two credits from FVP which were to improve his home and he repaid them punctually. Now he wishes to put a paving stone in front of his house, but does not have the money necessary to be able to buy the material because he is working on the construction during additional hours he needs to undertake the improvement. It is because of this that he is requesting a loan, because he wants that his family has a better and safer place to live. The person in the photo is his wife, Agdelina Ortiz, because Mr. Francisco was working at the time.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Placing a paving stone in his house

loans.name: Chontaca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chontaca es parte del proyecto Wari, El Banco Comunal inicia su Sexto ciclo con 16 socias. Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Chontaca, del distrito D. Acocro, Provincia D. Huamanga, Departamento D. Ayacucho. Las actividades principales son la agricultura en especial la papa y ganadería.
Como es el caso D. Maria que es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además D. restaurante, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos, los sueños D. Maria son tener un restaurante en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Mientras que HayD. es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, Haydee se dedica a la compra y venta D. cereales, los adquiere en las comunidades y lo venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo, los sueños D. Haydee son tener un molino para procesar los cereales.
texts.en:
The Chontaca Communal Bank is part of the Wari project. The Communal Bank begins its sixth cycle with 16 members. The members belong to the Chontaca community, Acocro district, Huamanga Province, Ayacucho Department. Their main activities are agriculture, in particular potatoes, and livestock raising. Maria, who is married and has 4 children, runs a grocery store from her home in additon to a restaurant; activities which she undertakes with help from her husband and children. She dreams with having a restaurant in the city of Ayacucho. HayD., on the other hand, is in a common-law union and has two children. She buys and sells grains which she gets from the communities and sells in the city of Ayacucho, an activity with which her husband helps. Her dream is to have a mill in which to process the grain.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general store merchandise, grains, small livestock.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
La señora Herlinda M. tiene ya más de un año con su negocio de venta de abarrotes, es la fuente de ingreso para su familia. 
Desea invertir para empezar a vender más verduras y carnes, ya que sus clientes se lo están pidiendo, y ella no quiere perder sus clientes.  
Pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio, portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para que su negocio tenga más ingreso y con el cual pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Herlinda M. has run her grocery store for over a year now; it is the sole source of income for her family. She wants to invest in inventory so that she can sell more vegetables and meats since these are the things her customers are asking for and she wants to keep them satisfied. But, she lacks the necessary capital for this investment and does not want to decapitalize her business, hence the need for this loan so that her business will have increased income with which to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El señor Jaime M. está muy agradecido por el su gran ayuda en el préstamo anterior con el cual comprar la herramienta que necesitaba para que su negocio esté mucho mejor y está dando un buen servicio. 
Nueva mente está solicitando un crédito ya que tiene el deseo de iniciar un negocio de papelería y mercería, ya que tiene una escuela cerca de su casa  y no hay papelería en toda la colonia, pero no cuanta con el capital necesario para la comprar del mercancía e iniciar el nuevo negocio. Y así tendrá más ingresos para su familia ya que sus hijos están estudiando y quieren terminar un carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Mr. Jaime M. is very grateful for the help with the previous loan, which he invested in the purchase of tools needed to provide a better service to his clients. He is requesting a loan to start a stationery business, as his house is located near to a school, and do not have a stationary/ book store in the area. He does not have the capital to start it, and the business will help him to provide for his young children who are in school and wish to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Triunfadoras es parte del proyecto Wari, El Banco Comunal inicia su Sexto ciclo con 20 socias. Las socias son del distrito D. Churcampa, Provincia D. Churcampa, Departamento D. Huancavelica. Las actividades principales son la agricultura en especial y ganadería.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como es el caso D. Paulina que es viuda, tiene 5 hijos, Paulina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, y también venD. en las ferias D. la región, los sueños D. Paulina son ampliar su negocio y tener mas ahorros.
Por otro lado Victoria es casada, tiene 5 hijos, Victoria se dedica al engorD. animales menores, los que son adquiridos en la feria D. la región y luego D. engordarlos los comercializa en su distrito, los sueños D. Victoria son educar a sus hijos y que culminen sus estudios para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
“El Banco communal triunfadoras” a community bank, is part of the Wari project. The community bank began its sixth cycle with 20 members. The members are from the Churcampa District, Huancavelica state. The main activities are agriculture and livestock.

The members are dedicated to different activities such as Paulina who is widowed and has 5 children, Paulina has small grocery shop in her home, and she also sells at fairs in the region. Paulina's dreams are to extend her business and have more savings.

On the other hand Victoria is married and has 5 children, Victoria is dedicated to the livestock business, that she buys at the fair and then sells later in her district. Victoria’s dreams are to give an education to her children and for them to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Roberta Rebeca

texts.es:
La señora María Roberta  tiene ya más de catorce años dedicándose a la venta de artículos de belleza, papelería y juguetes, esté negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que tiene poco tiempo que se quedo viuda y bajo su responsabilidad dos hijas. 
Desea invertir en el negocio la venta de artesanía Mexicana, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir, ya que no quiere descapitalizar el negocio, portal motivo está solicitando un préstamo y planea pagarlo con los ingresos del la nueva inversión que tendrá el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Roberta has been dedicated to the sale of toys, beauty and stationery products for about 14 years. This business is the source of income for her family. She became a widow recently and has two daughters that depend on her. She wants to start selling Mexican crafts, but does not have the capital to invest on it. She is asking for a loan and is planning to pay it back with the new business income.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: San Benito Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Benito inicia su Primer ciclo con 16 socios. 
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. ropa, abarrotes en general, comida, artesanía.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 7,500 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. verduras, arroz, azúcar, papa, gaseosas, ropa variada, pescado.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener un local propio, ampliar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The San Benito Communal Bank is starting its first loan cycle with 16 members.
The members run different businesses, selling clothing, groceries, food and handicrafts.
The members need different loan amounts, like 300 PEN and 600 PEN, making a total of 7,500 PEN in loans from the Communal Bank.
Their loans will be used to purchase vegetables, rice, sugar, potatoes, soft drinks, a variety of clothing and fish.
The members dream of having their own shops, expanding their businesses and their children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, rice, sugar, potatoes, soft drinks, clothing and fish.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel G. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en su anterior crédito, con el cual termino la recamara de sus hijos.
Nueva está solicitando un préstamo para terminar el cuarto que es el de su mama quien vive con ellos, es una persona ya mayor de edad y necesita ciertas necesidades y quiere acondicionarle la recamara lo mejor que se pueda. 
Pero no cuanta con el dinero necesario para terminar el cuarto es por eso que solicita un crédito, el cual pagara con sus ingresos con vigilante y limpieza de una iglesia. 
Las personas que aparecen en la foto son su mama y su hija quienes nos atendieron ya que el señor Miguel se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel G. is very thankful for the lenders' cooperation in his previous loan, with which he completed his children's bedroom. Once again, Miguel is requesting a loan, this time to finish a room for his mother, who lives with Miguel and his family. Because she is of an advanced age, his mother requires certain amenities. Miguel wants prepare the room for her as best he can, but he doesn't have the necessary funds to properly complete the room. It is for this reason that he requests a loan, which he will repay with his income from watching over and cleaning a church. The people who appear in the photo are his mother and his daughter, who stand in place of Miguel since he was at his job when the photo was being taken.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acabados del interior de su casa

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan Pablo de 22 años de edad, es casado, no tiene hijos, labora para el MINED de Santo Tomas desde hace 4 años como docente, su esposa labora como empleada domestica, y lo apoya con los gastos del hogar, esta solicitando su primer credito para levantar una pared para un anexo en su casa, a pesar que son un matrimonio joven desean contar con las condiciones basicas para cuando lleguen los hijos.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is 22 years old, is married and has no kids. He has worked for the MINED of Santo Tomas as a teacher for four years, and his wife works as a maid. She helps him out with the household costs, and is asking for his first loan in order to put up a wall to extend his house. Although they are newly-weds they want to be able to have the baisc conditions for when their kids arrive.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Levantar una pared

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
La señora Petra M. tiene ya mas de tres años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, esté negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Ella desea invertirle al negocio mercancía de papelería y mercería, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que planea, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así su negocio crecerá más y tendrá mas ingreso, y con el cual pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Petra M. has been selling groceries for more than three years now. This business is her family’s source of income.
She wants to buy stationery and haberdashery merchandise for her business, but she does not have the necessary money for this planned investment. This is why she is requesting a loan. This way her business will grow and she will make more income, which she will use to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Aurea Mercedita

texts.en:
Aurea Mercedita B. is 50 years old and from the city of Dipolog. She is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Aurea Mercedita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Aurea Mercedita is just starting this business.

In 2005, Aurea Mercedita joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Aurea Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be her seventh from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Lucrecia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucrecia es soltera, de 45 años de edad, tiene un hijo en edad secundaria, vive en Santo Tomas-Chontales, se desempeña como maestra de multigrados desde hace 18 años, esta solicitando su 4to credito para poder terminar una costruccion en su casa, pues tiene levantadas las paredes, solo falta poner el techo y ademas quiere comprar e instalar los protectores para brindarle mayor seguridad a su casa, pues es el patrimonio que le dejara a su hijo.  Expresa sentirse muy agradecida con el apoyo que AFODENIC le ha brindado, pues con los creditos ha podido ir haciendo su casita.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is single, 45-years-old and has one high school-aged son. She lives in Santo Tomas-Chontales and has worked as a multi-grade teacher for 18 years.
She is requesting her fourth loan to finish construction on her home. Since the walls are in place, she only needs to put up the roof. She also wants to buy and install protective bars to make the house safer, since this is the inheritance she will leave her son.
She says she is very grateful for the support AFODENIC has given her because the loans have enabled her to go about building her little house.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put up a roof and buy protective bars

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen J. is 51 years old and from the city of Dapitan. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clothes and shoes in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Helen joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase construction materials for house repair. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to have a comfortable home in which to live.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla Patricia de 33 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos, labora para el MINED de Santo Tomas como docente desde hace 11 años, esta solicitando su primer credito para la construccion de una tapia, pues con las lluvias el patio de su casa se llena de agua de los patios vecinos, lo que produce zancudos y mucho lodo y quiere evitarse enfermedades.  A pesar que no tiene hijos desea tener comodidades en su casa para cuando los tenga.  Karla es muy trabajadora, responsable y muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo.  Sueña con tener estabilidad laboral, estudiar una especialidad y una casa bonita que tenga las condiciones basicas para vivir.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia is 33, single, and she does not have children. She has worked as a teacher for MINED of Santo Tomas for 11 years. She is asking for her first loan to build a wall. With the rains, her patio fills with water from her neighbors’ patios. This produces mosquitoes and lots of mud. She wants to avoid illnesses. In spite of the fact that she does not have children, she wants to make her house comfortable for when she does have them. Karla is very hard working, responsible, and well liked among her colleagues at work. She dreams of having work stability, studying a specialty, and a pretty house that has the basic living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta F. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Violeta owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling school supplies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Violeta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 42,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her tenth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Remie

texts.en:
Remie D. is from the village of Danao. She is 36 years old. Remie is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Remie owns and operates a fishing business in which she harvests ocean-caught fish and sells them to the local community. Remie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Remie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. 

Remie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Remie's 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda M. is from the village of Puntod. She is 59 years old. Nilda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Nilda cultivates fruit trees, and harvests and sells the fruit. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2000, Nilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to expand the business. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This will be Nilda's 14th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia O. is 54 years old and from the village of Puntod. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clothes and shoes in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2000, Delia joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for use as working capital. Delia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Mrs. Saroeun Chorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of 22 members located in Khnach Khang Tboung village in Takeo Province, and they plan to use the loan for a variety of purposes. Mrs. Saroeun C., the village bank president selected by the members, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. Because her field is currently infertile, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support her field and to buy some piglets for breeding to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Chin Norn, is a sewing machine repairer. Mrs. Saroeun C. is a 51-year-old mother of a construction worker who is also a motorbike taxi driver. 

Twenty-one members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and one has monthly payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor,  allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to support her field and buy some piglets for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Mrs. Din Chin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people living in Khnach Khang Tboung village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Din C. is 27-year-old and the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Rous Ry, is a construction worker. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn little income to support their family. In order to improve their living situation, Mrs. Din C. decided to request a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business. She has three children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study. Mrs. Sok Kea C., Mrs. Saim M., and Mrs. Sok K. do not come to take a loan but their husband are, so their husband are presented in the picture instead.    

Seventeen members in this loan group have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principle on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en: Yeth Y. is a 38-year-old man and ox-trader. He normally goes to buy cows at a reasonable price from people who live in the rural area at the frontier of Phnom Penh. He also fattens cows from his home and will sell them out to farmers to gain income. Another source of daily income for his family comes from his wife, who works in a garment factory. Yeth Y. was married years ago and is blessed with three school-aged children. Yeth Y. will be using the loan to improve his oxen trade and buy a plot of land, and will rent the land out to farmers to gain extra profit.

loans.use: To improve his oxen trade and buy a plot of land

It is now the rainy season and time to plant new crops, but she is unable to do that because she does not have money to buy two oxen to do the plowing. That is why she has decided to apply for a loan to buy oxen. Her husband, Mr. Mork Seak, is a traditional healer and also helps his wife with their planting. Mrs. Soeng Y. is 54 years old and has three children, two of whom are farmers while the third works as a security guard. Her husband is seen here in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to plow her farm
