texts.en:
Justina T. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Justina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Justina operates a business venture in clothing sales. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling clothing in the local community. Justina has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (about $105) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Justina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Justina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Justina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Justina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Veng

texts.en:
The happy woman shown in the photo above is VE. M. E., who is 46 years old and married. She and her husband make a living selling various vegetables in the local market. They earn approximately $7 USD per day to meet the cost of their family’s living expenses.

VE. M. E. is an energetic and determined woman who sent her son to learn the skill of repairing mobile phones. When her son graduated, he intended to use his knowledge to earn money, but he lacked the capital to invest in a business. Therefore, VE. M. E. has decided to seek a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, HKL, in order to buy essential tools for repairing mobile phones so that her son can begin to provide a service.

loans.use: To buy essential tools for repairing mobile phones

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Ken Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-four people who live in Pou village in the Takeo province have formed a village bank loan and they will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Phalla K. is the village bank president. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Aside from this, she is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice. 

Since her rice farm is far from an irrigation system, she needs to use a pump machine to water her crop. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to buy fuel to support her pump, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy it for the aforementioned purpose. Her husband, Mr. Yon Yen, helps her with both businesses.  Mrs. Phalla K. has three children, two of whom are employed in different positions while the other is attending the local school. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term (EoT) loans. Fourteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fuel to support her pump in order to water her field.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Рахматулло Бобобеков проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 41 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. По специальности "шофер". Рахматулло более 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает бахчевые растения. Кредит просит для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Rahmatullo B. lives in teh Kurgan-Tyube district. He is 41 years old, married and has five children. He completed high school. By specialization, he is a driver. For more than five years, Rahmatullo has been involved in farming. In general, he grows melon plants. He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Saret Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of 23 people, is located in Pou village in the Takeo province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Saret C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside frO. this, she also is a pig breeder. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the rice field and to buy more piglets for breeding. She is a widow with three children, two of whO. are studying at the local school, while the other is studying in beauty-salon class.  

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Twenty-one members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the rice field and to buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Allaer

texts.ru: Аллаер Умирзоков проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 36 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. По специальности Аллаер "электрик". Аллаер более 8 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В данный момент он выращивает бахчевые растения. Кредит просит для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en:
36-year-old Allaer U. lives in the Kurgan-Tyurbe district. He is married with six children. By specialization, Allaer is an electrician, however, for more than eight years, he has been involved in farming. At the moment, he grows melon plants. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two grown up children. She owns a retail business and sells various things - dishes, small home products, even car oil! Ludmila has been in this business for thirteen years. Her approach to choosing inventories is simple - if people buy it, I should sell it!

Ludmila would like to borrow 3,050 UAH to increase her assortment. She enjoys her business. It enables her to bring a stable income to her family as well as making her feel independent.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Chim S. is a 34-year-old father of two teenage children who are currently in school. His wife is a garment worker. Since early 1999, he has made a living both planting crops and fishing in and around Tonle Sap Lake. For his fishing business, he wakes up every day early in the morning to prepare his fishing equipment and then after the sun rises he hurries to bring his fish to his regular market retailers.  He sells the fish to them on credit, which means he gets income from his customers after they finish selling. Recently, he hasn't been catching as much fish as before because his tools often break down. Therefore, he would like a loan to buy additional fishing tools for his business. He will use the remainder of loan to grow crops. He and his wife are pictured here.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools.

loans.name: Serozha

texts.en:
Serozha is married with three children. He owns a shoe business where he repairs and makes shoes. He began his business just repairing shoes. Later he began to take orders to make individual shoes as well. Making shoes has become quite a profitable part of his business.

Serozha has been in this business for seventeen years and his monthly net profit is 4,000 UAH. He is a hardworking and responsible person and has a good reputation among his clients. He has many repeat clients that use his services. 

Serozha would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina L. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 36 years old. Regina is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Regina owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products in the local community. Regina has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Regina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from HSPFI. Regina is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Regina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Abudacar

texts.en:
Abudacar is 30 years old and is a native of the Mozambican capital, Maputo. He has been employed as a driver by the ANES organization for the past seven months. He has been a licensed driver for the past six years. Before becoming a driver, Abudacar studied through the 10th grade and then tried his luck at a soccer career but was unsuccessful. 

Abudacar is requesting this loan to help finance the construction of his home. This will be the third loan he has taken out with Hluvuku for this motive. The previous loans have been successfully paid back and put to good use. As a driver, Abudacar receives around MT 3,500.00 a month and is able to save a small amount each month in a savings account at BIM bank. 

Abudacar is married and the father of two children, ages three and six. His wife is employed as a hairdresser. Abudacar's dream is to finish construction of his home and to continue to work to provide better living conditions for his family. 

About housing loans in Mozambique: In rural Mozambique many people still do not live in proper homes. Years of civil war and economic shock have inhibited residents from accessing capital and buying building materials for their homes. The last several years have been relatively prosperous and many residents are using microfinance as a means to commence construction of their home.

loans.use: To purchase construction Materials

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa T. C. is 48 years old and is a native of Guija in Gaza province. She moved from Guija to Boane with her parents when she was a child.

Teresa works in the Boane central market mainly selling produce, her best selling products being onions and potatoes. She is able to buy a sack of potatoes for MT 70 and sell them for MT 110 and buy a sack of onions for MT 80 and sell them for MT 140. She has been working in the market for the past twenty years and originally learned her trade in Swaziland.

Teresa is requesting this loan to help further diversify her products to satisfy customer demand. This will be her second loan with Hluvuku. Her first loan was for MT 10,000. Teresa earns around MT 10,000 a month and is able to set aside money each month in a savings account at the BIM bank.

Teresa studied through the ninth grade but was forced to stop due to pregnancy and the necessity to properly raise her child. She is married to a mechanic and is the mother of four children aged 18, 22, 24 and 26. She also supports two nieces and her mother, to whom she sends remittance payments.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Bartola Audelia

texts.es: Bartola Audelia F. D. L. resiD. en el municipio D. Tonacatepeque en el  departamento D. San Salvador. Bartola tiene 58 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijas que se encuentran estudiando actualmente. Bartola se dedica a la venta D. perfumes hace ya cinco años, pero hace unos meses Bartola tuvo la idea D. ampliar sus ganancias poniendo una tienda en su casa donD. también tendría a la venta sus perfumes D. esta manera Bartola y su familia han ido mejorando en la estabilidad económica, pero el destino del crédito que Bartola solicita es porque desea seguir creciendo con su negocio surtiéndolo con variedad D. bebidas, cereales, detergentes  entre otros; todo esto con el fin que obtener mayores ingresos para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Bartola Audelia F. D. L. resides in the town of Tonacatepeque in the region of San Salvador. Bartola is 58 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and three daughters, all of whom are currently in school. Bartola has worked selling perfumes for the past 5 years, but a few months ago, she had the idea to increase her income by putting a small market in her house, from which she could also sell her perfumes. By doing this, Bartola and her family have been improving their economic stability, however, Bartola still needs to request a loan because she wishes to continue expanding her business, supplying her store with a variety of drinks, cereals, detergents, and other goods. She seeks to grow her business in this way in order to meet her goal of obtaining a higher income for her entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: surtir su negocio

loans.name: Crista Isabel

texts.es: Crista Isabel A. R. reside en el municipio de San Martin en el departamento de San Salvador. Crista tiene 44 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres niños que aun son menores de edad y se encuentran estudiando. Crista posee una panadería hace ya siete años en la cual elabora variedad de pan dulce, que después es comprado por los vecinos de la zona, el deseo de Crista en buscar de una estabilidad económica para sus hijos la han hecho soñar con la idea de distribuir pan a diferentes tiendas de los alrededores y así poder comercializarlo al por mayor y a su vez generar mayor ganancias este sueño solo lo puede ser posible con este crédito ya que Crista no necesita nada más que suficiente materia prima para aumentar su producción de pan para después comercializarlo al por mayor de esta manera sus ganancias e ingresos mejoraran.
texts.en:
Crista Isabel A. R. lives in the Municipality of San Martin in the San Salvador Region. Crista is 44 years old and a single mother of three children who are all still minors attending school.
Crista has owned a bakery for seven years where she makes a variety of sweet breads, which neighbours in the area buy. Looking for economic stability for her children, Crista has been dreaming of the idea of distributing bread to different shops in the area. This way she would be able to sell it wholesale and generate greater profits at the same time.
This dream is only possible with the help of this loan because Crista needs nothing more than enough ingredients to increase her bread production for wholesale. This way her profits and income will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe M. reside en Olocuilta en el departamento de La Paz. Morena tiene 45 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos niños Balmore de 10 años y Emerson de 5 años de edad. Morena posee una pupuseria en la zona de Olocuilta la cual es muy conocida por todos los extranjeros ya que siempre los llevamos a comer nuestro platillo típico, ya que Olocuilta se encuentra situado en la carretera que conduce hacia al aeropuerto de El Salvador, es allí donde los salvadoreños con sus negocios ofrecen variedad de platillos típicos y en su mayoría son las pupusas, es así como Morena y la tradición de las pupusas en El Salvador la han llevado a tener  ya treinta cinco años en su negocio y ahora solicita un crédito porque  desea invertir en su negocio, en la compra de materia prima para las pupusas y así seguir aumentando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe M. lives in Olocuilta in the La Paz region. Morena is 45 years old and a single mother of two children, Balmore, aged 10, and Emerson, aged 5.
Morena owns a pupuseria in Olocuilta, which is well-known among foreigners since we always take them there to eat our traditional food. Olocuilta is located on the road to El Salvador’s airport, and is where Salvadorans run businesses offering a variety of typical dishes and mostly pupusas. This is how El Salvador’s pupusa tradition has already given Morena 35 years of business.
She is now requesting a loan to purchase pupusa ingredients for her business and, in this way, continue to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia E. C. is 37 years old and has lived her entire life in Boane, Mozambique. She was raised by her aunts. Due to the loss of her parents at a young age, Julia never had the opportunity to go to school. For the past 10 years, Julia has been working selling products in the Boane market. She learned her trade from family members. Her best-selling product is used clothes. She is able to buy a bundle of used clothes for 8,000 MZN and sell them for 10,000 MZN. Julia earns around 3,000 MZN a month.

Julia is requesting this loan to be able to offer more products to her clients. She will purchase products that her clients have been requesting, hoping to expand sales. Julia is the mother of four children ages 12, 16, 18, and 20. Three of her four children are currently in school. In the future Julia hopes to be able to build a home that her family can comfortably live in. To facilitate this, she hopes to see continued growth of her business and will continue to take out loans with Hluvuku.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing

loans.name: Carmen Griselda

texts.es: Carmen Griselda A. D. R. resiD. en el municipio D. San Martin del departamento D. San Salvador. Carmen tiene 40 años D. edad vive en casa apropia con su esposo y sus tres hijos todos aun menores D. edad. Carmen recibe el apoyo económico D. su esposo  Alejandro quien es empleado y trabaja como motorista, y ella maneja su propio negocio el cual es una tienda donD. lleva ya seis años D. tenerla, los principales clientes D. Carmen son sus vecinos ya ella posee su negocio en su casa que se encuentra ubicada en la entrada principal D. la colonia donD. también venD. almuerzos todos los días D. esta manera aprovecha la buena ubicación D. su casa que queda a la vista D. muchos, el deseo D. Carmen es aumentar la producción y variedad en sus almuerzos al igual que surtir D. su tienda con productos como arroz, , frijol, detergente, entre otros es por esa razón que ella solicita este crédito.
texts.en:
Carmen Griselda A. D. R. lives in the town of San Martin in the San Salvador district. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three minor children. Carmen receives financial support from her husband, Alejandro, who works as a driver. She has been managing her own business for 6 years. Her main clients are her neighbors. Carmen operates her business out her home, which is located at the main entry to the subdivision. She sells lunches every day, and she is situated in a convenient location where many people can come visit her. Carmen would like to increase her production and expand the variety of her meals, similar to dishes you would find in a restaurant containing rice, beans and other ingredients. This is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & expand her business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna M. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao Camiguin. Lorna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting, harvesting, and selling green bananas. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
  Сурайё 1981 года рождения, замужем имеет троих детей. Она два года занимается продажей продуктов питания на автовокзале «Рохи абрешим» г. Худжанда. Спрос на продукты питания большой, так как сюда приезжают на закупку из районов области. Муж Сурайё работает на Шёлкокомбинате инженером. В свободное время он помогает жене. Она закупает товар у оптовиков с рынка Панчшанбе и у фирм. Сурайё планирует расширить ассортимент своего товара, поэтому обратилась за кредитом в нашу организацию.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Surayo was born in 1981, is married and has three children. She has been selling groceries for two years on the auto depot Rohi abreshim in the town of Khujand. The demand for the groceries is high as a lot of people come there for shopping from other regions in the province. Surayo's husband works on the silk factory as an engineer. During his free time he helps his wife. She buys the stuff from wholesale sellers in the Panschabe market and from companies. Surayo plans to expand the assortment of her merchandise and this is why she has come to our organization to request a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries such as pasta, sugar

loans.name: Alejandro Ortega

texts.es: Alejandro Ortega M.  de 43 años de edad vive en el departamento de  La Libertad junto con su familia compuesta por su esposa y cuatro hijos todos a un menores de edad;Alejandro posee un negocio ubicado en el mercado municipal de Santa Tecla donde vende  variedad de productos como perfumes, shampoo, cremas corporales, pastas de dientes entre otros; el deseo de Alejandro es surtir su negocio para logara aumentar sus ventas ya que él es un pilar en la estabilidad económica de su familia y con este crédito que Alejandro solicita lograra aumentar sus ventas surtiéndolo con los productos que carece y muchos de sus clientes los buscan.
texts.en:
Alejandro Ortega M. is 43 years old and lives in La Libertad district with his wife and four children. He has a business located in the city market of Santa Tecla and sells a variety of products, such as perfumes, shampoos, body crèmes, toothpastes and other items. He hopes to expand his business so as to increase his sales. He is a pillar of financial stability for his family, and with this loan, he hopes to boost his sales by supplying his customers with the products they are looking for and can’t live without.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock his business

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is 44 years old, and she is married with a child. She sells garri in the market. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more garri to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto T. is 53 years old and from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin. He is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ernesto owns and operates a a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services with his vehicle to local community members. Ernesto has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ernesto joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesto is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide a better service to his passengers. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: María Adelfa

texts.es: María Adelfa M. D. A. con  43 años D. edad  resiD. en Barrio La Loma en el departamento D. Cabañas; María vive con hija Lisbeth D. 9 años D. edad y su esposo don José quien le ayuda en el negocio, ya que María se dedica a la distribución D. carnes rojas que son procesadas por ella misma para luego ser comercializadas en el mercado municipal D. Sensuntepeque, los clientes prefieren la carne que María distribuye ya que la califican como carne D. buena calidad y muy fresca, el destino del crédito que María solita es para la compra D. cerdos para el destazo ya que es una carne que tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en:
María Adelfa M. D. A. is 43 years old and resides in the neighborhood of La Loma in the district of Cabañas. She lives with her 9 year old daughter, Lisbeth, and her husband José. María is a meat vendor. She processes the meats in the same location where she sells them in the city market of Sensuntepeque. Her husband assists her with the business.

María’s customers prefer to buy from her because the meat she sells is very fresh and of good quality. She will use her loan to purchase pigs for slaughter because that type of meat is very much in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs for slaughter

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma T. is 31 years old and from the village of Barandiaz, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing and ready-to-wear items to local community members. Alma is just starting this business.

In 2009, Alma joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new additional ready-to-wear items for sale. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ready-to-wear items for sale

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мастура торгует на рынке Панчшанбе  маслом разных сортов. Ей масло поставляют фирмы и поставщики. В период кредитования она расширила ассортимент своего товара и увеличила свой бизнес. Для того чтобы сохранить продукт ей необходимо приобрести холодильник витрину. Мастура очень благодарна за поддержку малого бизнеса
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mastura sells different kinds of butter on the Panschabe market. She gets the butter from suppliers and also direct from manufacturers. During her credit history she has expanded the assortment of her merchandise and expanded her business. She needs to buy a display refrigerator so that she can keep the butter for long periods. Mastura is very thankful for the support of the small business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a display refrigerator

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek P., 25, has been raising pigs for sale in her village in Siem Reap Province since 2003. She earns a typical income of $3 USD per day. P. is married and lives with her husband, who also raises pigs. With his other jobs, he is able to generate $5 USD per day typically. They are blessed with two young children who do not yet attend school.

Traditional Cambodian agricultural methods require hard work and a long time investment to produce the best output and a competitive price at market. P. wants to take a loan of $200 USD for the first time from Kiva partner, CREDIT, to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. She wants to save her income for her children’s education and expanding her current business.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam K., 30, is a housewife and has two school-aged children. She lives in Seim Reap province, where it is favorable for her husband to operate a business as a Tuk Tuk (three-wheeled motorized taxi) driver for tourists. Besides being a Tuk Tuk driver, her husband is also a local soldier in his province. He typically earns around $5-7 per day as the primary source of income for his family. 

K. wants to take a loan of $500 to repair her house in order to make living much more comfortable for her children and the whole family. Her perspective is that she wants to have an additional business of selling groceries when she has enough money from saving her husband’s income.

loans.use: Buying contruction materials to repair the house

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth O. is 40 years old and she is married with four children. She sells provisions and drinks. She hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Chourb

texts.en:
Chourb S., 33, has been involved in a business producing raw materials for making Cambodian traditional mats since 1990, and she typically earns around US $3 per day. The Cambodian method of producing these tools requires hard work and a long time to produce the best outputs for a competitive price at the markets.

S. is married and lives with her husband who has been a motorbike retailer since 1990 with a typical income of US $5 per day. S. wants to take a loan of US $500 from Kiva partner CREDIT, to purchase a motorbike for her brother to operate a business as a motor-taxi driver. This is the first time S. has obtained a loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her brother's business

loans.name: Solihon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Турсунов Солихон 1954 года рождения. Женат, имеет двоих детей  и двоих внуков. Занимается куплей и продажей скота. Жена работает няней в детском саду. Они откармливают крупно рогатый скот дома, а потом продают на скотном рынке. Так же у них есть сезонный дополнительный заработок, они производят сахар-рафинад и сдают оптом клиентам на рынке. В этом ему помогают сын и невестка. Солихон хочет за счет займа увеличить количество поголовье скота и получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Solihon T. was born in 1954. He is married and has two children and two grandchildren. He buys and sells cattle. His wife works as a nanny in a kindergarten. They both grow large cattle at home and then sell it on the livestock market. They also have additional seasonal income, they produce sugar and sell it in wholesale on the market. Their son and daughter in law help him in this. Solihon wants to use the loan to increase the number of cattle and make more profit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn N., 28, has been involved in a business of selling vegetables and farming with a typical income of US $2 per day since 2000 in her village in Seim Reap province. N. is married and lives with her husband and four school-aged children. Her husband has to leave his village and go to the town to work hard every day as a construction builder for a typical income of US $4 per day to support his family.

Since her children find it hard to travel long distances to school on foot, N. wants to take a loan of US $200 for the first time from Kiva partner, CREDIT to purchase three bicycles for all of her children. By doing this, her children will be able to travel to school much easier and faster.

loans.use: buying three bicycles

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en: Modupe O. is 38 years old and she is married with 6 children. She sells provisions. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay N., 29, has been working as a rice farmer with a typical income of US $3 per day since 2000 in her village in Seim Reap province. Cambodian farming methods require hard work and a long time to produce the best output for competitive prices at the market.

N. is married and lives with her husband who is a gardener with a typical income of US $5 per day. She has five children; three of her children have attended a local primary school.

N. wants to take a loan of US $1000 as her second time receiving a loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT, to purchase fertilizer for her farming business, and with aN. remainder, she wants to pay off the money she borrowed from her relatives for her grand-father’s funeral.

Her perspective is that she wants to produce more rice from the fertilizer she will buy. Then she will be able to have adequate rice for the family’s use and for sale next year.

loans.use: buying fertilizer

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina B. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 67 years old. Peregrina is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Peregrina owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing dress-making services to local community members. Peregrina has been engaged in her business for over 45 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Peregrina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Peregrina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Peregrina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Peregrina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph O. is 62 years old and he is married with 8 children. He sells drinks wholesale and retail. He hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou T. is from the town of Aloran. She is 30 years old. Marilou is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates an eatery business in the food sector operating a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving local foods to customers in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Marilou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Marilou from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Bouy

texts.en:
Bouy S. is 40 years old and lives in Seim Reap Province. S. and her husband are working hard to ensure a comfortable life for their five school-aged children. She has been involved in a business of cleaning houses of the people in her town with a typical income of US $2 per day to cover her family expenses. Her husband is a construction worker who always has to work hard every day in the town, earning US $3 per day.

To overcome the hardship of their current living situation and support their 5 children, S. and her husband have spent their time tirelessly at work and other businesses that are able to generate a fair income. Due to the situation of her old house, she wants to take a loan of US $600 to buy wood to repair it. She thinks that her expected new house will be able to provide safety for her children who stay at home, and she will not worry so much about them when she is far away with her business.

loans.use: buying to wood to repair their house

loans.name: Siprina Atieno

texts.en:
Siprina A. is a 49-year-old widowed lady. She has six children; the oldest is 21 years old, and the youngest is aged 10 and in the fourth grade at school. Siprina lives in Sodom in Kangemi, which is a very highly populated peri-urban area on the outskirts of Nairobi.

Siprina has a second-hand clothes business, which she has been operating for the last four years. She operates from a temporary stall along a busy road. Most of her customers are passers-by.

She was introduced to KADET by friends who were already KADET clients. So far, she has paid back one loan successfully and this will be her second loan.

Siprina's business is small so she desires to add more stock and increase her trade, hopefully at a higher profit margin. She plans to use this loan to buy more used clothes to resell at her stall.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for a second-hand clothing stall

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Косимова Мунира 1975 года рождения, имеет одного ребенка. 9лет торгует на рынке «Джума-базар» и Матчинский район. Она торгует мужской одеждой. Мунира товар закупает на оптовом рынке г. Истаравшан. Муж мастер строительных работ. Свободное время помогает жене в бизнесе. Мунира хочет увеличить свой товарооборот и ассортимент в школьный сезон. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить сорочки и брюки подросткового возраста.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Munira K. was born in 1975, she has one child. She has been selling on the Djuma-bazar market and in the Matchinskiy region for nine years. She sells men's clothing. Munira buys the merchandise on the wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Her husband is a construction worker. He helps his wife with the business in his free time. Munira wants to increase her inventory turnover and the assortment for school season. She wants to use the requested loan to buy shirts and pants for teenagers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts and pants

loans.name: Seav

texts.en:
Seav S. is 30 years old and lives in Seim Reap Province. S. and her husband are working hard to ensure a comfortable life for their two school-aged children. She has been involved in a grocery business at her home since 2005 with a typical income of US $5 per day which is the primary income for her household. Her husband is a traffic police officer who works in Seim Reap Town, earning US $3 per day.

S. really wants take a loan of US $1000 to buy construction materials to repair her house and build a new grocery shop which is convenient and attractive for her customers. If she succeeds with her business plan, she will send her children to study at a good school for their higher education.

loans.use: construction materials

Since some of the members in her family are still jobless, M. wants to take a loan of US $300 to purchase a motorbike to operate another business for her children.

Her perspective is that she will purchase another motorbike as a M. of transporting her goods from the markets to deliver directly to the people in her village and the nearby places with a fairly profitable price. (M. was not available, so one of her children is present in the picture instead, with his motorbike for his business.)

loans.name: Kuanputun A2 Group

texts.en:
Kuanputun A2 Group is a group of 8 farmers in Bone Village, Nekamese Sub District – Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. Bone Village is situated about one and a half hours' drive from Kupang City. Most of the community living in Bone Village have a background as farmers who always lean on agricultural products for supporting their family. Only a small number of the community lean on husbandry for meeting their family needs as it needs a big capital.

This group is part of a larger group of 15 cattle farmers. Due to recent devaluation of the Indonesian Rupiah, the group had to be split into 2 smaller groups to keep the loan size within the limit of $5,000 per group loan. Due to the remote location of the village, the partner was not able to re-visit the group for new pictures and an interview with a second group leader. The original photo has been split in half and the group leader mentioned is in the second sub-group currently fundraising on Kiva.

The community in Bone village usually consumes corn and cassava as their main food. They sell agricultural products such as bananas and coconuts in Inpres Market, which is situated about 37 km from Bone Village. The challenge for the community in this village is the availability of public transport to help them reach the market. The public transport only operates on Monday, Wednesday and Saturday and there is no local market available in this village so it is quite difficult for the community to sell their agricultural products.

Kuanputun A is led by a 34-year-old farmer – Simson N.. Simson was born and grew up in Bone Village. He is a married man with 3 children. They are Dian N. 6 years old - in the first grade of Elementary School, Andhika N. 3 years old, and Alfian N., 1 year old.

As a farmer, Simson spends his days cultivating the farm. He plants peanuts, cassava, vegetables, coconuts and bananas on the farm. His family always relies on the agricultural products in meeting their daily needs. Simson’s wife also helps Simson by selling their agricultural produce but they only generate a meager income so Simson has difficulty covering the children’s education fees and their daily needs.

Just the same as the other community where the people have difficulty selling their agricultural products because of lacking transportation, Simson also faces the same problem. This difficulty has driven Simson to find another way to support his family.

The Cattle Fattening program becomes a preference for Simson to support his family, as it will benefit him after fattening the cattle for a certain period. Simson and the neighbors were really excited when they heard about the TLM cattle fattening program. Simson and his neighbors then decided to form a group to receive a loan so they can buy young cattle to be fattened. They are really interested in joining this program because the price of cattle is quite expensive in the market. They are sure the profits that will be generated from this program will help them cover the family's daily needs. They hope the loan will help them to improve their living standard and provide a bright future for their children.

Note: Yesaya and Matias were replaced by their family members when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Kuanputun A1 Group

texts.en:
Kuanputun A1 Group is a group of 7 farmers in Bone Village, Nekamese Sub District – Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. Bone Village is situated about one and a half hours drive from Kupang City. Most of community living in Bone Village have a background as farmers who depend on agricultural products to support their family life. A  small number in the community depend on husbandry in meeting their family needs as it requires a large amount of capital.

This group is part of a larger group of 15 cattle farmers. Due to the recent devaluation of the Indonesian Rupiah, the group had to be split into 2 smaller groups to keep the loan size within the limit of $5,000 per group loan. Due to the remote location of the village, the partner was not able to re-visit the group for new pictures. The original photo has been split in half.

The community in Bone village usually consumes corn and cassava as their main food. They sell agricultural products such as bananas and coconuts at the market in the town of Inpres, which is situated about 37 km from Bone Village. The challenge for the community in this village is the availability of public transport to help them reach the market. The public transport only operates on Monday, Wednesday and Saturday and there is no local market available in this village so it is quite difficult for the community to sell their agricultural products.

Kuanputun A is led by a 34 year old farmer – Simson N.. Simson was born and grew up in Bone Village. He is a married man with 3 children; Dian N., 6 years old is in the first grade of Elementary School, Andhika N. is 3 years old and Alfian N. is 1 year old.

As a farmer, Simson spends his days cultivating the farm. He plants peanuts, cassavas, vegetables, coconuts and bananas. His family has always relied on the agricultural products to meet their daily needs. Simson’s wife also helps by selling their agricultural products but they generate only a small income, so Simson has difficulty to finance the children’s education fees and their daily needs.

Simson also faces the same difficulty as the rest of the community, the difficulty of selling their agricultural products inspite of the transportation problem. This difficulty has driven Simson to find another way to support his family life. 

Simson has chosen The Cattle Fattening program to increase his income to support his family life. Simson and his neighbors were really excited when they heard about the TLM cattle fattening program. Simson and his neighbors decided to form a group to receive a loan so they could buy a number of young cattle to be fattened. They are really interested in joining this program because the selling price of cattle is quite high in the market. They are sure that the profits that will be generated from this program will help them meet the familiies daily needs. They hope the loan will help them to improve their living standard and provide a bright future for their children.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
D. Farhod is 27 years old. He is married with three children. Farhod produces the “tandir”- the traditional Tajik oven for baking the national bread “lepeshka”. All the national breads are cooked in “tandir” as it is tastier. He learned this type of business from his father. He has been in this business for 5 years already. 

Over these years Farhod became a real expert in his business and has a lot of customers. Since Farhod has a lot of demand, the business is very successful and brings in a stable and significant income allowing him to improve the living conditions of his family. Now Farhod has a big order for producing the “tandir”. 

Thus taking the chance today, he is requesting a loan of 1000 US Dollars to purchase the input materials for production of the “tandir”. Farhod is counting on your help and he sincerely thanks to everyone for supporting him.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing input materials for production of the “tandir” for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Хаитов Сафарали проживает в Вахшском районе. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Сафарали по специальности "строитель". Он более 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Клиент  просит кредит, для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян риса, т.к. он выращивает рис.
texts.en:
46-year-old Safarali H. lives in the Vahshskom district. He is married and has seven children. While Safarali's specialization is as a construction worker, he has been engaged in farming for more than ten years. The client is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for rice plants.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
Maruf has a successful business selling foodstuffs at a market in Penjikent, Tajikistan. He started his business about 6 years ago, after evaluating different business possibilities and deciding this would be the best option and something he would enjoy.

Maruf purchases his products at very low prices and is then able to resell them for a profit. Because he sells in bulk amounts, he deals with a high inventory turnover rate. Maruf rents a very good location at the market for his business and he has a small amount of competition.

He has requested a loan of 1200 USD to increase his business capital. This loan will give him the ability to purchase more products to sell, enabling him to increase his profit and continue operating a profitable business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buying confectionary and fodder for animals

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina had been raising livestock in her backyard for ten years now. She had an initial capital of Php 3,000 coming from her own savings. Catalina is so fortunate to have this kind of business because through the profit this business generated, all of her children have reached college and have have graduated from their chosen course. One, her youngest, is still in college. Her eldest who is a pharmacist works abroad and sometimes sends her money for the education of her youngest daughter. Three of her children have established their own families and Catalina has less to worry about, now that all of them have their own stable jobs.

Despite Catalina's age which is 62, the same as the age of her husband Raul, she doesn't want to let go of her business. Instead, she wishes that it would grow and can be inherited by her children. Believing in her capacity to run the business, she wantsto be independent from all of her children.

Catalina has already taken several steps towards the achievement of her dreams since she joined ASHI and has the opportunity of borrowing. She has performed well with ASHI in her past loans and therefore, ASHI qualifies her to borrow bigger amounts for additional business capital. With the profit she will be getting now with her business, she will no longer depend on her eldest daughter's remittances for her youngest daughter's education.

loans.use: buying three piglets, feed for pigs, medicines, chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma H. is from the village of Barandiaz, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Gemma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling pigs or pork in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Сайдалиев Муродали проживает в Вахшском районе. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. По специальности Муродали "строитель". Но в данный момент он занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает мелкий рогатый скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
35-year-old Murodali S. lives in the Vahshskom district. He is a married father of three. While he is a construction work by specialization, at the moment he is involved in raising livestock. He cares for and sells small horned animals (goats, sheep, etc.). The loan is to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small horned animals (goats, sheep, etc.)

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Фотима больше года кредитуется в нашей организации. Она занимается продажей женской одежды. Раньше она ездила продавать свой товар в Матчинский район и закупала товар на оптовом рынке г. Истаравшана. После кредитования она целенаправленно используя займ, увеличила товарооборот и стала ездить в Бишкек за качественными товарами. Сейчас она торгует в магазине «Бадри Мунир» г. Худжанда и имеет много покупателей. На запрашиваемую сумму Фотима хочет купить   летние женские платья, блузки, юбки и т.д.
texts.en:
Fotima has been a client of our organization for over a year. She sells women's clothing. Previously, Fotima went to sell her merchandise in the Mastchoh district and purchased the goods at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. After obtaining credit and using it purposefully, she increased her goods turnover and started going to Bishkek to get better quality merchandise. She currently sells at the Badri Munir store in the city of Khujand and has many customers. Fotima wants to use this loan to purchase women's summer dresses, blouses, skirts and etc.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's summer clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and poultry food

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. is from the village of Barandiaz, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and as supplement income for the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Faizali

texts.ru: Файзали Камолов проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 32 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Файзали более 18 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота. На полученную прибыль хочет до конца отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
32-year-oldFaizali K. lives in the Yavan district with his wife and six children. For more than 18 years, Faizali has been engaged in raising livestock. He tends to and sells livestock. The loan he requested is to purchase additional livestock. With the profits of his work, he hopes to finish renovations to his home.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Samuel Kiprugut

texts.en:
Samuel A K. is 57 years old, and married to Leah with whom he has six children. His business is located along Eldoret along Moi University Road at Lelmoluk Center in Eldoret Town.

Samuel has been in the retail business for the past seven years, selling food and household goods. He intends to use this loan to buy bags of sugar, rice, and cartons of bar soap. Samuel was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a KADET client.

In future, he hopes to diversify his operation to a wholesale business, and buy a plot and build a permanent house for his family to live in.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar, baking flour, rice, and cartons of bar soap

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima is the daughter of M. N..  She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and she is married with 4 children.  She works as a vaccinator for a children's health institute.  She wants to take a loan of 50000 Afghani and she is very happy about this lending process so she can secure a loan that she will use to help solve some of her problems.

loans.use: For buying materials.

loans.name: Leah Waihuini

texts.en:
Leah T. is a single mother of a 13-year-old girl. Her daughter is in high school. She runs a beauty salon in Naivasha Town in the Rift Valley province of Kenya.

This is Leah's second loan with KADET. She intends to buy a new hair dryer and also restock the hair products she uses from the proceeds of this loan.

Her dream is to one day open a hairdressing and beauty school. This will enable her to give the opportunity of learning to those who could not qualify for a university education but have a passion and talent in hairdressing and beauty.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and hair products and to buy a new hair dryer

loans.name: Sodik

texts.en:
A. Sodik works in agriculture. For this, he leaves his home to head for his distant farmlands that he must care for and fertilize at certain times. He has been farming for the past 20 years. He learned all the secrets and experiences of farming from his father. He tells us that, beyond the hard work he does for the good of his family. Sodik is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants with the goal that, in the coming harvest, he will have high quality and profitable products. Sodik hopes that you can meet his request for the good of his agricultural production.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Reina De Jesús

texts.es: Reina D. Jesús C. D. M. con 36 años D. edad resiD. en Atiquizaya ubicado en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Reina vive con su suegro Don Oliveno D. 82 años D. edad, su hija Delmi y su esposo Fausto quien le ayuda en el negocio. Reina tiene una tienda en su casa donD. venD. variedad D. productos D. consumo y tiene 14 años D. tenerla. Delmi y su esposo dependen D. su negocio ya que es el único medio con el cual generan todo el ingreso económico para la familia es por eso que solicitan un crédito para seguir haciendo crecer su tienda, surtiéndola D. variedad D. productos con los cuales ningún cliente saldrá insatisfecho D. su negocio ya que todo lo encontraran allí.
texts.en:
36-year-old Reina D. Jesús C. D. M. lives in Atiquizaya in the Ahuachapán region. Reina lives with her 82-year-old father-in-law Don Oliveno, her daughter Delmi and her husband Fausto who helps her with the business.
Reina has run a shop out of her home for 14 years selling a variety of consumer products. Delmi and her husband depend on her business because it is the only way they generate the family income.
This is why they are requesting a loan to continue growing the store. They will stock a variety of products that will leave no client unsatisfied since they will find everything there.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en: Bolale lives in Lagos State and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. These loans have increased her peppers, tomatoes and onions business and also her profitability. Bolale has been in this business for the past 20 years and she has been able to use her experience to retain her customers thereby increasing her sales. Bolale is 42 years old and married with 3 children. Bolale hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more peppers, tomatoes and onions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more peppers, tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Mutabar G. is 52 years old, an admirable mother and widow  She has shown a great enthusiasm for agricultural work and raising cattle. These activities have provided an education for her children. She continues to strive towards providing the well-being and education for her children and also towards being able to cover the expenses that her delicate health demands.. As a result of this, her work has been very limited, and her profits have decreased notably.  Mutabar would like to increase the quality of her produce with the purchase of fertilizers with the goal of obtaining a larger income to continue the children's education and improve their living condition. She is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni, which she will use to make her plans a reality.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose U. is 42 years old and married with four children who are in school. Rose sells paint, using her profit to support her husband in taking care of the family. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more paint to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more paint to sell

loans.name: Obid

texts.en:
M. Obid is 40 years old and married with four children. He is a farmer who grows potatoes, something he has done for six years. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most. For Obid, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. Now he wants to borrow money for purchasing seeds and fertilizer for his crop. This is the first loan for Obid from IMON International and he promises to repay the loan in time without any violations.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy I. is 43 years old and married with three children. Joy sells bags, shoes and jewelery. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more jewelery, bags and shoes to sell so that she can supply her increasing number of customers and make more profit.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelery, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta Lidia C. D. S. D. 60 años D. edad resiD. en  Atiquizaya ubicado en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Marta vive solamente con su hermano Francisco D. 66 años D. edad, Marta posee una tienda D. productos D. consumo dentro D. su casa  donD. obtiene buenas ganancias, también confecciona cojines, set D. fundas para el baño los cuales son muy solicitados por sus clientes, pero el crédito que solita Marta es para su tienda ya que desea surtirla con granos básicos.
texts.en:
Marta Lidia C. D. Sanchez is 60 years old and lives in Atiquizaya, which is in the Ahuachapan department, with her 66-year-old brother, Francisco. Marta runs a grocery store from her home from which she makes good profits. She also makes cushions and bathroom linen sets, which are highly prized by her customers. However, the purpose of the loan she is requesting is to stock her store with basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains for her store.

loans.name: Suyar

texts.en:
M. Suyar has a responsibility that makes him work hard for improvement. He is farmer. He grows onions and potatoes. He is hopeful of making progress with this work to provide what is necessary for his family's needs. For that reason, he wants to invest in his production, expand his crop fields and improve the quality of his products. 

Suyar knows that if he takes care of his land and works diligently he will reap excellent products that will have a better reception in the marketplace. The request Suyar makes is to purchase fertilizers necessary for his land. Support this hardworking man so his effort is worthwhile.
