loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Blanca Irma

texts.es: Blanca Irma C. L. de 51 años de edad reside en el municipio de Ilopango en el departamento de San Salvador. Blanca vive en casa propia con su hija Susana quien es empleada y su nieto de 15 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando; Blanca posee un negocio, es una librería y tienda , con tres años de experiencia en los mismos, la ubicación en la que Blanca tiene su negocio le ayuda a vender más rápido sus productos  ya que se encuentra cerca de un instituto nacional y dos colegios de esta manera la afluencia de jóvenes estudiantes por el negocio de Blanca es grande, es por eso que Blanca desea surtir su negocio para la compra de artículos para su librería y tienda.
texts.en:
Blanca Irma Ceo L. is 51 years old and lives in the municipality of Ilopango, San Salvador department. She shares her own home with her daughter Susana who is employed and her 15-year-old grandson, who is a student. Blanca runs a combination general and book store which she has had for the past 3 years. Her location is very appropriate for her kind of business since she is located close to a national institute and two high schools thereby having a large number of students who are her customers. This is why Blanca wishes to increase the stock of goods in her book and general store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en: T. Ibrohim is married and is the father of four children. He works as a farmer everyday. He has a good work ethic and has whole-heartedly committed himself to agriculture. Thanks to his hard work, he has today become a man known for his determination and serves as an example and reference for other farmers. Ibrohim has been growing onions and potatoes for the past eleven years. He is now seeking a loan of 3,000 USD to buy seeds and fertilizer in the hope of producing a good harvest at the end of the season. He can then better meet the needs of his family and improve his working conditions. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anabetty

texts.es: AnaBetty U. G. de 39 años de edad reside en Santa Tecla en el departamento de La Libertad. AnaBetty vive con su esposo quien trabaja en la venta de ropa de manera ambulante  y sus tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando. AnaBetty posee un negocio en el mercado central de San Salvador donde vende variedad de vestidos para ocasiones especiales como fiesta rosa (15 años), primera comunión, boda, entre otros; también ofrece variedad de accesorios de decoración para el cabello o para los mismos vestidos, el destino del crédito que solicita AnaBetty es para la compra de accesorios y vestidos para comercializar en su negocio.
texts.en:
AnaBetty U. Garcia is 39 years old and lives in Santa Tecla in the La Libertad department. AnaBetty lives with her husband, who works as an itinerant clothing salesman, and her three children, who are still students. AnaBetty has a stall in the San Salvador central market where she sells dresses for special occasions like first communions, weddings, quinceanera, etc. as well as a variety of items designed to adorn hairdos or the dresses themselves. The loan she is requesting is to purchase accessories and dresses to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stock.

loans.name: Salohidin

texts.en: Since he was young, Salohidin has known work. His parents taught him how be successful as an farmer, and he learned very well. Now that he is father, he still works as an farmer. Thanks to his parents, Salohidin now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer, and he hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can bring his loved ones a more promising life. Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs. They are very expensive, but without them his production will not improve. You can help Salohidin keep moving forward with his development plans. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Temitope

texts.en:
Temitope is 42 years old and married with five children. She sells kerosene from a tank, and she makes a huge profit from the business.

Temitope is requesting the loan of N150,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Odildjon

texts.en:
Z. Odildjon is 33 years old. He is married and has two children. Odildjon is a very diligent and hardworking man. With his car, he is providing taxi services. For the last 3 years, this business has been the main income for the family, allowing Odildjon to improve the living conditions of his large family. Along with his wife and children, he is also supporting his mother and brother. As any business generating income, the business of Odildjon also requires some investments from time to time. Thus, his car needs some fixing. For this purpose, Odildjon requests 1,500 USD for purchasing spare parts. Odildjon promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

Tajikistan:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Thorough fixing of the vehicle used for providing taxi services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle food

loans.name: Aziza Group

texts.en: Aziza is the group leader of Aziza group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to help grow their business so they are requesting a group loan in the amount of 44100 Afghani.  Aziza will use the loan for her check-up room. Norui wants to use the loan for her echocardiography business.  Bibi Gul will use the loan for her carpet weaving business. They are very happy about this lending process being in Afghanistan and around the world.

loans.use: To grow their businesses.

loans.name: Motunrayo

texts.en: Motunrayo is 36 years old and married with 4 children; she sells palm kernel oil, rechargeable phone cards and provisions. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm kernel oil, rechargeable phone cards and provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel oil, rechargeable phone cards and provisions to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en: James O. is 52 years old and married with 6 children who are in school. He has a small crushing machine which he uses to crush palm kernels and filter out the oil in them, which is use in making (hair) pomade and other things. The palm kernel chaff is use for making cakes and livestock feed. He is requesting for the loan to purchase more palm kernels for his business so as to make more profits and take good care of his family. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels for production

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан Камолов проживает в городе Явана. Возраст 59 лет. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Хасан по специальности "зоотехник". Его сын работает в России. Хасан более 40 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот на рынке. Ему в этом помогает младший сын. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
59-year-old Hasan K. lives in the city of Yavan. He is married and has eight children. By specialization, Hasan is a veterinarian. His son works in Russia. For more than 40 years, Hasan has been raising livestock. He cares for and sells cattle in the market. In this way, he is able to help his young sons. The loan requested will be used to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget O. is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children. She sells clay pots, made by people in the region, in the market. She hopes for the loan amount to purchase more pots to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more native pots to sell

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en: Magdaline is 35 years old. She is married with 4 children. She is a tailor. She hopes for the loan to purchase more tailoring materials. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She sells sarongs in the market. She hopes for the loan amount to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all her Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy Y. is 40 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Busayo

texts.en: Busayo is 30 years old and married with a child who is in school and doing well. Busayo sells drinks. She is requesting for the loan amount to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She has a provisions shop. She hopes for the loan amount to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 31 years old and she is married with 3 children. She sells sarongs and she is also a tailor. She hopes for the loan amount 0 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Кодирова Рано 1968 года рождения, замужем мать троих детей. Рано 22 лет занимается национальной вышивкой, она вышивает на платьях  золотыми нитями разные виды цветов, что придает платью красивый, нарядный вид. Так же у неё много учеников, которых она учит вышивать. Эти наряды пользуются большим спросом у женщин нашего менталитета . На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить разноцветные нити и благодарит кредиторов за поддержку.
texts.en:
Born in 1968, Rano K. is married and is a mother of three children. Rano has been doing traditional embroidery for 22 years. Using gold thread, she embroiders various types of flowers on dresses, which gives dresses beautiful and elegant looks. Rano also has many apprentices, whom she teaches embroidery. The outfits are in high demand among women in our culture. Rano wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase colorful threads and thanks creditors for the support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of colorful threads

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo is 46 years old and married with 3 children; she has a shop where she sells clothes and shoes. She is requesting for the loan to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nakasero East Namboze Kevin Group

texts.en: N. Kevin is a married twenty-five-year-old lady blessed with two children going to school. She is the group leader of Nakasero East and has a restaurant which has been operating for more than four years. She is planning to use the loan to purchase restaurant items, such as food (bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, sauce, meat, fish, vegetables, ground nuts, etc.). She is an active businesswoman whose dream is to enlarge her business.

loans.use: Purchasing restaurant supplies

loans.name: Eshmatkhoja

texts.en: P. Eshmatkhoja is 50 years old, married and, together with his wife, they have four children. Eshmatkhoja runs the family business, which is a convenience store that sells all kinds of much-needed items like oil, sugar, tea, coffee macaroni and many others. He's been doing this business for more than nine years. Eshmatkhoja says that the business is going very well and is generating good earnings. And now he's planning on selling larger quantities of all kinds of drinks like soft drinks, juices and beer, since in summer demand for cold drinks will rise considerably. The loan he's requesting well help him to meet this goal. loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of all kinds of drinks

loans.name: Ziyorat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”

Норматова Зиёрат 1960 года рождения, замужем имеет четверых детей. Её муж работает в Российской Федерации и каждый месяц высылает ей деньги. Сама Зиёрат работает диспетчером Худжанской городской электро сети. У Норматовых дочка на выданье, поэтому они хотят сделать ремонт квартиры. На полученный кредит Зиёрат планирует сделать ремонт,за что благодарит  кредиторов.
texts.en:
Born in 1960, Ziyorat N. is married and has four children. Her husband works in the Russian Federation and sends her money every month. Ziyorat works as a dispatcher at the Khujand city electric station. The Normatovs have a daughter to marry off, and this is why they want to repair their apartment. Ziyorat plans to use this loan to make the repairs and thanks our creditors.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Apartment repairs

loans.name: Bahri

texts.en: For more than five years, Bahri has spent a great part of her time working and managing at the market by selling foodstuffs. She has always looked for a way to generate income for her home, which is why her current business is not her first job. Previously, Bahri worked at a mobile fruit stand. However, she thinks that maintaining her store is a more secure job. Her youngest daughter accompanies her and always helps. Bahri plans to continue improving her business by continuing to have a diversity of goods so as to be able to increase her sales. For now, she feels happy to have helped her children with their studies. loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy A. is 56 years old and she is married with six children. She sells ice cream in retail and wholesale to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more ice cream to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice cream to sell

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi is 39 years old and married with three children. She sells shoes and bags. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thank to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Djamoliddin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Джамолиддин 1987 года рождения. Студент Худжанского Универститета на четвертом курсе. После учебы торгует продуктами питание на автовокзале «Рохи Абрешим». Товар он закупает на оптовом рынке Панчшанбе. Спрос на товар большой из-за расположение место. Родители Джамолиддина поддерживают сына и не против, чтобы он взял кредит. На запрашиваемый займ он увеличит ассортимент.
texts.en:
Djamoliddin was born in 1987. He is a forth-year student at the Khujand University. He sells food products after school at the Rohi Abreshim bus station. Djamoliddin buys his products at the Panchshanbe wholesale market. The demand for his products is high due to the retail location. Djamoliddin's parents help him and support his desire to obtain a loan. He will use this loan to increase his product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of buckwheat, sugar and various types of tea

loans.name: Bidemi

texts.en: Bidemi, 36 years old and married with one child, has a provision shop. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Ede

texts.en: Ede, 32 years old and married with two children, sells electrical materials. He is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical goods to sell.

loans.name: Nakasero East Nakazi Jenifer Group

texts.en: Jenifer N., a single businesswoman blessed with two children who are attending school, also takes care of three dependents who go to school as well. Jenifer is leading her group and she wants the loan to purchase new shoes for children, ladies and gents for her shop to satisfy customer demand. She has been in the business for over six years and hopes to improve it with the loan. N. Jenifer is a hardworking lady whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes for children, ladies and gents in her shop to satisfy customer demand.

loans.name: James Kimutai

texts.en:
James has been in the business of selling cows for the past four years. He is 56 years old, married, and blessed with seven children. His business is located at Lelmoluk Centre, along Moi University Way, in Eldoret Town.

James was introduced to KADET by a friend. He intends to use this loan from KADET to expand his business by buying more cows for resale. James hopes he will be able to continue to make good profit from his business, so that he will be able to pay for his children's higher education.

About KADET The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities, in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy two heifers

loans.name: Eno

texts.en: Eno is 42 years old and married with two children. She has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to cook. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter W. is a freight hauler in Naivasha town. He is married to Elizabeth Wambui, who works as a casual laborer at one of the many flower farms in the Naivasha area. Together they have three children who are all still in school.

A friend introduced Peter to KADET. After joining KADET and going through training, Peter received a first loan of about $250 US. With this second loan, he plans to service the pickup truck he is using, buy a new set of tires, and renew the vehicle's insurance cover. In the future, he plans to buy a bigger truck (probably a lorry) which will enable him to better serve clients who need to transport bulky stuff.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To service a pickup truck used for transport and freight hauling

loans.name: Adebola

texts.en: Adebola is 41 years old and married with two children. She sells kerosene from a tank. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in agricultural work

loans.name: Ngao Group

texts.en:
Hanifa R. has been selling food for eight years. She works for four hour a day and makes a monthly profit of 200,000 Tsh. She has four children and their ages are 20, 18, 12 and 7. She wants this loan in order to expand her business. The profit she gains will be used to pay school fees, do repairs, get more food for her family and expand her business.

Hanifa is a member of Ngao Group Msamvu in Morogoro. Maria is a member of the same group. She wants a 250,000 loan in order to expand her business. Another member of the same group is Asha. She also requests a 250,000 loan in order to buy more things for her business.

loans.use: To expand her food business

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the Kinegangosi B borrower group in Ruaha, Iringa. She is a 41 year old married woman and the mother of three children: ages 18, 14, and 11. She also cares for one other dependent.

Six years ago, Jenny started her own shop selling soap, sugar, rice, and other goods. She works there 13 hours per day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzanian Schillings.

This is Jenny’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 250,0,00 Tsh in order to buy more products for her shop. 

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, she hopes to provide more food for her family, pay school fees, do repairs, and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase products for her shop

loans.name: Raji

texts.en: Raji is 52 years old and married with 6 children. He sells engine oil and electrical materials. He is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. He says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Nakasero South Natongo Rehema Group

texts.en:
Rehema N. is a single mother of a twenty-one-year-old. She is an active business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land. She is the leader of her bank group. 

Rehema has been purchasing onions in from villages to resell in markets for the past year. She is requesting a loan to add capital to her business so she can purchase and resell onions in larger quantities.

loans.use: Purchase onions in bigger quantities to sell in markets.

loans.name: Daajinsuren

texts.en:
Daajinsuren is a single mother who lives with her two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Daajinsuren sells children’s clothing. In 2007 she and her two daughters moved to the city from the countryside and began to sell children’s clothing at the outdoor market.  In 2009 she moved to a different market, leased a booth and started working there.  Her older daughter helps her at the market even though she is in school.   She also takes care of her little sister when Daajinsuren is away.  They hope someday to be able to lease another booth to expand their business.

With money from the loan she would like to buy clothes in Beijing and bring them to Mongolia to sell.  If she can get a better selection and better quality clothes from Beijing she can gain more customers and increase her income.

She lives with her two daughters in a Mongolian Ger.  Her husband got sick and passed away four years ago.  The property they live on has a shack on it but it is so old and run down that they can’t live in it.  She hopes to be able to save enough money to fix up that shack and move into it before winter sets in.

Daajinsuren is very quiet, unassuming, and a very hard worker.  She says her biggest goal is to raise her daughters to be good and wise people.

About XacBank:

Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar.  It currently serves approximately 16,000 micro clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country.

XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about Planet, People, and Profit. The Bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the Bank’s clients, including its traditional Micro-entrepreneurs as well as Small and Medium businesses.

Your loan enables XacBank to expand its microloan capacity and return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term

To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase more children's apparel to increase her business inventory

loans.name: Nakasero South Namilimu Juliet Group

texts.en: N. Juliet is the group leader of Nakasero South. She is 32 and is a single mother of six children; all are in school. She has owned her beauty salon for over ten years. She requests the loan to purchase hair braids, chemicals (relaxers), treatments and so forth. Her standard of living is improving and her future hope is to enlarge her salon business.

loans.use: To purchase hair braids, chemicals (relaxers), treatment and so forth

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
In 2007 Sarantuya began selling groceries at the Orkhon Marketplace in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city.  In 2008 she moved to a new market and began leasing a booth there.  She recently was able to acquire one more booth to expand her little store. With a loan she will be able to buy and then sell all kinds of foodstuff instead of the limited groceries she is able to buy now. One day she also hopes to be able to get a car. 

She and her husband have lived in their own two-room apartment for six years now,  with their son Undrahbulag, who is 8 and is in 2nd grade, and their daughter Indra, who is 5 and is in kindergarten.  Her husband Altanbulag makes furniture for a living.  

She is a very unassuming and pleasant person.  She is very sincere and treats everyone the same.  She has good business sense, and no bad habits.

About XacBank:

Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar.  It currently serves approximately 16,000 micro clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country.

XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about Planet, People, and Profit. The Bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the Bank’s clients, including its traditional Micro-entrepreneurs as well as Small and Medium businesses.

Your loan enables XacBank to expand its microloan capacity and return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term

To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase food products for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry and poultry food

loans.name: Tserenhuu

texts.en:
Tserenhuu and her husband have been sewing and selling clothes together for a long time.  Before 2001 they sewed and sold suits at the old open market in the capital.  Once Narantuul, the new and bigger market, opened in 2001, they moved to that market and bought their own booth. They buy their material from the same market.  They work hard and have always been able to maintain a profit. 

They live with their two sons on property owned by their relatives in a Mongolian Ger (nomadic housing tent). Both children are attending local elementary schools. With money from this loan she wants to expand the business so that they will be able to afford a place of their own, in a building instead of a ger. She is a very quiet, pleasant, and unassuming lady.

About XacBank:

Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar.  It currently serves approximately 16,000 micro clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country.

XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about Planet, People, and Profit. The Bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the Bank’s clients, including its traditional Micro-entrepreneurs as well as Small and Medium businesses.

Your loan enables XacBank to expand its microloan capacity and return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term

To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Majengo Group

texts.en:
Avelina is one of 2 members of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is  32, is married, and has 2 children, 11 and 6 years old. 
  
Avelina started her own cafe business 3 years ago. She works  11 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 120,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Avelina’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to to buy more commodities for her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Avelina hopes to get more food, pay school fees, do repairs and expand her business. 

Fatina, the other member of the Majengo borrower group, has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick O. is 55, married and has 5 children. He is a commercial bus driver. He hopes for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase a second-hand bus.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand bus

loans.name: Kinegamgosi Group

texts.en:
Gress is one member of the Kinegamgosi borrower group in Ruaha, Iringa. She is 30, is married, and has 2 children, 18 and 14 years old. She also cares for 2 other dependents. 
Gress started her own cafe business 6  years ago. She works 11 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 100,000 Tanzania Schillings.
This is Gress’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities like rice,and meat. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Gress hopes to do repairs, get more food for her family, save money and expand her business. 
Mwanaharabu, the other member of the borrower group, requests 200,000 Tsh in order to support her used clothing business.

loans.use: buy more commodities

loans.name: Esther Olubunmi

texts.en: Esther Olubunmi is 43 and is married with 2 children. She sells good-condition used books. She is requesting a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more books to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used books to sell

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en: Olabisi is 42 and married. She has 4 children who are in school. Olabisi operates a restaurant where she sells cooked food, and drinks. She is requesting a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort L. is 30 years old and married with four children. She sells electronic parts. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more electronic parts to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic parts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Muyibat

texts.en: Muyibat is 52 years old and married with four children. She sells drinks and cooked foods and has been in the business for long. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs, this she says will help her serve her customer better. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose is 38 years old and married with three children. She has a salon where she styles hair and sells hair extensions and drinks. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more hairdressing materials, hair extensions and drinks. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hairdressing materials

loans.name: Osewuonamen

texts.en: Osewuonamen O. is 33 years old and she is married with two children. She sells laboratory equipment. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more laboratory equipment to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more laboratory equipment to sell

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
María vive en el sector de la Dolorosa, comunidad de Pacha, a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, su clima es parecido a la ciudad de Cuenca(variado), tiene 46 años de edad y es casada, su esposo es albañil, tienen 2 hijas ya son casadas, un hijo varón pero ya falleció, cuenta que cierto día cuando este tenía 24 años de edad, estuvo bebiendo en el lugar de trabajo(construcción), y que a una altura de un metro se cayó de espaldas golpeándose la cabeza pero como estaba borracho se levantó y siguió bebiendo, ya por la tarde se trasladó a su casa con un fuerte dolor de cabeza, su esposa sabía que le gustaba beber, por tal razón no tomó en cuenta lo que le había sucedido, por la noche se dirige a lavarse la cabeza y luego de esto comenzó con una rara actitud, como loco, al ver esta actitud, lo trasladaron al hospital, en donde le diagnosticaron que tuvo un derrame cerebral por causa del golpe, esa misma noche falleció.
María vive en casa propia que sus hijas la han ayudado a construir sobre la que tenía que era de barro y bareque, tiene en su poder dos nietos que su madre está en el extranjero, se dedica a tejer chalinas a crochet, los hace para vender, cuenta que se demora dos semanas, hasta un mes por chalina debido a que no lo hace seguido sino en cada momento que tiene tiempo, esta profesión aprendió en la escuela primaria, a partir de esto se dedica y lo toma como un entretenimiento ya que sus manos no pueden dejar de estar haciendo algo. Cada chalina invierte aproximadamente unos 8 a 9 dólares y los vende a un costo de 20,25 o 30 dólares según lo complicado del diseño.
El monto que adquirió ahora fue para comprar animales y construir galpones para pollos de engorde que empezará a criar y venderlos conjuntamente con su esposo porque ya no quiere que salga a trabajar porque se dedica mucho a la bebida, esta muy agradecida con la fundación, que como es socia ya hace mucho tiempo y ha tenido muchos créditos anteriormente le ha ayudado para seguir adelante.
La meta que tiene María es seguir trabajando y pide a la fundación espoir que le siga colaborando.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Dolorosa sector, Pacha community, 30 minutes from the city of Cuenca. The climate is similar to Cuenca’s (variable). She is 46 years old and married. Her husband is a construction worker and they have two married daughters and a son who is deceased. She relates that when her son was 24 years old, he had been drinking at his construction work site and fell a distance of 1 meter on his back hitting his head. Because he was drunk he got up and kept drinking. That afternoon, when he returned home, he had a strong headache. His wife knew of his drinking problem so she didn’t think much of this incident. Later that night, he was washing his hair and began behaving in a strange way, as if he were crazy. He was taken to the hospital where he was diagnosed with a cerebral hemorrhage due to the earlier fall. He died that same night. Maria lives in her own home which her daughters have helped her build upon the old one which was just mud and scrap. She also cares for two grandchildren since their mother is out of the country. She knits and crochets scarves which she sells. It takes her from two weeks to a month to complete each item since she only knits when she has free time. She learned how to knit in elementary school and what began as a hobby now is a form of making some money. Each scarf costs her about 8 or nine dollars and she sells them for 20, 25 or 30 dollars depending on the degree of intricacy of the design. The current loan is to purchase chicks and to build coops so that she can raise the chicks to sell them with her husband because she wants her husband to stay home more and not go out as much because, when he does, he drinks in excess. She is very grateful to the foundation since, as a long-standing member, she has had several prior loans and they have helped her get ahead. Her goal is to continue working and she asks Espoir foundation for its continued cooperation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicks and build coops.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is married with three children who are in school. She sells drinks. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is 32 years old and married with three children. He sells provisions in cartons and uses his motorcycle for transport business. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Lois Toyin

texts.en: Toyin Lois is 34 years old and married with four children. She sells stationery. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more stationery to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery to sell

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious O. is 23 years old and she is single without a child. She is a tailor and she also sells tailoring materials. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Adegboye

texts.en: Adegboye is 27 years old. He has a tailoring shop where he makes nice clothes. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel N. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is 20 years old and a student in a local university. Her two younger daughters go to a local high school.

Odgerel has a small grocery. She sells various products, including dairy products and soft drinks. She has been in the business for more than 14 years and currently rents a small stall in the Herlen shopping center for her business. In the future, she hopes to buy a stall at the shopping center instead of paying high rent. She says that next year her two daughters will be university students, which means that she needs more money to cover their tuition and living expenses. She also says that she is working even harder to make extra income to meet the family's increasing expenses.

With part of the loan, she plans to purchase more products for her business and the rest of the loan will be used to buy a car engine for her family's minibus.

loans.use: To purchase a car engine and food products

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy A. is 35 years old and married with three children. She sells local gin to make a living. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Biodun

texts.en: Biodun A. is 34 years old and married with two children. She has a patent shop and she also sells provisions. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and provisions to sell

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle is 55 years old and a widow with six children who are in school. She is a nurse and also has a shop where she sells drinks in crates and cartons. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drinks to sell

loans.name: Tserenlham

texts.en:
Tserenlham D. is 55 and has two daughters. She lives in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since her husband's death, she has been doing a small business in retail. She visits her client families and local people and sells various products for family or individual needs. 

She has been in the retail business for about 14 years and has a wide base of clients and customers. She visits the local police office, tax office, and even hospitals to pitch her products for sale. She employs an orphan teenage boy who does not have parents and shelter. She supports him and gives him a job with a salary. She says that she has raised two daughters well and now would like to raise this orphan teenager well. 

She requests a loan to purchase more products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase 25kg flour, meat and 30 liters of vegetable oil

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe is 40 years old and married with 3 children who are in school. Dupe sells drinks and is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She wishes to say thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose E. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. Bose sells sarongs and jeans and hopes for a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She wishes to say thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his taxi and purchase a ger (nomadic housing tent)

loans.name: Achan Rose‘S Group

texts.en:
Rose is a leader of four members of a group.  She is 32 years old and married with three children between 8 and 13 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with three people. Rose takes care of her sister. There is no electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala.  Rose stays in Naguru selling smoked fish at Nakawa Market in one of the Kampala suburbs. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. Rose also sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people excluding children. She works six days a week. Rose sells mainly on retail only. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises and home.  She has been in this business for the last 10 years. Rose has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her 10th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more fish.  Rose is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise and home.

.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Del Futuro Group

texts.en:
Agapita H. is the coordinator for Mujeres del Futuro, a microfinance group with Esperanza. She lives with her husband, Zacaria, in an impoverished area of Puerta Plata. Although she has no children, kids from the neighborhood love to come to her house to play. Agapita serves them food and watches them ride bikes, play ball, and run around at her house. She considers these children to be her own and gets a sense of joy from watching them grow up.

Agapita runs a small grocery shop from her home. There she sells a wide variety of raw foods, including plantains, tomatoes, and a variety of meats. She will use the loan from Esperanza to buy more food and expand her business. Ultimately, she plans to purchase a motoconcho, which is a cheap motorcycle. This transportation will help her transport her goods to a market where she believes that she will be able to sell a great deal more than by selling only in her quiet neighborhood. 

In addition to improving and expanding her business, Agapita plans to use her increased earnings to improve her home and take care of some of her health problems. She would like to install new windows because her house is too dark during the day. Additionally, Agapita says that she has recently experienced a great deal of tension in her heart. She would like to buy some medicine to resolve that health problem. Your loan will give Agapita the means to run a successful business and subsequently improve her life and economic situation. Thank you for reading her story and for your consideration.

loans.use: Purchasing raw foods for resale.

loans.name: Pamella Nabuuma ‘S Group

texts.en:
Pamella is a leader of five members of a group.  She is 33 years old and married with four children aged between 3 and 10 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with five people. Pamella takes care of additional family members. There is no electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Pamella owns a retail shop in Lubaga ben Kiwanuka zone and so she incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and sells to all categories of people.  She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for both home and business, and feeding the family. Besides this retail shop, she also owns a charcoal stall.  She has been in this business for the last two years Pamella has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her 12th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more commodities for her shop. Pamella is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise and home. 

.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Jazmines Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Jazmines” con 12 integrantes,  llevan adelante su reunión con la orientación de una de las asesoras.

Todas tienen sus propios  negocios, tales como la  venta de ropa, refrescos, cosméticos, repuestos, comida, ollas, radios, tienda de barrio y costura de chamarras y necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería o materia prima, es el caso de la señora Dina C. de 23 años de edad, casada con un hijo, emprendió su negocio de costura de chamarras  hace 1 año, por la necesidad de mantener a su familia y generarse un ingreso, ella le entrega las prendas a su hermano que tiene un puesto de venta en la plaza “Eguino” y necesita el préstamo para comprar tela y forro.
texts.en:
You will find the community association Jazmines in one of Pro Mujer’s community centers. There are 12 members. They are having a training meeting with one of the advisors. All of them have their own business like selling clothes, soft drinks, cosmetics, replacement parts, food, pots, and radios. Some of them have neighborhood stores and some make jackets. They need a loan to buy merchandise or raw material. For example, Dina C. is 32, married, and she has one child. She started her business of making jackets one year ago. She did this because she needed to support her family and generate an income. She gives the jackets she makes to her brother. He has a sales place in the Eguino plaza. She needs a loan to buy material and lining.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (clothes, soft drinks, perfume, pots) and raw material (fabric and lining)

loans.name: María Ángel

texts.es: María Ángel C. de 38 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad. María vive con su esposo  que trabaja como motorista y sus tres hijos de los cuales dos estudian,  María posee su negocio hace tres años es una tienda donde vende productos de  primera necesidad, el motivo por el cual María solicita un crédito es para invertir en su negocio con la compra de más variedad de productos que le ayudaran a aumentar sus ingresos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Angel C. is 38 years old and lives in La Libertad department. She lives with her husband, who is a truck driver, and her three children, two of whom are still students. For the past 3 years Maria has had a general store where she sells basic foodstuffs. She requests this loan to invest in stock so that she can offer a wider variety of items thereby incresing her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store.

loans.name: Wcsl Primary School, Binkolo Group

texts.en:
These are the staff of the Wesleyan Church of Sierra Leone Primary School, Binkolo (WCSL). WCSL Primary school, Binkolo was set up in 1919 by the Wesleyan Mission to give formal education to the children of Binkolo village and its surrounding villages. Today, the school has a total of nine staff and five hundred pupils. 

With this loan, some of these teachers will invest in business, others to pursue further studies, others will use it to pay their children’s school/college fees, others to buy house-building materials and others will use it to buy pieces of furniture.

Augustine C. K. (left) is the head teacher at the school. Augustine was born in Binkolo village, about seven miles from Makeni, some 52 years ago. He is married and they have three children. One of his sons is a police officer and the remaining two have just sat for the West Africa Senior Secondary Schools Examinations (WASSE). He has been a teacher for 31 years. Augustine will use this loan to pay college fees for his children once they enroll into university.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Telmar

texts.en:
Telmar M. D. C. G. runs a small general store in Boane, Mozambique. She has been running this store since 1995 with the help of two employees. Her best selling product is beer, which she sells for MT 30. Telmar is able to make around MT 5,500 a day through her sales. Her income allows her to set aside a little bit each month in a savings account. She learned her trade way back in 1987 from family members. 

With this loan, Telmar plans on increasing her product inventory to meet customer demand. In the future, Telmar wants to open a second store in a different district in Boane. She plans to pursue this goal with the help of microfinance.

Telmar is originally from Zavala, but moved to Boane at a young age with her family. She studied through the tenth grade, at which point she was forced to stop, as she was pregnant and did not have time to dedicate to her  studies.She is a single mother of three children between the ages of 6 and 14.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Six years ago Amelia C., now age 50, was unemployed and single and supported by her two adult children. She decided she wanted to turn her life around and took a sewing class in order to start her own business making curtains and bedding. Amelia took out her first loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric to start her business.

Now, 6 years later, she is a shining example of how much a little opportunity can go. She frequently travels to surrounding towns to sell her well-crafted curtains and bedding which are in high demand. Now she is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine so she can hire another employee and increase production to meet the high demand. Right now she makes all of her products from her house, but she has a dream of one day of having her own store with multiple employees helping her sew. 

Amelia is now an independent woman and instead of depending on her children, she is able to provide for them. She has experienced a new sense of self-confidence and empowerment and she is excited to continue to grow her business. By supporting this loan, you can help Amelia come one step closer to achieving her dreams!

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Kasifa Namakula ‘Sgroup

texts.en:
K. is a leader of five members of a group.  She is a 65-year-old single mother of two children aged 45 and 35 years.  None of her children goes to school because they are all old with five children of their own aged between 17 and 25 years. Only three of their children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with five people. K. takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala. K. stays in Mulago zone selling second hand clothes in Kalerwe one of Kampala suburbs. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping or work. K. also sells chicken and pig's food. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people excluding children. She works six days a week. K. sells mainly on retail only. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises.  She has been in this business for the last five years. K. has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her 10th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy clothes for resale.  K. is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise.

.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Active Group

texts.en:
This is Zainab K. and Aminata C. of Active group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

Zainab K. (right) is the leader of Active group. She is 33 years of age, married to a businessman and they have six children. One of her children is now in Junior Secondary School, four in Primary Schools and one is still not of school going age. Zainab sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and gara lappas (locally dyed clothes sometimes with fabricated designs). Zainab has been a businesswoman for 15 years now.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Jacqueline Marisol

texts.es: Jacqueline Marisol O. V. de 26 años de edad vive en el departamento de San Salvador con su Abuelo don José de 83 años y sus tres hijos Alexander de 10 años, Luis de 4 años y Jenifer de 2 años de edad. Jacqueline posee su negocio en el cual fabrican variedad de zapatos para ser distribuidos en San Vicente y Usulután, Jacqueline solo cuenta con la ayuda de un empleado en su negocio, Jacqueline solicita un crédito para compra de materiales que se utilizan en la zapatería ya que desea  seguir expandiendo su distribución en ventas a otros departamentos del país.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Marisol O. Vasquez is 26 years old and lives in San Salvador department with her 83-year-old grandfather, Don Jose, and her three children: Alexander, 10, Luis, 4 and Jenifer, 2. Jacqueline has a business where she makes a variety of shoes for distribution in San Vicente and Usulutan. She only has one employee to help her. She needs this loan to purchase raw materials used in the manufacture of shoes because she wants to continue to expand the distribution of her product to other departments in the country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Irma Margoth

texts.es: Irma Margoth R. M. de 38 años de edad  reside Cantón Maquilishuat, Ilobasco; Irma vive en casa propia con su mamá y su hijo Nelson de 9 años de edad actualmente está cursando el 3er grado, Irma se dedica a la confección de ropa a la medida pero también para generar mayores ingresos ahora está comercializando productos de una revista la cual lleva de visita a la casa de todos clientes para que pueden comprar cualquier producto que se encuentre en  la revista, esto benefia a Irma ya que obtiene una comisión por venta, pero ahora Irma solita un crédito por que tiene muchos pedidos en ropa que sus clientes le solicitan  y desea comprar la tela para poder sacar dicha producción, ayudando a Irma a obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Irma Margoth Rodriguez M. is 38 years old and lives in Canton Maquilishuat, Ilobasco. She has her own home which she shares with her mother and her 9-year-old son, Nelson, who is currently in 3rd grade. Irma custom makes and sells clothes but she has added catalogue sales of a variety of items which she offers door-to-door in order to increase her profits. This is beneficial to Irma since she earns a comission on every sale. However, she now has several back orders for custom-made clothes and she is requesting this loan to purchase the fabric she needs to manufacture these items thereby increasing her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric for clothing manufacture.

loans.name: Mansaray Group

texts.en:
This is Aminata M. and Unisa K.. Aminata (on the left) is the leader of this group. Aminata sells market food and has been in this business for 22 years now. She was born in Makeni. She is age 39, married to a diamond miner and they have two children. One of their children is now in Senior Secondary School I (SSS I) and the other is in class six.

This group is called M. Group, named after the group leader. The members are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni city. Business has been growing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs due to lack of sufficient capital. Therefore, they came to SMT/Kiva seeking a loan of Le 500,000 each to help them expand their business.

loans.use: To invest in food business

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Cette femme a commencé en 2006 le commerce des articles de mercerie, elle a des clients qui sont pour la plupart des couturières, elle vend à crédit à certaines de ses clientes et collecte les fonds dans les huit jours suivants, ainsi elle arrive à gagner la confiance de bons nombre de clients. Voulant agrandir son stock actuel, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit pour acheter des grippures, des doublures, des fils et divers articles de mercerie.
texts.en:
In 2006, this woman began doing commerce in sewing supplies. Most of her customers are seamstresses. She sells on credit to some of them and collects the funds in the following weeks. She thus manages to earn the trust of a good number of customers. Wanting to expand her current inventory, she is requesting a second loan to buy heavy lace or trim, some linings, thread, and various other sewing-related items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes H. N. de 40 años de edad reside en el municipio de Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San Salvador. María vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas Diana de 14 años de edad y Blanca de 17 años de edad ambas niñas se encuentran estudiando. María posee un negocio en una de las calles de comercio más transitada de San Salvador, donde vende variedad de artículos para regalos y venta de ropa interior, sus ventas son diarias y muy estables ya que los precios en los productos de María son accesibles, María solita un crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa para su negocio de esta manera logara aumentar sus ganancias a través de sus ventas
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes Hernandez N. is 40 years old and lives in the Ciudad Delgado municipality in the San Salvador department. She shares her own home with two daughters: Diana, 14 and Blanca, 17, who are both students. Maria has a store on one of San Salvador's busiest streets where she sells a variety of gift items as well as underwear. Her daily sales are stable since her prices are fair and accessible to her customers. She is requesting a loan to invest in more inventory so that her profits will increase through her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy condiments and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Cette femme a eu une formation en couture et exerce ce métier depuis 2006, actuellement elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes de ses clients, ayant des apprentis, la seule machine dont elle dispose ne lui permet plus de satisfaire de façon convenable ses clients, elle souhaiterait acheter une deuxième machine pour livrer dans les délais convenables les commandes des clients, c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite  un crédit pour acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre.
texts.en:
This woman had a training course in clothes making and this has been her business since 2006. Currently, she receives a lot of orders from her customers. She has apprentices, but the only machine she has at her disposal does not allow her to satisfy more orders in a manner suitable to her clients. She would like to buy a second sewing machine in order to deliver to customers within a suitable time frame. It is for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Alejandro Francisco

texts.es: Alejandro Francisco A. L. de 77 años de edad reside en el municipio de Cuscatancingo departamento San Salvador. Don Alejandro  vive con su esposa y su hija Paola de 19 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Alejandro es vendedor de Lotería, a pesar de su edad eso no es obstáculo para salir de su casa temprano todos los días y viajar a parques, mercados y buses dándole una esperanza a las personas que ellos podrían ser los ganadores del premio gordo, para que se animen a comprar de su billetes,  de esa manera es como se gana la vida Alejandro y mantiene a su familia. El destino del crédito que solicita Alejandro es para la compra de mayor cantidad de billetes que le ayudaran a  aumentar su ganancias
texts.en:
77-year-old Alejandro Francisco A. L. lives in the Municipality of Cuscatancingo in San Salvador. Alejandro lives with his wife and 19-year-old daughter Paola who attends school.
Alejandro is a lottery ticket seller. His age does not stop him from leaving his home early in the morning every day and travelling to parks, markets and buses, giving people hope that they could win the jackpot so that they buy his tickets. This is how Alejandro makes a living and provides for his family.
The loan that Alejandro is requesting will be used to purchase a larger quantity of tickets that will help him increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more lottery tickets to sell

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur  était gestionnaire d’une station d’essence, mais ne gagnant pas assez de revenu pour subvenir aux besoins de sa femmes et de ses 02 enfants, il a abandonnée cette activité et a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle il fait des services de photocopie et la vente de divers articles de bureau, sa photocopieuse est en panne, il voudrait en acheter un autre, c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une photocopieuse.
texts.en:
This gentleman used to be the manager of a gas station. But, not earning enough income to provide for his wife and two children, he abandoned that business and opened his own shop, in which he offers photocopying services and sells various office items. His photocopier broke down, and he would like to buy another one. This is why he's requesting a loan from WAGES.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a photocopier

loans.name: Dios Es Esperanza Group 1

texts.en: Miranda Y. is 24 years old. She is hoping to start a new business selling cooking fuels and food items, such as sugar and coffee, with help from her first loan from Kiva and Esperanza International. Miranda has just moved to the sugarcane-cutting community (called a 'batey') of El Prado, which lies in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. She has never owned her own business before. Currently, Miranda, her husband, and their four children live in severe poverty. The family has no regular source of income.

loans.use: To buy cooking fuel and food items for small general store

loans.name: Tabatasu Group

texts.en:
The members of the Tabatasu group are Katrine K., Sallamatu C. and Rugiatu T.. They are small scale businesswomen based in the city of Makeni who have come to SMT/Kiva to seek their very first loan, requesting Le 500,000 for each to enable them expand their businesses.

Born in Makeni 27 years ago, Katrine K. (shown in the middle) is the leader of this group. She is married to a driver and they have three children, one of whom is in class five, another in class two, and the last not yet of school-going age. A businesswoman for ten years now, Katrine sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) at trade fairs and other market foods at home.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Cette dame est une résidente du quartier d’avedji non loin d’adidogomé à lomé.  Elle  exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, pour réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays, plus précisément à Anié où le bol des céréales est moins coûteux. Elle voudrait rehausser son stock et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de maïs et 10 sacs d’haricots.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady is a resident of the Avedji district, not far from Adidogomé in Lomé. She earns revenues from commerce in grains. To realize a greater profit margin on her sales, she stocks up from the country's interior, in Anié to be exact, where a bowl of grain is less costly. She would like to replenish her stock and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 15 sacks of corn and 10 sacks of beans. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply his shop

loans.name: Atsu

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur achète des motos qu’il exploite pour des activités de taxi motos. Il veut acheter une autre moto pour l’exploiter pour les activités de taxi moto, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une moto. 
Etant célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de cette activité qu’il subvient à ses charges.
texts.en:
This man buys motorcycles to operate a business of moto-taxi. He wants to buy another motorcycle to use in his moto-taxi business. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a motorcycle.

Being single, the income from this activity provides for his expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle to use as taxi, moto-taxi.

loans.name: Villa Dolores Group

texts.es: Margarita M., tiene el negocio de venta de arroz, es una integrante del grupo “Villa Dolores”  tiene 19  años casada con un hijo, aprendió del negocio que actualmente maneja  hace 8 años, ayudando a sus hermanos, pero hace 2 años se ha independizado, compra su mercadería de diferentes lugares como es de Santa C., Caranavi y Perú, carga toda su mercadería en una movilidad y va ofreciendo su producto zona por zona en la ciudad de El Alto, es decir, ambulando y ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y espera estar mucho tiempo en el grupo hasta obtener un crédito alto. Al igual que  Margarita sus demás compañeras tienen diferentes negocios como la venta  de jugos,  ropa, calzados, cerámica, carne, arroz y requieren el préstamo para la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
Margarita Madani sells rice. She is a member of the Villa Dolores group. She has been married for 19 years, and she has a son. She learned the business that she currently has eight years ago. She learned by helping her siblings. Two years ago she started on her own. She buys her merchandise from different places like Santa C., Caranavi, and Perú. She loads all of her merchandise in a vehicle. She sells her product by traveling from zone to zone in the city of El Alto. She now needs a loan to buy merchandise. She hopes to be in the group for a long time and even get a larger loan. Just like Margarita, the other members have different businesses like selling juice, clothes, footwear, ceramics, meat, and rice. They need a loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (rice, quinoa, clothes, ceramics, and meat)

loans.name: Mireya Luisa

texts.es: La señora Mireya Luisa F. tiene la edad de 34 años, reside en la capital de Managua en el barrio Hialeah, casada y con tres hijos de 7,9 y 11 años de edad, que estudian su primaria. Sus planes es pode repellar su casa y embaldosar  para estar en mejores condiciones con su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, electrodomésticos y zapatos que desde once años vende, inicio con capital propio y vendiendo ropa usada. Con este crédito va a compra ropa, zapatos para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad y cumplir con la demanda, espera obtener mejores ganancias y captar clientes nuevos para crecer en su negocio. También poder ayudar a sus hijos para que sean niños de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mireya Luisa F. is 34 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. She is married with 3 children, aged 7, 9, and 11, all of whom are in grade school. Her hope is to be able to perform some repairs on her house in order to provide better living conditions for her family. Mrs. F. has worked for 11 years selling clothing, household appliances, and shoes. She started this business with her own money and began by selling used clothing. With this loan she is going to buy clothing and shoes so that she can offer improved selection to her customers. In this way she hopes to attract and keep new customers, grow her business, and increase her profits. She also wants to support her children to help them become upstanding individuals.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Tamaraneh Traders Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu T. and Magrette S. and they named their group Tamaraneh Traders. They are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have benefited from previous SMT/Kiva loans. With the help of those loans, they were able to pay their house rent, feed their families and pay school fees for their children.

Having repaid the previous loan successfully, Tamaraneh Traders are asking for a new loan of Le 1,200,000 each to further improve their businesses.

Kadiatu T. (right) is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is now age fifty-five and is married with four children. Two of her children are already grown-ups and two are in secondary schools. Kadiatu was born in Port Loko but now resides in Makeni where she sells local produce like rice, palm-oil, groundnuts (peanuts), etc. She has been a businesswoman for more than twenty years now.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié, il est père de famille, pour subvenir convenablement aux charges de sa famille, il a acheté un taxi qu’il exploite pour son propre compte. Avec cette activité, il réalise d’excellentes recettes. Son moteur est en panne, ce qui a bloqué son activité. Voulant reprendre son activité et subvenir convenablement aux charges de sa famille, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  un moteur pour son taxi et reprendre son activité.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a married father. In order to properly provide for his family's expenses, he bought a taxi that he operates for himself. With this business he makes an excellent income. His engine broke down, which has stopped his activity. He would like to start his business again to provide properly for his family's expenses. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy an engine for his taxi and to restart his business.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an engine

loans.name: Kayo

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est lancée en 2008 dans le commerce des articles de mercerie, ce commerce lui réussit bien car elle est la seule femme à exercer cette activité dans son quartier, elle exerce ce commerce dan sa boutique qu’elle a appelé « GOSS WAY ». Elle veut agrandir son commerce pour réaliser plus de recettes, elle demande alors à WAGES un crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de boutons, 6 tas  de fermeture, des fils de couture et divers articles de mercerie.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman began selling sewing notions in 2008. The business is going well since she is the only person to sell these items in her neighborhood. She works out of her shop she calls « GOSS WAY ». She would like to expand her business so as to make more income. She is therefore asking WAGES for a loan to buy 2 cartons of buttons, 6 piles of zippers, sewing thread and various other sewing necessities.

She is married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sewing notions for re-sale

loans.name: Eyaa

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’adidogomé, l’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce est le commerce de produits de premières nécessités, son stock de produits vivriers a baissé, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter divers produits de premières nécessités. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de ce commerce, elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This lady is married and the mother of 1 child. She lives with her family in the Adidogomé neighborhood. Her income-generating activity is selling staples. Her stock of foodstuffs is low so she needs to replenish it. She is asking WAGES for a loan to buy various staple goods. With the income from her business, she contributes supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of staple goods for re-sale

loans.name: Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
Jane T. (left) is the leader of this group. Jane sells firewood. She was born in Makeni. She is 33 years of age, married to a businessman and they have four children who are still in primary schools. Jane has been a businesswoman for 15 years now.

This group is called Tamemsu. They are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a big impact on the lives of these borrowers. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan of Le 800,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses.

loans.use: To invest in firewood business

loans.name: Blanca Nieves Group

texts.es:
La asociación Blanca Nieves pertenece al centro focal Villa Tejada, esta formado por doce mujeres, ellas trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace diez años. Varias son las actividades de este grupo, por ejemplo Virginia se dedica a la venta de cámaras fotográficas y relojes, Carmen  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida rápida (hamburguesas y salchipapas), Lindaura vende colchas y sabanas, Encarnación vende desayunos, Catalina vende relojes.
Todas afirman que necesitan aumentar capital a sus negocios, desean comprar mercadería o insumos, con esto obtendrán mayores ganancias
texts.en:
The Snow White Association is a branch of Villa Tejada, and is made up of a dozen women who have worked together at Pro-Mujer for 10 years. The group is involved in a variety of activities: for example Virginia sells cameras and watches, Carmen makes and sells fast food, Lindaura sells mattresses and blankets, Encarnacion sells breakfast foods, and Catalina sells watches. All of them would like to increase their incomes, and want to buy more merchandise or raw materials to make that happen.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère d’un enfant,  elle réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’awatamé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle a appris le métier de la couture et a ouvert son atelier qu’elle a nommé «  la main de Dieu ». Elle a associé à cette activité le commerce de pagnes et ce commerce marche bien pour elle, aussi elle confectionne des habits qu'elle vend à ses clients. Elle veut  agrandir le commerce de pagnes et de tissus, raison pour laquelle elle demande de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 pagnes de nouvelles qualités
texts.en:
