This lady is married and the mother of one child. She lives with her family in the Awatamé district, an outlying neighborhood of the city of Lomé. She learned to be a seamstress and opened her own workshop that she named « la main de Dieu » [God's hand].

Along with sewing, she also sells "pagnes" (brightly colored lengths of African print cloth). This business is going well for her, especially as she also sews outfits that she sells to her customers. She would like to expand her sales of "pagnes" and other fabrics, so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 30 "pagnes" of new sorts.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Veronique

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice le commerce en détail de tissus, draps, rideaux et serviettes. Elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante, ce qui lui permet de pouvoir toucher un plus grand nombre de clients et de réaliser plus de profits. La demande de ses clients en ce moment est élevée, pour les satisfaire tous, elle doit rehausser son stock, raison pour laquelle elle s’adresse à WAGES pour obtenir un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter  une vingtaine de tissus, 30 draps de lits, 18 rideaux et 15 serviettes.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman sells fabrics, sheets, curtains, and napkins to earn a living. She does this door-to-door, which allows her to reach a larger number of customers and to make more profit. At present, the demand for her goods is high and in order to satisfy all her customers, she needs to add to her stock. For that reason, she is asking WAGES for a loan that will permit her to buy 20-odd fabrics, 30 bed sheets, 18 curtains, and 15 napkins.

She is married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabrics, sheets, curtains, and napkins for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying coffee and cocoa for re-sale to exporters

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Cette femme âgée de 37 ans  est venue s’installer depuis plusieurs années déjà à lomé. Actuellement elle est divorcée de son mari et a à sa charge ses deux enfants. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce et qui lui permet de  subvenir de façon convenable aux besoins de ses enfants est la vente de charbons de bois. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays. Voulant agrandir son stock pour mieux vendre, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This woman, age 37, came to Lomé to establish herself several years ago already. Currently, she is divorced, and she has two children in her care. Selling charcoal is the revenue-generating business that she operates and that allows her to support her children appropriately. She stocks up from the country’s interior. Wanting to expand her stock in order to sell more, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Amenouko

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier de dzidjolé, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, après étude du besoin de certains de ses clients, elle y a associé le commerce de produits de première nécessité. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Son stock a diminué, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes et quelques produits de premières nécessités.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of the Dzidjolé district. She is married and the mother of three. She earns revenues from commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth). After studying the needs of some of her customers, she has included commerce in staple goods. She stocks up at the grand marketplace of Lomé. Her stock is diminished. She wants to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 25 bolts of pagnes and some basic necessities.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en: Celestine H. sells fish at Denu. Celestine has received no formal education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a fisherman. Celestine has been selling fish since 1997. She is responsible for paying bills. Her loan will be used to buy fish to be processed and then sold. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand the business and build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy fish to be processed and then sold.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred G., married with two children, received education through junior high school. A saltwater fisherman since 2006, he sells his catches in Elmina. His wife is a trader. Alfred uses his income to pay bills and other expenses and will use the loan to buy fishing equipment to enhance his fishing work. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to reinvest in his enterrprise.

loans.use: Alfred will use the loan to buy fishing equipment to enhance his fishing work.

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est lancée  en 2007 dans le commerce de chaussures, elle y a associé plus tard le commerce de mèches. Elle veut agrandir son stock pour cette raison elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 paires de chaussures et  quelques mèches. Elle est divorcée.
C’est avec ce qu’elle gagne comme revenu dans cette activité qu’elle subvient à ses propres charges et à celles de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who got started in the commerce of shoes in 2007. She has included with it commerce in hair extensions. She wants to expand her inventory. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 pairs of shoes and some hair extensions. She is divorced. With what she earns in revenues from this business, she supports herself and her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris A. sells processed fish in Denu, which she has done since 2003. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. She has received no formal education. Doris uses her income to pay fees and other bills. Doris will use this loan to buy fish to be processed and sold. With the increased profits, Doris plans to expand the business and also to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy fish to be processed and sold

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca T. sells processed fish in Denu. Rebecca has received junior high school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Rebecca has been selling fish since 2001. She is responsible for paying bills. Her loan will be used to buy fish for processing and sale. She hopes to use the increased profits from her business to pay fees and help her children further their education.

loans.use: To buy fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur exerce dans la boulangerie,  il a deux types de clients, ceux qui achètent pour la consommation et ceux qui achètent pour revendre. Il réalise  de bonnes recettes et ses clients sont très satisfaits de ses services. Les matières entrant dans la fabrication du pain étant épuisées, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des sacs de blé, de sucres et divers entrants de fabrication de pain.
Il est marié et père de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This man is in the bakery business and has two types of customers; those who buy for consumption and those who buy to retail. He makes good income and his customers are satisfied with his services. Having run out of supplies for making bread, he requests a loan from WAGES to buy bags of wheat, sugar and various items used for baking bread. He is married and the father of 03 children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic supplies for baking bread

loans.name: Divinas Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Divinas” trabaja junto a  Pro-Mujer hace tres años,  a la fecha  cuenta con dieciséis socias activas, ellas han  demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría están casadas y con un promedio de 5 hijos, se ven en la necesidad de buscar  otras fuentes de ingresos ya que las necesidades de sus hijos aumentan día a día.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación por ejemplo, Gabriela realiza tejidos de chompas y mantillas, Graciela tiene un puesto de verduras, Gregoria vende cosméticos, Lucrecia realiza trabajos en cuero.
La asociación Divinas necesita capital para la  compra de mercadería y materia prima, de esta manera ampliaran sus ventas y generaran mayores ingresos que les permita sustentar a sus familias
texts.en:
The Divinas Association has worked with Pro-Mujer for 3 years. At the moment, it has 16 members, and it has proven to be an organized and dependable organization. Most of the women in the group are marrried, with an average of 5 children, and they find it necessary to find other sources of income since the needs of their children increase every day. There are different businesses within the organization. For example, Gabriela knits sweaters and baby clothes, Graciela sells vegetables, Gregoria sells cosmetics, and Lucrecia makes things out of leather. The Divinas Association needs capital for the purchase of merchandise and raw matierals so they can expand their sales, generate more income, and in this way be better able to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.en:
Dzifa A. is married and has one child. Her husband is a fisherman. Dzifa has received primary-level schooling and, since 2003, has been making a living selling processed fish at Denu. She uses her income to pay bills. 
At present, Dzifa needs a loan to be able to buy more fish for resale. She plans to use the additional profits to re-invest in her sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice G. is a single parent and has two children. She has received schooling through vocational education. Since 2004, Alice has been making a living selling processed fish at Denu: she buys the fresh fish from the fishermen, takes them home for processing, and then brings them to the market for sale. Alice uses her income to pay bills. Currently, she needs a loan, which she will use to buy fish for resale. With the new profits, Alice plans to expand the business and help her children in pursuing further education.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for resale

loans.name: Sela

texts.en: Sela K. is a single parent with four dependants. She has received schooling at a junior high school and now makes a living catching and selling fish at Denu. She has been engaged in this activity since 1991, using her income to pay fees and other bills. Sela is now asking for a loan that she will use to buy fishing equipment to improve the efficiency of her work. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sela plans to help her children continue schooling.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Cette dame vit en famille avec son époux qui est un cuisinier et ses 03 enfants, pour aider son époux dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer, elle a commencé en 2000 le commerce de  charbons de bois, de tubercules et de céréales. Elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante, ce qui lui permet de toucher un plus grand nombre de clients. Son stock de marchandises ayant connu une baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois, 5 sacs de maïs, 03 sacs d’haricot et 10 tas d’ignames.
texts.en:
This woman lives with her family: her husband, a cook, and her three children. To help her husband with day-to-day household expenses, she started doing commerce in charcoal in 2000. She operates door-to-door, which allows her to reach a larger number of customers. Since her stock of merchandise has experience a drop, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 sacks of charcoal, 5 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of beans, and 10 piles of yams.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal, grains, and yams

loans.name: Wisdom

texts.en: Wisdom Z. sells fish at sea-view in Elmina. Wisdom has received a junior high school education.  She is single and has no children. Wisdom has been selling fish since 2004. She is responsible for paying utility bills. She loan will be used to buy more fish for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Paz Y Amor 1 Group

texts.en:
Daniela O. M. is the hardworking mother of one who currently sells women’s clothing and shoes to those in her area just outsiD. of Samaná, Dominican Republic. She lives with her husband, a construction worker, and her 22-year-old son.

Daniela is currently on her eighth loan with Esperanza. Having faithfully paid back her previous seven loans, she is seeking to continue to expand the inventory which she offers to those in her neighborhood. She would love to sell new bracelets, necklaces and other accessories to augment her sales in the future and, with this loan, hopes to begin offering some of these products.

Daniela is seeking to proviD. a better living situation for her family. Her previous loans have allowed her to make her house out of concrete blocks rather than just wood and to purchase some furniture and a freezer. The profits from this business will help her to continue purchasing more food and healthcare for herself and her son.

Thank you for this Kiva loan to Daniela. You can be confident that your loan will be used wisely by all the group members for the betterment of themselves and their families.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing, shoes, necklaces and bracelets

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana K. is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen, processes it through smoking at Elmina and sells it at Denu. Juliana has received primary.  She is a widow and has two children. Juliana has been selling fish since 1988. She is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy fish to process and then sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand the business and also to help the children further their education.

loans.use: To buy fish to process and sell.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina A. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school.

Augustina sells secondhand clothes and kitchenware like knives at Abura, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a mason. She uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses.

Augustina will use the loan to buy more clothes and kitchenware for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and kitchenware for resale

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère deux enfants, son mari est un instituteur, le revenu de son époux est insuffisant pour couvrir toutes les charges du foyer, pour l’aider elle a commencé le commerce de tissus et des articles de mercerie. Ses principaux clients sont des couturières et des tailleurs. Son stock de marchandise a connu une baisse, ce qui a diminué ses recettes. Pour se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des articles de mercerie et une quinzaine de tissus de bonne qualité.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of two. Her husband is a teacher. Her husband’s income is insufficient for covering all household expenses. To help him, she started doing commerce in fabrics and sewing supplies. Her main customers are seamstresses and tailors. Her stock of merchandise has seen a drop, which has diminished her income. To stock up again, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy sewing supplies and about 15 units of good quality fabrics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Kassoumaye De Cachouane Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes un groupe de jeunes personnes encadrée par une professionnelle dans l'extraction de l'huile de myrrhe qui est un produit très demandé dans le marché local et dans tout le pays et les pays voisins. C'est un produit très rare, difficile d'obtenir et dont nous proposons de produire grâce à l'expérience acquise dans ce domaine par les femmes de notre écovillage. Les fonds vont nous permettre d'acheter les graine du fruit qui seront traitées et transformées pour l'obtention de l'huile.Cela nous aidera nous jeunes de l'écovillage de Cachouane à trouver un emploi, vu que nous habitons un écovillage enclavé à cause de sa situation géographique(île).Nous sommes certains que nous pourrons nous en sortir car ce produit est très recherché pour ses vertus curatives.
texts.en:
We are a group of young people supervised by a professional in the extraction of Oil of Myrrh, a product in very high demand locally, throughout Senegal, and in neighboring countries. It is very rare and difficult to obtain. We will be able to produce the oil thanks to the experience of women in our eco-village. The funds will be used to purchase seeds of fruit which will be treated and transformed to obtain the oil. We are young people living in a geographically isolated enclave, so we will benefit from having work here in our ecovillage. We are certain we'll be successful because this product is highly valued for its healing properties.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to produce Oil of Myrrh

loans.name: Paz Y Amor 2 Group

texts.en:
Yessenia R. (far left) has created a living selling shampoo, makeup, and other Avon beauty products from her home near Samaná, Dominican Republic. Living with her husband and three children, ages 13, 11 and 8, Yessenia travels to Santo Domingo to buy the products which she sells. Currently on her eighth loan cycle, Yessenia has faithfully repaid loans for more than three years. With the support of her husband, she has seen her fledgling business grow since she received her first loan with Esperanza.

Yessenia, previous to her loans with Esperanza, was selling clothing to those in her local area. However, finding it difficult to sell these for a good profit margin, and due to slow sales in general, she sought to change her business with her new loan. She then changed to buying her own Avon products – the shampoo, makeup, rings, etc. – and selling them locally. This way, she gets to be flexible with the products she delivers to her customers, and is able to make a better profit margin when she buys the products directly from Santo Domingo.

With these extra profits, Yessenia has been able to improve the quality of living for herself, her husband and her children. She can buy extra food and has been able to pay for unexpected medical bills. Without this financial security, sudden medical bills many times can be extremely hard to overcome, and Yessenia has been able to pay them when needed.

In the future, Yessenia first is seeking to grow her business, and to incluD. different products for sale, such as incorporating some of the clothing sales she maD. in the past and adding in more beauty products than she currently offers. With this income, she hopes to continue to proviD. for her family and support her children as they get older.

Thank you for this Kiva loan!

loans.use: Buy additional shampoo, makeup, rings and other beauty products

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de friperie, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2000 et s’approvisionne au marché local de hedzranawoé.elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. Sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, pour les satisfaire tous elle doit augmenter son stock alors elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  3 ballots de friperie.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns revenues from commerce in second-hand clothing, sheets, and the like. She has been in this business since 2000 and acquires her supplies at the local market of Hedzranawoé. She operates door-to-door. Her customers grow in number day after day. To satisfy them all, she must increase her inventory. She is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy three bales of used clothing. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. sells fish in Abura, which she has done since 1999. She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a security guard. She has received no formal education. Ama uses her income to feed and clothe the children. Ama will use this loan to buy more fish for sale. Ama plans to save and reinvest the increased profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Christine Dovi

texts.fr: Cette femme est Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, son époux est un retraité, son revenu n’arrive plus à couvrir toutes les charges du foyer. Afin de contribuer aux charges de la famille,elle a entamé le commerce des articles de mercerie, elle le fait de façon ambulante et y a associé la vente de bijoux, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Voulant augmenter son stock pour mieux vendre et gagner plus d’argent  elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter divers articles de mercerie et des bijoux.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of 02 children. Her husband is retired and his income is no more able to cover all the household expenses. In order to support the family, she started a business by selling sewing supplies and included the selling of jewelry. She does this business door-to-door and she gets her supplies in the big market of Lomé. Wanting to increase her stock to sell better and make more money, she requests a loan from WAGES to buy various sewing supplies and jewelry.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing supplies

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina N. sells saucepans in Abura. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. Georgina has received no formal education. Georgina has been selling saucepans since 2005. She is responsible for paying for housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be invested in the business to buy more saucepans for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build.

loans.use: To buy more saucepans for resale

loans.name: Sekina

texts.en:
Sekina I. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through vocational school.

Sekina sells cooked yam and stew at Abura, which she has done since 2007. Her husband is a driver. Sekina uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses.

Sekina will use the loan to buy yams and other foodstuffs from the farmers at their farms since it is cheaper buying directly from them instead of at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sekina plans to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy yams and other foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Froilina

texts.es: Froilina tiene 34 años, es natural de Ucayali, ciudad de la selva peruana, vive en Lima desde hace 10 años con su pareja y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la preparación de comida en su restaurante, siempre le ha gustado la cocina y por ello desde muy joven aprendió con su madre los mejores secretos del arte culinario. Y este oficio le ha permitido hoy mantener a su familia, siendo su esposo su mayor apoyo y fuente de motivación en todo lo que emprende, pues juntos han se esfuerzan por el progreso de su familia. Su negocio da buenos ingresos, ya que su sazón es incomparable y toda su clientela le es muy fiel. Froilina trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, siendo una labor muy cansada, ya que cada vez la clientela se incrementa y tiene que preparar más porciones. Para un futuro cercano, quiere tener un local grande que pueda decorar con bonitas sillas, mesas y vitrinas, y donde atienda más cómodamente a sus comensales. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, ella se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos, gustándole mucho su trabajo en su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado equipará mejor su restaurante y también comprará sacos de arroz, litros de aceite y demás comestibles al por mayor.
texts.en:
Froilina, 34, is from Ucayali, which is a city in the Peruvian jungle. She has lived in Lima with her husband and their three children for ten years. For three years she has made food in her restaurant. She has always liked cooking, and since was very young she learned the best secrets of the culinary arts from her mother. This work has allowed her to support her family. Her husband is her biggest help and the source of her motivation in everything she does. Together they have worked for the progress of their family. Her business produces good income. Her seasoning is incomparable, and all of her customers are very loyal. Froilina works from eight in the morning until six in the evening. It is very tiring work because her customer base keeps growing, and she has to prepare more food. In the near future she would like to have a large place that she could decorate with pretty chairs, tables, and cases. This is where she could wait on her diners more comfortably. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is always very punctual with all of her payments. She really likes working with her community bank. She will use the money she is asking for to better equip her restaurant. She will also buy sacks of rice, liters of oil, and other wholesale foods.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food to prepare her meals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme est une infirmière, afin d’aider les personnes disposant de peu de moyens à pouvoir se soigner en ayant accès aux médicaments, elle a entamé la vente de produits génériques. Elle arrive ainsi à aider beaucoup de monde. Le stock de produits génériques dont elle dispose étant en baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 4 cartons de produits comprimés, des produits sirops, des  injectables et divers produits génériques.
texts.en:
This woman is a nurse. She started selling generic drugs in order to help people with little means look after themselves by having access to medication. She thus manages to help a lot of people. Since her stock is low, she is requesting a loan through WAGES to purchase four boxes of tablets, syrups, injectables and various generic pharmaceutical products.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan O. sells soap, saucepans and sandals in Abura. She is carrying some of the pans as a sample of what she sells. She normally carries them to her customers upon demand. Joan has received junior high school education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Joana has been selling soap, saucepans and sandals since 2005. She is responsible for supporting her husband. Her loan will be used to increase the sale of her products. She hopes to use the increased profits from her business to save and build a house.

loans.use: To increase the sale of soap, saucepans and sandals

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 56 años, vive en el distrito de Collique (al norte de la ciudad de Lima) desde hace 12 años, con su pareja María de 46 años, la cual es comerciante, y con su hijo Junior de 11 años. Desde hace casi la misma edad de su hijo se dedica al oficio de electricista, siendo la actividad que aprendió desde muy joven para poder mantenerse, y la cual el día de hoy, se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. José trabaja bajo contratos, lo llaman para solucionar diferentes problemas que se presentan por avería de las instalaciones de electricidad en hogares particulares o instituciones. A él le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es independiente y lo realiza por horas, pero también es muy riesgoso, ya que más de una vez ha recibido alguna descarga de energía por no contar con las herramientas necesarias, a pesar de las precauciones que él toma. Su esposa trabaja como comerciante y juntos implementaron recientemente un pequeño restaurante, tratando de incursionar así en otros negocios para mejorar el futuro de su familia. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre ha sido muy puntual en los pagos de con su banco comunal, llamado “Estrella Azul”. Con el dinero solicitado comprará algunas herramientas para facilitar su oficio de electricista y también adquirirá lo necesario para seguir equipando su pequeño restaurante.
texts.en:
José is 56, and he has lived in the Collique district (to the north of the city of Lima) for 12 years. He lives with his wife, María. She is a 46 year old merchant. They live with their 11 year old son, Junior. Ever since he was almost the same age as his son, he has worked as an electrician. He learned to do this when he was very young in order to support himself. This trade has now become his primary source of income. José works under contracts. They call him to fix different problems when something electrical does not work in certain houses or institutions. He really likes his work; he is independent and the jobs take hours. But, it is also risky. He has received electric shocks more than once, in spite of the precautions he takes, because he did not have the necessary tools. His wife is a merchant, and together they recently started a small restaurant. They are trying to venture into other businesses to improve their family’s future. This is his fourth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and he has always been very punctual in his payments with his Community Bank, Estrella Azul. He will use the money he is asking for to buy tools to facilitate his work as an electrician. He will also get necessary items to keep equipping his small restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools and set up his restaurant

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Cette femme a appris le métier de la tresse, mais ne gagnant pas suffisamment de revenu de son activité, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de détail de mèches. Cela lui permet de gagner un meilleur revenu. Elle a une ancienneté de 5 ans dans ce commerce, elle fait ce commerce de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Voulant reconstituer son stock qui s’épuise, elle sollicite  de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une trentaine de mèches et divers.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un  enfant.
texts.en:
Akossiwa C. learned to braid hair, but this activity did not generate sufficient income, so she started a retail business selling hairpieces. This allows her to earn more money. She has been doing this for five years,selling her goods door-to-door and stocking up in the big market at Lomé. Wishing to build up her diminishing stock, she is requesting a loan from Kiva Field Partner, WAGES, to buy 30 hairpieces and various other items. Mrs. C. is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hairpieces

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis Enrique tiene 39 años, vive con su esposa Gabi de 38 años y sus hijos: Julio de 19, Jorge de 13 y Caleb de 5 añitos en su casa propia. Desde hace varios años atrás se dedica a brindar el servicio de trasporte de pasajeros (taxi), ya que siempre le atrajo el manejo y aprendió desde muy joven en carros de familiares y amigos, siendo estos últimos quienes lo animaron a incursionar en este trabajo. Actualmente se encuentra feliz con su trabajo, ya que le da mucha independencia y buenas ganancias económicas. Su jornada es desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, descansando solamente para almorzar y cenar, lo cual ha hecho que todos sus esfuerzos tengan buenos frutos y pueda llevar el dinero necesario para mantener la estabilidad de su hogar. Lamentablemente lo más complicado de su trabajo es el estrés que se vive día a día con el tráfico y los malos conductores. En un futuro, a Luis Enrique le gustaría tener una flota de taxis para conformar su propia empresa de transportes. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, por lo que se compromete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado hará refaccionar su auto, pues presenta algunas averías, también realizará los pagos necesarios para actualizar sus documentos de circulación.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique is 39 years old, and lives with his wife Gabi (38) and their sons, Julio (19), Jorge (13), and Caleb (5), in their own house. For several years, he has been providing passenger transportation services in a taxi, because he was always interested in driving and learned to drive quite young in cars belonging to his family and friends. His friends encouraged him to start this work.

Now he is happy with his job, since it gives him a lot of independence as well as a good income. His workday is from 8 in the morning until 9 at night, with breaks only for lunch and dinner. All his efforts have been fruitful and he is able to earn the money needed for his family to have stability. Unfortunately, the worst part of his job is the stress he lives with every day with traffic and bad drivers. In the future, Luis Enrique would like to have a fleet of taxis to create his own transportation company.

This is his first loan with PRISMA Microfinance, and he is committed to being punctual with all his payments. With the requested money, he will repair his vehicle, which has had several breakdowns. He will also make the necessary payments to update his traffic documents.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and updating his vehicle's documents

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zenayda

texts.es: Zenayda tiene 29 años, es natural de la ciudad de Huánuco (sierra central peruana), pero reside en la ciudad de Lima desde hace 10 años con su hija Anai de 9 años de edad, viven en su casa propia. Zenayda siempre ha sido muy trabajadora y luchadora, incursionó en varios oficios, los cuales requerían que se mantenga fuera de su hogar dejando sola su pequeña, es por eso que decidió optar por una labor que pueda realizar desde su casa para poder pasar tiempo con su niña. Entonces, desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, actividad que le da los ingresos necesarios para que pueda solventar las necesidades de su hija, la cual es su razón de vivir. Cada día, luego de que su hija se va al colegio, Zenayda sale a ofrecer sus prendas a sus vecinas y amigos, los cuales siempre le tienen algún pedido debido a la buena calidad de la ropa que les ofrece. Actualmente está vendiendo polares (prendas hechas de una tela denominada polar, muy caliente) debido al frío de esta época del año. Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda de ropa e ir progresando cada día más. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, en su banco comunal, denominado “Estrella Azul”, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque todos son muy amigos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para la época de invierno.
texts.en:
Zenayda, 29, is from the city of Huánuco (central Peruvian mountain range). She has lived in the city of Lima for ten years. She lives with her nine year old daughter, Anai. They live in their own house. Zenayda has always been a hard worker and a fighter. She has done various jobs, which required her to be away from home and to leave her small daughter alone. That is why she decided to choose work that she could do from home, to be able to spend time with her daughter. She has been selling clothes for two years. This gives her the necessary income to be able to afford her daughter’s necessities. Her daughter is her reason for living. Each day, after her daughter goes to school, Zenayda leaves to sell clothes to her neighbors and friends. They always order from her because of the good quality of clothing that she sells. She is currently selling “polares” (clothes made from a material called polar, very warm) because it is very cold at this time of year. Her wish for the future is to have a clothing store and to keep progressing more each day. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She really likes working with her Community Bank, Estrella Azul, because all of them are good friends. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a greater quantity of clothes for the winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jeannettte Del Rosario

texts.es: Jeannette del Rosario E. Díaz tiene 40 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian con el esfuerzo de Jeannette. El negocio inicio hace 17 años, en su vivienda comenzó a vender refrescos naturales, por lo que logro tener demanda por sus clientes, posteriormente se ubico en las afueras del mercado. Es aquí donde está situada actualmente, por lo que con este negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia. Es destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de frutas para la elaboración de sus refrescos naturales, pan con mantequilla. Su deseo es obtener otra fuente de ingresos, para su familia.
texts.en:
Jeannette del Rosario E. Díaz is 40, married, and she is raising three children. The children go to school because of Jeannette’s efforts. She started her business 17 years ago. She started selling natural beverages from her home. She managed to have customer demand, so she later located herself outside of the market. That is where she is currently located. Through this business she has been able to support her family. She will use the loan to buy bread, butter, and fruit to make her natural beverages. Her wish is to obtain another source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Garcia Lopez Solidarity Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario García L. está conformado por 2 señoras. Que han luchado para salir adelante con sus negocios.  Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas, pero su manera de pensar las reúne para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias. Luydi Mercedes García L. tiene 39 años de edad. Su actividad económica es venta de productos lácteos. Su negocio nació hace más de 10 años, por lo que ella se levanta muy mañana para la preparación de las cuajadas, la mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinos. María de la Concepción García L. 42 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de productos lácteos. Por lo que ha sido un medio de vida para su familia. La inversión del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Las 2 son personas muy humildes, que les gusta trabajar y que a pesar de no poseer un alto nivel académico de estudio. No les falta el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
The García L. solidarity group is made up of two women who have made great efforts to improve their businesses. They work in different fields, but they are united by their way of thinking so they can improve their families' quality of life. Luydi Mercedes García L. is 39 years old. She sells dairy products. She started her business more than 10 years ago, and gets up very early every morning to prepare cuajadas (milk curd). Most of her clients are neighbors. María de la Concepción García L. is 42 years old. She's a single mother with one son. She sells dairy products, which has been a way to support her family. The financing will be used as working capital to buy supplies. They are both simple people who like to work, even though they don't have a lot of formal education. They have enough for their daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Elevit

texts.es: Elevit tiene 50 años, es viuda desde hace un año y vive con sus 2 hijos y su madre. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de bebidas (gaseosas y cerveza) en su casa, negocio en el que le está yendo bien, debido a que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada y cercana a un parque donde acuden varios deportistas y requieren siempre de sus bebidas heladas. A Elvit le gusta mucho su trabajo porque por medio del mismo conoce a muchas personas con quienes mantiene conversaciones interesantes y entretenidas. Además, con las ganancias que obtiene diariamente consigue solventar los gastos de su hogar, y también está ahorrando para tener una tienda de comestibles en un futuro cercano. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP y lo que le agrada de trabajar con su grupo es hay mucha confianza y unión entre todos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará algunas sillas y mesas para colocar fuera de su casa y sean usadas por sus clientes. También incrementará la cantidad de bebidas que vende.
texts.en:
Elevit is 50 years old. She's been widowed for a year and lives with her two children and her mother. She's been selling beverages (soft drinks and beer) from her home for two years, and the business is going well because she's in a bustling area near a park used by a variety of athletes who always need a cold drink. Elevit likes her work a lot because she meets a lot of people and has interesting, engaging conversations. In addition, she uses her earnings to cover her family's expenses, and she's also saving up so she can have a grocery store in the near future. This is her third loan with MFP, and what she likes about working with her group is the level of trust and community among all the members. She will use the money requested to buy some chairs and tables to place outside her house for customers to use. She will also increase the number of drinks she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock and buy furniture for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. sells shoes and clothes at Abura. She has received vocational education. She is married and has two children and is responsible for feeding and clothing the children. Her husband is a secretary.

Veronica has been selling shoes and clothes since 2005. Her loan will be invested in her shoes and clothing business by increasing her stock. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build her business.		

On her lap are some of the footwear used as samples of what she trades in.

loans.use: To invest in her shoes and clothing business by increasing her stock

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through senior high school. Her husband is a mason.

Vida sells earrings, panties and cosmetics at Abura, which she has done since 2007. Vida uses her income to pay for house-keeping expenses. She will use the loan to buy more of the cosmetics since they are in high demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics since they are in high demand by her customers

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 32 años, es padre soltero de una pequeña de 5 añitos que ya empezó a estudiar, y por el momento viven en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de cervezas en un local que alquiló en una zona turística de su ciudad. Los sábados y domingos complementa a sus bebidas con la venta de parrilladas y otros platillos típicos de su región como: juanes (arroz con pollo, huevo y aceitunas), tacachos (plátano aplastado con aceite y carne de cerdo), entre otros. A Jorge le gusta atender con mucha amabilidad a sus clientes para que sean asiduos a su establecimiento, ya que de eso dependerá el incremento de sus ganancias. Su deseo como padre es brindarle todo lo necesario a su hija, quien es el motivo de su esfuerzo diario, pues desea verla en el futuro hecha una buena profesional. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy entusiasmado por su trabajo en su banco comunal, donde ha notado que todas son personas responsables y existe mucho compañerismo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más cervezas e ingredientes para sus comidas del fin de semana.
texts.en:
Jorge is 32 years old. He's a single father with a little five-year-old daughter who's already in school. For the time being, the two of them live with his parents. For two years he's been selling beers in a rented space in a touristed area of the city. On Saturdays and Sundays he rounds out his beverages by offering grilled meats and other typical foods of the region such as juanes (rice with chicken, eggs, and olives) and tacachos (mashed plantain with pork). Jorge likes treating his customers well so they are loyal to his establishment, since any increase in his earnings depends on that. As a father, he wants to provide his daughter with everything she needs. It is for her sake that he works so hard and he'd like to see her find a good job in the future. This is his first loan with MFP and he's very enthusiastic about his work with his communal bank, where he has seen that all the members are responsible, collegial people. He will use the requested loan to buy more beer and ingredients for his weekend meals.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Madeleine Ngoné

texts.fr: Madeleine Ngoné âgée de 36 ans est mariée et mère de 03 enfants à sa charge. Son activité est la vente de papaye et de manioc. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madeleine Ngoné, age 36, is married and the mother of three children in her care. Her business involves selling papayas and cassava. She wants to bolster her business. Her revenues enable her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell papayas and yuca (cassava)

loans.name: Limber

texts.es: Limber tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja y madre de 2 pequeños hijos. Por el momento están viviendo en casa de su madre. Desde hace un año tiene un carrito salchipapero (móvil para preparar frituras al paso), con el que todas las noches trabaja vendiendo salchipollo (pollo frito con papas) y salchipapas (salchichas con papas fritas) en las afueras de su casa. Para esta actividad cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien es la encargada de la preparación, mientras él atiende a los clientes. Adicionalmente, por las mañanas, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro y esta actividad la ejerce desde que tenía 18 años. Con ambos negocios, Limber se siente muy contento porque vienen produciendo buenas ganancias para el sostenimiento de su familia. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP y una de las cosas que más le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas responsables y solidarias. El dinero que solita será usado en la compra de mesas, sillas y cubiertos para el uso de sus comensales. También hará reparar su motocarro porque está presentando algunos problemas mecánicos.
texts.en:
Limber is 27 years old. He lives with his partner who is the mother of his two small children. At this time they are living in his mother’s house. For a year he has had a small cart (it is a mobile cart where he can fry food as he moves from place to place). Every night he sells fried chicken and French fries or sausage and French fries from the cart in the suburbs near his house. In order to do this work, he depends on this wife to be in charge of the preparation of the food while he serves his customers. Also, in the mornings he transports people in his car. He has served as a driver since he was eighteen years old. Limber is happy with both of these businesses because they provide a good income that he uses to support his family. This is his second loan from MFP. One of the things he likes the most about the cooperative bank is that his colleagues are personally responsible and they are a cohesive group. The money that he is asking for will be used to buy tables, chairs and tablecloths that will be used by his diners. Also he will fix his car because it has been having some mechanical problems.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for his restaurant business and to fix his car.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth B. is married, has four dependents and a junior high school education. She has been selling fish in Abura since 2002.  Her husband is a mason. She is responsible for supporting her husband. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell. She plans to use the new profits to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity A. has a small boutique in Abura where she sells panties. Charity is married with two children and has received a junior high school education. Her husband is a trader and she is responsible for supporting him. Charity has been selling panties since 2008.  Her loan will be used to buy more and varied clothing for sale. She plans to use the new profits from her business to re-invest.

loans.use: To buy more and varied clothing.

loans.name: Lisvania Del Carmen

texts.es: Lisvania del Carmen P. E. tiene 26 años. Es una joven soltera. Lisvania es una joven emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante. La humilde actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que su Mama era la que se dedicaba a este negocio, pero al ver la responsabilidad de su hija decide que ella se haga cargo del negocio. Además Lisvania está cursando el 4 año de su carrera, el pago de su universidad, lo realiza ella misma y también contribuye con los gastos de su hogar. Por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes son sus amigos de la universidad, vecinos y amistades. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cosméticos, colonia y alguna ropa interior. Ya que corresponden a diferentes casas comerciales. su mayor sueño es finalizar sus estudios y mantener esta fuente de ingreso para salir adelante con su familia y sus metas.
texts.en:
Lisvania del Carmen P. E. is a 26 year old single woman. She is a young entrepreneur who is eager to get ahead. Her small business involves selling cosmetics. She has been engaged in this activity for 6 years and her mother was also in the same line of business. Lisvania is studying for her four year degree, so she is paying for her university tuition as well as her household expenses. Most of her customers are classmates, neighbors and friends.

She will use her loan to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, colognes and some undergarments, which she obtains from different commercial vendors. Her biggest dream is to finish her studies and earn a good living so that her family can get ahead and reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos I. O. vive en el municipio de Sensuntepeque en el departamento de Cabañas. Santos tiene45 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos Luis de 17 años, Karina de 11 años y Josué de 7 años de edad, los tres niños se encuentran estudiando.  Santos lleva en sus hombros toda la responsabilidad para con sus hijos y por medio de su negocio es que ha logrado sostenerse y salir adelante todo el tiempo ya que Santos es un madre muy responsable y trabajadora, tiene su negocio en ventas de pupusas, el cual está situado dentro de su casa donde sus clientes potenciales son todos los vecinos de la zona que compran mucho de las pupusas de Santos, el destino del crédito que solicita Santos es para compra materia prima y así aumentar su producción de pupusas ayudando a obtener mayores ganancias
texts.en:
Santos I. O. lives in the town of Sensuntepeque in the Cabañas district. She is a 45 year old single mother of three children: Luis – 17, Karina – 11, and Josué – 7. All three are students. Santos bears the entire responsibility for her children on her shoulders, and through her business, she has been able to sustain her family and move forward this entire time. She is a very responsible and hardworking mother. Her business involves making and selling pupusas (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) out of her home. Her potential customers are all her neighbors in the district who buy many pupusas.

Santos is requesting a loan to buy ingredients so that she can increase her production and earn more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth S. is a single parent with one child. She has been schooled through junior high school. Since 2007, Elizabeth has sold cooked yams and stew in Abura. Elizabeth uses her income to pay bills. Elizabeth will use the loan to expand her business by buying fresh yams and other ingredients for the food she prepares and sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to re-invest.

loans.use: To buy yams and other ingredients

loans.name: James

texts.en: Since 2004, James A. has been selling car engine oil and other lubricants in Abura. James has received a junior high school education.  He is married and has one child. His wife is a trader. She is responsible for paying fees. His loan will be used to buy more engine oil for resale. He hopes to save the new profits from his business to re-invest.

loans.use: To buy engine oil for resale.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja, quien es transportista de motocarro, y con sus 3 hijos, quienes están en edad escolar. Desde hace 8 años se dedica la venta de frutas regionales (naranjas, coconas, mandarinas, plátanos, etc.), negocio que acondiciona todos los días en las afueras de su casa. Gracias a esta actividad puede solventar los gastos de educación de sus hijos quienes se sienten muy orgullosos de tener una madre como ella. A Lizbeth le gusta su trabajo porque se siente útil ante la sociedad y porque se entretiene mucho conversando con sus clientes. Su deseo a futuro es poder crecer hasta el punto de tener un minimarket donde ofrezca toda clase de productos. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que puede confiar en el trabajo responsable de sus compañeros, y ellos confían en ella. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más frutas para implementar su negocio, también adquirirá madera para mandar a construir un kiosco donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is 32 years old and the mother of 3 school-aged children. She lives with her husband, who is a motorcar driver. For the past 8 years, she has been selling regional fruits (oranges, coconuts, tangerines, bananas, etc.). Her business is well-stocked every day outside of her home. Thanks to her sales, she can afford to educate her children, who are very proud to have a mother like her. Lizbeth enjoys her work because she feels useful to society and likes entertaining and talking with her customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business to the point that she can convert it into a minimarket where she sells all types of products.

This is her 8th loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her communal bank group because the members are responsible and they have confidence in her. With the money she is requesting, she will buy more fruit for her business and also purchase wood to build a kiosk from which she can sell with greater ease.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory & build a kiosk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica G. is a single parent with one child. She has received schooling through junior high school.  Since 2006, Monica has sold fresh eggs in Abura. Monica uses her income to pay for house-keeping expenses. Monica will use the loan to purchase more crates of eggs for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Monica plans to re-invest.	

In the photo, Monica is holding some egg crates on top of her head as an example of what she sells.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Martin

texts.es: Carlos Martin G. P. vive en casa propia, con su esposa María y sus 4 hijos. Carlos brinda los servicios de alquiler de molino. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, el inicio por cuenta propia, en estos momentos Carlos se encuentra enfermo, la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Por lo que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, ya que estos son los ingresos que mantienen a su familia. Es un hombre que ha tenido muy buenas experiencias ya que solamente no se ha dedicado a esta actividad. Es por ese motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la proporcionarle el mantenimiento necesario a su molino y comprarle las herramientas necesarias. Su mayor deseo es de recuperarse para ayudar a su esposa con el cuido de sus hijos y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Carlos Martín G. P. owns the home where he lives with his wife, María, and their four children. Carlos rents a mill located in his house. He opened the business on his own and has operated it for the past 6 years. He has put a lot of effort in the business and he and his family have been able to get ahead on the income it generates. He is a well-rounded individual who has been involved in other activities as well. He will use the loan to finance maintenance for the mill and to buy tools for it. Carlos has been ill. His most important goal now is to get better and help his wife take care of the children so that they can grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ohemaa

texts.en: Ohemaa N. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Ohemaa sells secondhand bags at Abura, which she has done since 1991. Her husband is a taxi driver. Ohemaa uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses. She will use this loan to purchase bails of bags for resale. With the new profits, Ohemaa plans to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase bails of bags for resale

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia O. C. reside en el municipio de Sensuntepeque en el departamento de Cabañas. A sus 36 años María se encuentra casada y madre de tres hijos todos aun menores de edad y estudiando. Edwin el esposo de María trabaja como albañil y aporta a la familia US $50 mensuales, con estos ingresos la familia no lograría salir adelante, es por ello que María monto hace ya diez años su propio negocio el cual le genera ingresos que son de gran ayuda para la familia, el negocio de María es la venta de variedad de zapatos, se encuentra ubicado en el mercado municipal de la  zona, donde hay mucha afluencia de personas lo cual le ayuda a vender más rápido sus zapatos;  el crédito que solicita María es para la compra de nuevos estilos en zapatos que le ayudaran aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Julia O. C. lives in the municipality of Sensuntepeque in the province of Cabañas. María is 36 years old, married and the mother of three children who are still in school. Her husband, Edwin, is a mason. He earns US $50 a month, which was not enough for the family to get ahead. For this reason María opened her own business 10 years ago. The income it generates is very important to her family. She sells different types of shoes at the municipal market. The market is very well attended which allows for quick turnover of her merchandise. María will use the loan to buy new shoe styles, which will help her increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new shoe styles

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah Q. sells body creams and other cosmetic products in Abura. Sarah has received polytechnic education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an engineer. Sarah has been selling body creams and other cosmetic products since 2002. She is responsible for paying fees and supporting her husband. Her loan will be used to expand the business by increasing the quantity of cosmetics she buys for resale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 55 años, es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes y tienen sus propias familias. Ella vive sola en su casa propia. Hace 15 años empezó a trabajar como costurera, pero ahora ya es la administradora de su propio negocio, donde lleva un periodo de 2 años en su local propio. Luisa tiene una pequeña tienda de ropa y accesorios típicos de su región. Las prendas que vende son sólo para mujeres y son confeccionadas por otras personas que trabajan para ella. Lo que le gusta de esta labor es relacionarse con muchas personas, inclusive la visitan algunos artistas del medio del espectáculo local, quienes no dejan de probarse y tomarse fotos con sus prendas, lo que es una buena publicidad para su negocio. El deseo a futuro de Luisa es tener otras tiendas en diferentes lugares de su ciudad. Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos trabajan con mucha responsabilidad y ha hecho muy buenas amistades. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más materiales textiles para seguir confeccionando sus prendas.
texts.en:
Luisa is 55 years old. Her two children do not depend on her anymore and have their own families. She lives by herself in her own home. Luisa started working as a seamstress 15 years ago and now runs her own business, a small clothing shop, where she also sells traditional accessories from the region. She sells women’s apparel exclusively, made by people whom she hires. She likes what she does especially well because of the opportunity to meet many people. Local performance artists come to the shop to try on the clothing she sells and have their pictures taken, which is good publicity for the business. Her goal is to eventually own several stores in various parts of the city. This is the 4th loan she secures from MFP. She enjoys working with the communal bank because people there are very responsible and many have become good friends. Luisa will use the loan to buy textiles for new clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textiles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. has a small bar where she sells soft drinks in Abura. Grace has received junior high school education. She is married and has four dependants. Her husband is an account clerk. Grace has been selling soft drinks for some time now. She is responsible for paying housekeeping bills. Her loan will be used to buy crates of minerals (soft drinks) to expand the business. She hopes to use the new profits to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy crates of minerals (soft drinks)

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa G. L. D. C. resiD. en el municipio D. Sensuntepeque en el departamento D. Cabañas. Teresa tiene 51 años D. edad vive con su esposo y su hijo D. 17 años llamado Elías estudiante D. bachillerato. Teresa es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora para prueba  D. ello vale decir que tiene dieciséis  años D. dedicarse a la alta costura, negocio que le deja ganancias satisfactorias, Teresa tiene una buena clientela ya que es muy delicada y minuciosa para la elaboración D. sus prendas cosa que se ve reflejada al finalizar sus vestidos y es por eso que sus clientes la prefieren, el crédito que solicita Teresa es para la comprar tela que utilizara para fabricar vestidos D. porristas y bandas D. paz que salen a desfilar por las calles en pocas semanas que se acerca nuestro día D. independencia patria.
texts.en:
Teresa G. L. D. C. lives in the municipality of Sensuntepeque in the province of Cabañas. She is 51 and lives with her husband and her 17 year old son, Elías, who is a high school student. Teresa is responsible and hard working. Proof of that is the fact that she has been able to earn a good living in the high fashion business for the past 16 years. Teresa has a good customer base. Her clients prefer her services because she is careful and meticulous in her work; you can see the results in the dresses she makes. She will use the loan to buy material to make clothing for the cheerleaders and peace bands that will participate in a few weeks in the parades for Independence Day.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for clothing

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo, quien es maestro constructor, y con sus 2 hijos estudiantes que la apoyan en todo. “Magui”, como todos la conocen se dedica a la venta de bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas), negocio que acondiciona en un espacio frente a su casa. Hace 10 años que realiza esta actividad y desde que sus hijos crecieron, cada vez que están libres de sus labores escolares la ayudan en la atención de los clientes. Magui es muy amable con sus clientes, pero también muy cuidadosa para evitar que abusen de su confianza. Ella considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio es debido a la gran demanda que hay de las bebidas, en cualquier momento del día por el intenso calor de su región, además es la única persona en su zona que vende estos productos. Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP, menciona que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos son muy cumplidos con sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de la cantidad de las bebidas que vende.
texts.en:
Margarita is 35 years old. She lives with her husband, a master builder, and with her two school age children who support her in everything she does. People know her by "Magui". She has been selling soft drinks and beer for the past 10 years out of a space she has dedicated for the business in front of her house. Now that her children are older, they help her in the store when they are done with their school work. Magui is kind and attentive to her customers, but she is also very careful not to allow them to take advantage of her. She attributes the profitability of the business to the fact that the region where she lives is very hot and there is high demand throughout the day for the types of drinks she sells. She is also the only person in her area to sell these products. She has been granted 11 MFP loans and says that she enjoys working with the communal bank because everyone there meets their obligations. She will use the loan to increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel A. is married and has four dependants. She has received schooling through junior high school. Mabel sells kenkey in Abura, which she has done since 1994. In the bowl is a sample of kenkey. Her husband is a driver. Mabel uses her income to support her husband. Mabel will use this loan to purchase more maize to enable her to cook on a larger scale. With the profits, she plans to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase maize

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter M. is married to Monicah Wanjiru and they have two school-going children. He runs a general shop that sells food and household goods in small quantities to the residents of a city council estate in Naivasha Town. Peter became interested in joining KADET after hearing some of his friends talking about it and how it had assisted them in boosting their businesses. This is Peter's second loan from KADET and he plans to increase the variety of household goods he sells to his clients so that they may get most of the things they need in his shop without needing to go far away to other shops. Peter's dream is to one day move into a bigger premises and open a mini supermarket. He also hopes to venture into the restaurant business. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his shop

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice M. has a small bar where she sells cooked rice and stew at Abura. Alice has received junior high school education. She is married and has four dependents and is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. Her husband is a driver.

Alice has been selling cooked rice and stew since 2001. The loan will be used to buy bags of rice to run the business on a larger scale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice to run the business on a larger scale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel M. de 47 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad vive solamente con su esposa Doña Ana de 48 años quien es comerciante. Samuel posee un negocio en su casa se trata de un tienda de productos de consumo de primera necesidad donde los comercializa al detalle y también por mayoreo, Samuel solicita un crédito ya que por vender al por mayor necesita mayores cantidades en productos y en esta ocasión desea surtir de aceite para cocina, cereales y otros. Samuel ya ha obtenido créditos anteriormente los cuales se encuentran cancelados  y se califica como un cliente responsable en todos sus pagos.
texts.en:
Samuel M., 47, lives in the La Libertad department. He lives with his 48 year old wife, Ana. She is a merchant. Samuel has a store in his house. He sells daily basic needs products that are consumed daily. He sells retail and also for wholesale. Samuel is asking for a loan because selling wholesale requires a greater quantity of products. He wants to stock his store with cooking oil, cereal, and other things. Samuel has had previous loans, which have been paid back. He qualifies as a responsible client in all of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock his business

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Carlos José M. Juárez tiene 49 años. Vive con su pareja y madre de sus 4 hijos. Desde muy Joven Carlos tuvo que trabajar para sacar a su familia adelante. Por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de materiales de ferretería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio con fondos propios para salir adelante con este humilde negocio. Es destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de lámparas, cerraduras, sierras y otros productos.
texts.en:
Carlos José M. Juárez is 49 years old. He lives with his partner, who is the mother of his 4 children. Since he was very young, Carlos had to work to help his family. He sells hardware supplies. He has been doing this for 7 years, and he started the business with his own funds so that he could overcome his problems with this humble business. The loan will be used as capital to buy lamps, locks, saws and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his business

loans.name: Marily

texts.es: Marily tiene 24 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 pequeños hijos. Hace algunos años atrás pudo comprar un motocarro con el que su esposo se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y se encarga de mantener el vehículo en perfectas condiciones. Por otro lado, Marily se dedica a la venta de ropa por los distintos lugares de su zona de forma ambulante, en el horario que ella misma se ha establecido, de 6 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde; trabajar la hace sentirse útil, menciona. Esta joven pareja está luchando por salir adelante y forjarse un futuro, pues su deseo es poder brindarles a sus hijos una adecuada educación. Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros y compañeras son personas tranquilas y bien organizadas. El dinero que solicita será usado en el mantenimiento y reparación de su motocarro, lo que le costará un aproximado de 800 soles, lo restante será invertido en la compra de más ropa.
texts.en:
Marily is 24 years old and lives with her partner, who is the father of her two young children. Some years ago, she was able to buy a motorcar, with which her husband transports passengers. He also takes care of the vehicle and keeps it in perfect condition. Marily sells clothes in different places in the area by traveling; she has set her schedule so that she works from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening. She says that working makes her feel useful. This young couple is fighting to overcome their problems and create a future, because their dream is to offer their children a good education. She has already gotten three loans from MFP, and what she likes most about her community bank is that her colleagues are calm and well-organized people. The money that she is requesting will be used to maintain and repair her motorcar, which will cost approximately 800 soles. The rest of the loan will be invested to buy more clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her motorcar and increase her merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed Y. is married and has two children. His wife is a seamstress. He has received schooling through junior high school.

Ahmed sells timber logs at Abura, which he has done for quite some time now. He uses his income to pay fees and housekeeping expenses.

Ahmed will use the loan to purchase to plywood for sale since it is in high demand. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ahmed plans to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase to plywood for sale since it is in high demand

loans.name: Fátima Yesenia

texts.es: Fátima Yesenia C. reside en el departamento de La Libertad. A sus cortos 20 años de edad Fátima ya es madre de dos niños Alex de 6 años y Mario de 6 meses. Fátima vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos hace ya seis años, en su mayoría sus  compradores son clientes individuales y también por comerciantes ya que Fátima cuenta con bajos precios y un producto muy fresco, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el muelle del puerto de La Libertad una zona con mucha afluencia nacional y extranjera, el crédito que solicita Fátima es para aumentar su inventario para poder percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Fátima Yesenia C. lives in the department of La Libertad. At her young age of 20, Fátima is already the mother of 2 children, Alex, who is 6 years old, and Mario, who is 6 months old. Fátima lives with her husband and children. She has sold seafood for 6 years. For the most part, her customers are individual clients and she also serves merchants, since she has low prices and fresh products. Her business is located on the dock in La Libertad, which is an area with a lot of domestic and foreign abundance. The loan that Fátima is requesting will be used to increase her inventory so that she can have larger earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes S. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Her husband is a security guard.

Agnes sells powder, pomade and clothes at Abura, which she has done since 1999 and uses her income to support the family. She will use the loan to expand her cosmetics business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: To expand her cosmetics business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo, su hija, su yerno y su nieto en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 meses tiene una pequeña bodega que implementó en un espacio de su casa, donde vende abarrotes, productos de primera necesidad y bebidas. Nancy atiende durante todo el día y le va muy bien por encontrarse ubicada en una zona muy transitada y concurrida por muchas personas. Para ella es muy importante brindar una buena atención a sus clientes para que regresen a comprar en su negocio; por otro lado, le gusta mucho esta actividad porque la mantiene activa. Para un futuro cercano, Nancy quiere ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en un minimarket donde ofrezca gran variedad de productos. Este es su 5to crédito con MFP y lo que más le agrada de su grupo es que son personas responsables y trabajadoras. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más abarrotes y gaseosas para surtir mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Nancy is 37. She lives with her husband, daughter, son-in-law, and granddaughter in her own house. She has had a small store, which she set up in a space in her house, for eight months. She sells groceries, basic needs products, and drinks. Nancy works at the store all day. It is going very well for her because it is located is a heavily traveled and busy area. It is important to her to offer her customers good attention so that they come back to shop in her store. On the other hand, she really likes this work because it keeps her active. In the near future Nancy would like to expand her business and convert it into a mini market where she would sell a great variety of products. This is her fifth loan with MFP. What pleases her the most about her group is that the people are responsible and hard working. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more groceries and soft drinks to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima A. is married and has two children. She has received no formal education. Her husband is a sawmill operator.

Fatima runs a cold store where she sells frozen meat and fish at Abura, which she has done since 2007. She uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses.

Fatima will use the loan to buy more meat and fish to satisfy her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more meat and fish to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Thioro

texts.fr: Thioro est une femme mariée de 53 ans qui s’active dans la plantation  et le commerce de bananes. Elle veut renforcer son activité. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter du de l’engrais, de la paille, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le fonçage, les frais d’arrosage et de faire face à tous les frais pour la production et vente de banane.
texts.en:
Thioro is a married women of 53 who is active in planting and in the commerce of bananas. She wants to bolster her business. The loan she is requesting will enable her to buy some fertilizer and straw and to pay for the labor for drilling, as well as for the costs of irrigation and those of producing and selling bananas.
