Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting and the banana business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina M. H. de 53 años de edad  reside en el municipio Apopa del departamento de San Salvador. Marcelina  vive con su hija que es empleada y su nieta de 8 años que se encuentra estudiando la primaria. Marcelina posee su negocio dentro de su casa donde por las mañana hace ventas de pupusas y por la tarde vende almuerzos con variedad de platillos hechos en casa, el negocio de Marcelina también ofrece variedad de frutas todo el tiempo, el crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad es para la invertir en la compra de materia prima de esta manera aumentara la producción de sus platillos ayudando a obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marcelina M. H., 53, lives in the Apopa municipality in the San Salvador department. Marcelina lives with her daughter, a maid, and her eight year old granddaughter who goes to elementary school. Marcelina has a business in her house where she sells pupusas (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) in the mornings. In the afternoon she sells lunches, a variety of dishes, made in her home. Marcelina’s business also offers a variety of fruits all of the time. The loan she is asking for is to invest in raw materials to increase the production of her dishes, which will help her produce greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo tiene 25 años, vive junto a su pareja y madre de su pequeño de 2 meses de nacido. Por el momento están viviendo en la casa de su madre, donde también vive su hermana. Desde hace 3 años tiene en su casa una pequeña bodega donde vende productos de primera necesidad y bebidas, este negocio está abierto durante todo el día, todos los días. Pero hace poco tiempo, Pablo encontró un trabajo donde le ofrecían una buena remuneración, por lo que ha dejado encargada de su tienda a su esposa, estando él pendiente de su correcta administración. Uno de los factores que contribuyen a la rentabilidad de su negocio es que en su zona es la única tienda de comestibles. Y esto hace que Pablo mira el futuro de su pequeña bodega convertida en una tienda grande que ofrezca gran variedad de productos, donde sus vecinos encuentren todo lo que necesiten a un precio accesible. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes se apoyan entre sí. Él invertirá el dinero que solicita comprando productos de primera necesidad y así implementará su negocio adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Pablo is 25 years old and lives with his partner and their 2 month old child. At the moment, he resides in his mother’s house along with his sister. For the past three years, he has been operating a small grocery store from home where he sells essential goods and beverages. The business is open 24 hours every day. Pablo recently found a job that pays a good salary, so he left the store in charge of his wife to continue operating properly. One of the reasons why his business is so profitable is because it is the only grocery store in the area. In the future, Pablo would like to expand his small grocery into a larger store that offers a variety of products and where his neighbors can find anything they need at an affordable price.

This is Pablo’s second loan with MFP and he enjoys working with his communal bank because all the members support one another. He will use the proceeds of his loan to purchase essential goods so that his business can continue running smoothly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is divorced and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high school.

Grace sells gari (a fried cassava dish), sugar and fish at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 1989. She uses her income to pay bills.

Grace will use the loan to buy more stock for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for resale

loans.name: Aberwa

texts.en:
Aberwa Y. is married and has three children. She has received schooling but no formal education. Her husband is a driver.

Aberwa sells kenkey at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 2001. Kenkey is a Ghanaian dish which is prepared from fermented corn dough that is cooked and wrapped in the corn husk and eaten with hot pepper. Aberwa uses her income to pay fees and bills.

Aberwa will use the loan to buy foodstuffs like maize and other ingredients for the preparation of the kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aberwa plans to help educate her children.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like maize and other ingredients for making kenkey

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana tiene 44 años, tiene 3 hijos y vive con su esposo, quien trabaja en una maderera. Desde hace 2 años implementó en su casa unos módulos con computadoras para brindar el servicio de internet, Viviana aprovechó la oportunidad porque su vivienda está ubicada frente a una institución educativa y sus principales clientes son los estudiantes. Por otro lado, es propietaria de 2 motocarros, que son manejados por chóferes particulares a quienes contrata para que se dedique a brindar transporte de pasajeros y ella administra las ganancias diarias. Viviana está muy contenta con sus negocios porque ambos le están sirviendo para incrementar los ingresos económicos de su familia. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que entre todos son muy unidos y solidarios. Con el dinero que ahora solicita hará reparar 2 de sus monitores de sus computadoras, también comprará repuestos para el mantenimiento de sus motocarros.
texts.en:
Viviana is 44 years old with three children. She lives with her husband, who works as a carpenter. Two years ago she installed some modules in her house with computers in order to offer internet service. Vivianna took advantage of this opportunity because her dwelling is opposite an educational institution, and her principal customers are students.

In addition, Viviana owns 2 three-wheeled vehicles that are driven by private drivers with whom she contracts to engage in offering transportation to passengers. She administers the daily earnings.

Viviana is very happy with her businesses, because both are helping to increase her family’s income. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and what she likes about working with her community bank is that everyone is very united and jointly liable. With the money that she is now applying for she will make repairs on 2 of her computer monitors and will also buy spare parts for her vehicles

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of computer monitors and maintenace of vehicles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana Leticia M. D. C. resiD. en el municipio D. apopa en el departamento D. San Salvador.  Ana tiene 31 años D. edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos; Oscar D. 12 años y Saúl D. 5 años D. edad. Ana recibe el apoyo económico D. su esposo ya que él trabaja, pero esto no hace que Ana se conforme y es por ello que ha montado su propio negocio; el cual maneja con mucho orden y con tres años D. experiencia en el mismo, se trata D. un chalet ubicado en un centro escolar D. Apopa donD. obtiene buenas ganancias ya que hay mucha afluencia D. personas y no se encuentra con competencia  alguna, el deseo D. Ana es surtir mas su pequeño local para ayudar a incrementar sus ventas, es por eso que solicita este crédito.
texts.en:
Ana Leticia M. D. C. lives in Apopa in the department of San Salvador. Ana is 31 years old, lives with her husband, and is the mother of two children: Oscar who is 12 years old and Saúl who is 5 years old. Ana’s husband helps her economically since he is working, but this doesn’t mean that Ana wants to stay at home. This is why she started her own business. Ana has a cafe in one of Apopa’s schools. She has been in business for three years and is very organized. She makes a good income because there are many affluent people and no competition. Ana needs a loan because she would like to stock her small store so she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret E. is married and has four dependents. She received schooling through primary education. Margaret has established herself in the business of selling  plastic bowls at Amissano in Elmina. Her husband is a cleaner. Margaret uses her income to pay bills. Margaret is requesting a  loan to purchase more plastic bowls. Having more inventory will increase her income, which will help Margaret save to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married to Roxana Wanjiku and together they have three school-going children.  He is in the business of selling fresh milk to residents of Naivasha Town. His milk bar is well located, just next to the Naivasha District Hospital, so his milk supply is always in demand.

Joseph was introduced to KADET by a friend of his who is also a KADET client. This is his second loan with KADET. Because his clientele is ever-increasing, he is requesting the loan to buy another heifer so he can increase production of milk. 

His dream is to grow his business and get tenders to supply milk from area institutions and restaurants, and one day to have a processing plant for milk products.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase another cow to increase milk output.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary C. sells beef, pork and gari at Amissano in Elmina. Mary has received junior high school education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband works with zoomlion. Mary has been selling beef, pork and gari since 2006. She is responsible for paying school fees and bills. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuff to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to further expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase more food stuffs

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia M. is married and has five dependents. She has received schooling through junior high school. Cynthia sells rice porridge and charcoal at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 2002. Her husband is a cleaner. Cynthia uses her income to pay school fees for her children .She is requesting a loan to buy more rice and charcoal. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cynthia plans to reinvest and continue to grow her income.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and charcoal.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret Y. is married and has four dependents. She has received no formal education. Margaret sells food at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 1980. Her husband is a carpenter. Margaret uses her income to pay for utility bills and other household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Margaret plans to save and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. has a small shed and under its roof she does her selling of kenkey at Amisanu in Elmina. Kenkey is a Ghanaian dish which is prepared from fermented corn dough that is cooked and wrapped in the corn husk and eaten with hot pepper. Mary prepares kenkey from maize and sells the food with fried fish.

Mary has received no formal education. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Mary is responsible for paying fees and bills.

Mary has been selling kenkey since 2000. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to increase her production of kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more maize to increase her production of kenkey

loans.name: Akuavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme a appris le métier de la couture, elle a commencé en 1998 le commerce des habits qu'elle confectionne, son ancienneté dans ce commerce a fait qu’elle en a une parfaite maîtrise. La demande actuelle de ses clients est élevée. Pour pouvoir les satisfaire, elle doit payer des pagnes pour confectionner de nouveaux habits, c’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’adresse à WAGES pour obtenir un crédit pour acheter  15 pièces de pagnes.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who learned the trade of dressmaking. In 1998, she started doing commerce in clothing, which she makes. Her seniority in this business means she has a good command of it. Right now, the demand from her customers is high. To satisfy them, she must buy pagnes (colorful West African cloth) to make new clothing. For this reason, she is inquiring with WAGES to obtain a loan to buy 15 bolts of pagne cloth. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Evelia Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Evelia del Socorro J. B. tiene 46 años de edad. Es cliente de Fundación León 2000. Es madre soltera pues ella tiene la función de ser madre y padre de sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Y ambos dependen de ella. El espíritu con que ha salido adelante con sus propios medios es importante.su actividad economica es la venta de cosmeticos. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio y con la ayuda de una prima obtuvo la mercadería, para su negocio. En la actualidad ella continúa con esta actividad ubicada en su vivienda y algunas veces que ofrece sus productos a otros lugares. Con este préstamo lograra realizar un pedido de cremas, perfumes, talcos, cremas faciales y pintura de labios. Por lo que ahora sueña con establecer su propio negocio en el mercado donde obtendría más clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evelia del Socorro J. B. is 46 years old. She is a client of Fundación León 2000 and a single mother who has the job of both mother and father for taking care of her two dependent children. Mrs Evelia has been able to get ahead on her own and for eight years has made a living selling cosmetics. She was able to obtain her merchandise with help from a cousin. She sill sells cosmetics -- mostly from her home but sometimes in other places. With this loan she will be able to fill orders for creams, perfumes, talcs, face lotions, and lipstick. She hopes to establish a shop in the market where she could get more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Moses Wainaina

texts.en:
Moses K. is 24-years old and married with one child. He lives and carries out his business in the Githurai 45 neighborhood of Nairobi.

Moses shines shoes and sells secondhand clothes.  His clients are middle-class income earners in the urban setting. Before taking loans from KADET, Moses never borrowed from any MFI. He was introduced to KADET by a friend.

This will be his first loan and he is requesting it to set up a proper shop for shoe shining and selling secondhand clothes.  One day, he hopes to own a fleet of public transport vehicles.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To set up a shop for shoe shining and selling second hand clothes

loans.name: Anielka De La Concepcion

texts.es: Anielka de la Concepción G. D. tiene 24 años. A pesar de su corta edad Anielka ha obtenido cierta experiencia en su negocio, lo que le ha dado el empeño necesario para salir adelante. Es una digna actividad que nace hace 3 años. Porque esto se lo enseño su Mama. Y fue con el paso del tiempo que Anielka le tomo cariño a su actividad económica como es la venta de cosmeticos y fue así que decide seguir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, body y pinturas de uñas. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle condiciones a su vivienda, para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Anielka de la Concepción G. D. is 24 years old. In spite of her young age, Anielka has already gained significant experience in her business, which gives her the incentive to get ahead. Anielka sells cosmetics for a living. She began her business three years ago after her mother taught her how to and has grown to love it. The loan is for working capital to buy perfumes, creams, and nail polish. She would love to be able to make improvements to her home so she can continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Heydi Jose

texts.es: La joven de Heydi Jose S. M. de 29 años. Es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. A pesar de ser tan joven Heydi inicio desde muy joven trabajando, por lo que tenía que sufragar sus estudios. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general la mayoría d sus clientes son personas de sus edad, y esto le facilita la comunicación con sus clientes. En la actualidad continua con su mismo negocio, y en su barrio ella es la única que tiene este tipo de actividad económica. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de bolsos, calzado, colonias y estuches de pinturas.
texts.en:
Heydi Jose S. M., 29, is a single mother raising one son. Heydi started working at a very young age, so she had to defray her education. She sells general merchandise. Most of her customers are her age. This facilitates the communication with her customers. She is currently in the same business. She is the only one in her neighborhood that has this type of business. That is why she is asking for this loan for working capital. She will buy purses, footwear, cologne, and paintboxes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pablo Cruz

texts.es: Pablo Cruz P. R. tiene la edad de 74 años. Es hombre que ha vivido muchas experiencias y debido a esto ha obtenido el reconocimiento necesario para su trabajo. La actividad económica de Pablo es ofrecer los servicios de carpintería. Ya que inicio como ayudante en una taller de carpintería. Y con las pocas ganancias logro establecer su propio negocio con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Y Logro salir adelante, Pablo es un hombre muy luchador y que le gusta el trabajo duro. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materiales, clavos, pinturas y lijas para las maderas.
texts.en:
Pablo Cruz P. R. is 74. He is a man who has lived many experiences. Because of this he has obtained the necessary knowledge for his work. Pablo is a carpenter. He started as a helper in a carpentry shop. With his small earnings, much work, and sacrifice, he was able to establish his own business. He was able to get ahead. Pablo is a fighter, and he likes hard work. The loan he is asking for is to buy materials, nails, paint, and sandpaper for the wood.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Unidas Somos Mas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Unidas Somos Más, es un banco formado por seis socias, esta ubicado en la Parroquia de San Pedro de Quingeo, comunidad Nonadé, sector las Rosas,  en su templo se venera una efigie de Cristo Crucificado, muy visitada y conocida como, el Señor de los Milagros En esta parroquia, fueron célebres, durante el Carnaval, los juegos del Pucara, que significa: fortaleza. Consisten en la lucha entre dos rivales, generalmente indígenas muy fuertes y de pequeña talla, provistas de ondas y masas de hierro que lanzaban contra su contendor, el que se defendía escudándose con un sombrero de cuero, de grandes faldas, que al agacharse protegían su cuerpo. 
En la foto se encuentran las socias y por esta vez el coordinador de Fundación Espoir, el mismo que hacia una visita de control.
Sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, tejer sombreros con paja toquilla, su gente es muy trabajadora y cumplida como podemos darnos cuenta en este grupo por ejemplo las señoras:
Sra. Carmen Leonor S. C..
Carmen es oriunda de Quingeo, tiene 38 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos, de 14 y 10 años de edad, la de 10 estudia en la escuela Rumipamba ubicada en Quingeo, y la mayor le ayuda a su madre en las labores cotidianas y domésticas, vive en casa de sus padres conjuntamente con sus hermanos pese a que son mayores y casados siguen viviendo con sus padres,  Carmen por su falta de educación dice que no le queda más que dedicarse al campo a trabajar ya que no ha conseguido en que más laborar, se dedica a más de la agricultura a tejer sombreros que luego de terminarlos en el tiempo de 2 a 3 días, los comercializa en el mismo barrio a un costo de 12 a 15 dólares cada uno, según la dificultad que lleve cada uno de ellos, tiene pollos en su casa pero son muy pocos para lo que desea comercializar, solicitó crédito de 440 dólares para comprar más pollos y así dedicarse más en su casa al trabajo y no tenga que salir a trabajar en los campos.
Sus metas es poder independizarse construyendo su propia casa y poder poner allí su negocio de pollos.
Sra. Eva Beatriz S. C.
Eva es socia mucho tiempo de la fundación ESPOIR, realiza su tercer crédito, tiene 27 años de edad, soltera, tiene una niña de 7 meses de edad, vive  conjuntamente con sus hermanos pese a que son mayores a ella,  siguen viviendo con sus padres, por su falta de educación dice que no le queda más que dedicarse al campo a trabajar ya que no ha conseguido en que más laborar, se dedica a más de la agricultura a tejer sombreros que luego de terminarlos en el tiempo de 2 a 3 días según como se dedica, los comercializa en el mismo barrio a un costo de 12 a 15 dólares cada uno, según la dificultad que lleve cada uno de ellos, tiene pollos en su casa pero son muy pocos para lo que desea comercializar, solicitó crédito de 330 dólares para comprar más pollos y así dedicarse más en su casa al trabajo y no tenga que salir a trabajar en los campos.
Su sueño es poder hacer un criadero grande de pollos, y comprar vacas lecheras porque dice que la venta de la leche es buena por el sector y sus padres tienen terrenos de hierba.
texts.en:
The Somos Más Community Bank consists of six members. It is located in the San Pedro de Quinego parrish, Nonadé community, Rosas sector. In their temple they worship an effigy of Christ Crucified. It is very visited and well known as the Lord of the Miracles. In this parish, the fighters were celebrities. During Carnaval, they held the games of Pucara, which means strength. The fight was between two rivals, who were generally very strong, but short indigenous people. They had metal weapons, which they threw at their opponent. They defended themselves by wearing a leather hat with large flaps, which they lowered to protect their bodies. The members and the current coordinator of the Espoir Foundation, who was making a supervisory visit, are in the photo. The community’s inhabitants work in agriculture, raise animals, and weave panama hats. The people are hard working and responsible, as you will see in the examples of this group: Carmen Leonor S. C. Camren is from Quingeo. She is 38, divorced, and has two children ages 14 and 10. The 10 year old goes to the Rumipamba school, which is located in Quingeo. The older helps her mother with the daily work and household chores. She lives in her parents’ house together with her siblings. Even though they are grown and married, they still live with their parents. Carmen, with her lack of education, says that there is nothing else for her to do but work in the fields. She has not found other work. She does more than farming. She weaves hats, and after two or three days she finishes them. Then she sells them in her own neighborhood for $12 or $15 each, depending on the difficulty in making them. She has chickens at her house. She would like to sell them, but she has very few. She has asked for a loan for $440 to buy more chickens. That way she could work more at home and not have to leave to work in the fields. Her goals are to be able to become independent, build her own home, and be able to set up her chicken business there. Eva Beatriz S. C. Eva has been a member of the ESPOIR Foundation for a long time. This is her third loan. She is 27, single, and has a 7 month old daughter. She lives with her siblings. Even though they are older than she is, they continue living with their parents. Due to her lack of education, she says that there is nothing else for her to do but work in the fields. She has not found other work. She does more than farming. She weaves hats, and after two or three days, depending on how she makes them, she finishes them. Then she sells them in her own neighborhood for $12 or $15 each, depending on the difficulty in making them. She has chickens at her house. She would like to sell them, but she has very few. She has asked for a loan for $330 to buy more chickens. That way she could work more at home and not have to leave to work in the fields. Her dream is to be able to be a big chicken farmer and to buy milking cows. Milk sales are good in her sector, and her parents have good, grassy fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens and cows

loans.name: Margarita Marcelina

texts.es: La señora Margarita Marcelina Cárdena Pacheco es cliente de Fundación León 2000. Tiene 46 años y 2 hijos que dependen de ella. Con el fin de contribuir a los gastos de su familia decide laborar en un kiosko y ademas ofrcer los servicios de fotocopias, con esta humilde actividad ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. En la actualidad estudia la carrera de administración de empresas ya que esto le ayudara con su negocio. Pues ella enfrenta las preocupaciones de la bajas de las ventas. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de gaseosas, golosinas, refrescos y repostería. Su mayor sueño es mejorar su negocio y mantenerse estable.
texts.en:
Margarita is a client of Fundación León 2000. She is 46 years old and has two dependent children. To help with her family’s expenses she works in a newsstand that also offers photocopying services. With this humble job she has helped her family move forward. She has been doing this for more than six years and is currently studying business administration since this will help her work. She is facing worries of a reduction in sales. Her motive for seeking a loan is for working capital to purchase sodas, candies, and pastries. Her dream is to improve her business and remain stable.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase sodas and candies to sell

loans.name: Thalia Lizeth

texts.es:
La señora Thalia Lizeth E. es madre de dos pequeños hijos y está estudiando la carrera de contador público. 
Pero en este momento solicita un préstamo para poder pagar la colegiatura y el titulo profesional, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para liquidar.
Ella trabaja como vendedora en una compañía de teléfono, este es el ingreso que tiene para sus estudios y pagar el crédito ya que los gastos familiares los cubre su esposo el señor  Roberto Coronel.
texts.en:
Thalia Lizetha E. is a mother of two small children and is studying to be an accountant. However, right now she is requesting a loan to pay her school fees since she doesn't have the money necessary to pay them. She works as a seller at a telephone company which is the income that she uses for her studies and will use to repay the loan, since her husband Roberto Coronel covers the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for school fees

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: Wilson N. O. tiene 41 años, es una persona humilde. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para invertirlo en capital de trabajo y así comprar  productos de consumo diario para su pulpería como arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar y golosinas en general. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle a sus hijos una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
41-year old Wilson N. O. is a simple person and is responsible for raising his two children. He earns his living by running a small grocery store, a job he has been doing for more than four years. He plans to use the loan to increase the stock in his store—to buy items that are in daily use such as rice, oil, beans, sugar, and candy. His greatest dream is to provide his children with a nice home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products for his store

loans.name: Johanna De La Concepcion

texts.es: Johanna de la Concepción J. Z. tiene 38 años. Es una mujer casada. Johannna tenía 1 hijo pero dadas las circunstancias de la vida falleció, y con la ayuda de su esposo han salido adelante. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, con el apoyo de una tía que le proporcionaba la mercadería, entonces Johanna visitaba a sus clientes para ofrecerles sus productos. Le motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa interior, perfumes y cremas. Por lo que su deseo es establecer una pequeña distribuidora.
texts.en:
38-year old Johanna de la Concepción J. Z. is married and had a son, but due to unfortunate circumstances he died. With help from her husband, she has managed to move on. Her work is selling cosmetics. Johanna is a hardworking woman, and she has always enjoyed working. She’s been doing this job for more than ten years—with help from an aunt who provided her with the merchandise, and Johanna would visit the customers to show them the products. She wants to use the loan to buy more products such as underwear, perfumes, and lotions. Her dream is to open a small store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products for her business

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es: Aura Elena G. tiene 43 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Desde muy joven ella ha trabajo para progresar en la vida. Aura tiene la actividad económica de venta de granos básicos y leña. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y además elaboraba unas deliciosas enchiladas. Pero debido a la artritis que posee tuvo que dejar de elaborar tortillas y dedicarse a venta de granos básicos y leña. Aura solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite y leña. Su deseo es construir su propia vivienda, ya que actualmente vive con su Mama.
texts.en:
43-year old Aura Elena G. is married and is raising a son. Since she was a young woman, she has worked in order to get on in life. Aura earns her living by selling staple grains and firewood. She has been doing this work for more than twelve years; beforehand she made and sold tortillas as well as delicious enchiladas. However, because of arthritis she had to stop making tortillas and sell grains and firewood instead. She is asking for a loan to buy more products like rice, sugar, oil, and firewood. Her dream is to build her own house as at the moment she lives with her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Petrona Virginia

texts.es: Petrona Virginia E. Hernández tiene la edad de 53 años, es una mujer viuda. Tiene 2 hijas a su cargo, ellas le ayudan a salir adelante con su negocio. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio, Petrona es una mujer muy luchadora, por lo que empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia por lo que tenía que mantener a sus hijas y es por medio de su humilde actividad económica que ha logrado proporcionarles a sus hijas la oportunidad de brindarles estudios. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos para su pulpería como arroz, aceite, golosinas, refrescos naturales y jugos. Su mayor deseo es que sus hijas logren prepararse.
texts.en:
Petrona Virginia E. Hernández is 53 years old. She is widowed and has 2 daughters who help with her business. For 30 years, she has operated a small grocery store. Petrona is a fighter – she began working for herself in order to support her daughters and provide them an opportunity to receive an education.

She is requesting a loan to buy products for her grocery store, such as rice, cooking oil, candy, soft drinks and juices. Her greatest desire is to prepare her daughters for success.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Carlota Del Carmen

texts.es: Carlota del Carmen L. tiene la edad de 53 años. Es una mujer soltera. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian. Es una mujer que ha trabajado muy duro, ha sido una excelente cliente con Fundación León 2000. Por lo que con este humilde oficio ha logrado que sus hijos estudien y obtengan lo necesario. Su actividad económica es la venta de venta de refrescos naturales, gaseosas, jugos, café, pan y fruta. La ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras de un dispensario. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Y ha logrado obtener muchos clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de jugos, gaseosas, pan entre otras cosas. Su mayor deseo es mantener esta fuente de ingresos para que su familia pueda obtener lo necesario.
texts.en:
Carlota del Carmen L. is 53 years old, and is a single woman. She has 4 children she is in charge of, all of whom are in school. She is a women who has worked very hard, and has been an excellent customer of Fundación León 2000.

With her humble profession, she has succeeded in getting her children to study and getting that which they need. Her business is the sales of natural soft drinks, sodas, juices, coffee, bread and fruit. Her business is located outside of a clinic. She has been in this business more than 7 years, and she has gotten many customers.

The loan she is requesting is for working capital for the purchase of juices, sodas, bread and other things. Her biggest wish is to maintain this source of income so that her family can get everything that it needs.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es: Xiomara del Socorro Martínez G. tiene 40 años. Es casada. Es madre de 2 hijos, los 2 dependen de ella y están estudiando. Xiomara es una mujer muy luchadora esto fue lo que la motivo para salir adelante con sus hijos y este negocio que  es una pulpería. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Ha sido modificada para proporcionarle espacio a sus productos. En la actualidad ella tiene ciertos de clientes que viven en comarcas alejadas. Con este financiamiento lograra comprar arroz, aceite, cosméticos, jugos, gaseosas y golosinas en general. Xiomara ha hecho de todo para salir adelante con su familia y con su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Xiomara del Socorro Martínez G. is 40, and she is married. She has two dependent children who go to school. Xiomara is a fighter, and she is motivated to get a good future for her children. That is why she has her business, a mini market. The business is located in her home. It has been modified to provide more space for her products. She currently has some customers who live in neighboring regions. With this loan she will buy rice, oil, cosmetics, juice, soft drinks, and sweets. Xiomara has done everything to get ahead with her family and with her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Shalom Group 5

texts.en:
Wendi, pictured far left, is the group leader of the group Shalom. Wendi and her group live in the small town of Hato Mayor in the eastern province in the Dominican Republic.

Wendi has been selling pants and undergarments for five years. Two years into her business she decided to take out a small loan to help grow her business and she is now on her 7th loan cycle. Because she has never missed a payment, she is able to take out a bigger loan every time. With every loan she is able to increase her profits and put more money in her savings account. Wendi loves her job because she enjoys helping people find those ever-so-elusive perfect pair of jeans. 

Wendi has two children (ages 1 and  7) and her goal is to grow her business enough to help send her children to college. You can help Wendi achieve her dreams but supporting this loan!

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her clothing business.

loans.name: Shalom Group 2

texts.en:
Dominga, pictured far left, is the group leader of the group Shalom Group 2. The members of this group live in the small town of Hato Mayor in the eastern province of the Dominican Republic. 

Dominga runs a fruit and vegetable stand with her husband. They sell all kinds of fruits and vegetables and with this loan they will buy more bananas, yuca, avocados, and oranges. Dominga has successfully taken out and paid back 5 small loans and with each one she is able to grow her business a little bit more. She distinguishes her business from the other fruit and vegetable stands because she makes sure that she sells the freshest and tastiest produce she can find. 

Right now Dominga lives in government-provided housing and it is her dream to be able to one day own her own house. By supporting this loan you can help Dominga come one step closer to realizing her dreams!

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
Liz pertenece al grupo LOS ANGELES que esta ubicado en la colonia María Isabel en el Municipio de Valle de Chalco una zona semi urbana. Del Estado de México, Liz  vende productos de papelería frente a una escuela con su triciclo todas las mañanas antes de que los niños entren a la escuela,  por lo  cual ella tiene que trasladarse desde su casa a la escuela muy temprano empujando su triciclo. Ella   esta pidiendo este préstamo  para comprar  más productos de papelería (cuadernos, lápices, colores) ya que se acerca el nuevo ciclo escolar y necesita surtirse por que es, cuando todos los niños necesitan nuevos útiles,  y para Liz una oportunidad de generar mas ventas y obtener ingresos que le ayudaría con los gastos de escuela para sus 3 hijas  y apoyar a su esposo en estos gastos, por que el cuenta con un trabajo que es de temporada, cubriendo  necesidades básicas  y con el trabajo de ambos darle a sus hijas una preparación académica mayor, a la que ellos tuvieron.


El grupo  esta formado por 12 integrantes (de izquierda a  derecha):



Maricarmen Domínguez                         Venta de Uniformes
Avelina Pérez M.                      Venta de Corsetería
María del Rosario C. C.                   Venta de Dulces
Ivett Sarai Guzmán G.                      Abarrotes
Rosa Lorena García M.                Costurera
Refugio Beatriz R. Fernández         Venta de Ropa
Lucia Gabriela Juárez Jiménez              Venta de dulces
Julia López Q.                              Venta de Antojitos
María Luisa Ramírez M.                Reparadora de Calzado
Agustín Domínguez M.                    Venta de discos
Marco Antonio Juárez C.              Verdulería
texts.en:
Liz belongs to the Los Angeles group, which is located in the María Isabel colony in the Valle de Calco municipality, a semi urban area in the state of Mexico. Liz sells paper products with her tricycle in front of a school every morning before the children enter the school. To do so, she has to go from her house to the school very early pushing her tricycle. She is asking for a loan to buy more paper products (notebooks, pencils, colors) because the new school cycle is approaching. She needs to stock up for when the children need new supplies. This is an opportunity for Liz to generate more sales and get income that will help her husband with the school expenses for her three daughters. Her husband’s work is seasonal, and it covers basic needs. By both working they can give their daughters greater academic preparation, like they had. The group consists of 12 members (from left to right): Maricarmen Domínguez Uniform Sales Avelina Pérez M. Corset Sales María del Rosario C. C. Sells Sweets Ivett Sarai Guzmán G. Groceries Rosa Lorena García M. Seamstress Refugio Beatriz R. Fernández Clothing Sales Lucia Gabriela Juárez Jiménez Sells Sweets Julia López Q. Sells Appetizers María Luisa Ramírez M. Shoe Repair Agustín Domínguez M. Sells Disks Marco Antonio Juárez C. Vegetable Market

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
La señora Maricruz M. es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos hijas menores de edad, para las cuales quiere lo mejor para ellas. 
Tiene poco que le adquirió la vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, pero le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor de la casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar la barda. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la mejora  y así ella y sus dos pequeñas hijas estarán más seguras en su casa.
Maricruz trabaja en un despacho contable como contadora publica, este es el ingreso que genera para su familia y con el cual un parte cera para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Maricruz M. is a single mother, and she has two young daughters under her responsibility, and she wants the best for them. She has little that she acquired for her home by means of a governmental loan, but she is missing the fence around the house, but she does not have the money necessary to buy the material and pay the person that is in charge of building the fence.

She requests a loan to be able to make the improvement, so that she and her 2 little daughters will be safer in their house. Maricruz works in an accounting office as a public accountant. This is the income that she makes for her family and with which in part she will pay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a fence in the back of the house

loans.name: Union Y Progreso Group

texts.en:
Ana V. L. is a mother of 6 and is one of two group leaders in the Union y Progresso loan group. She lives with her family in Santiago, a crowded city in the Dominican Republic. 

Prior to her involvement with Esperanza, Ana sold miscellaneous things out of her home to other women in the community. When Esperanza began working in her community, she took out a loan and started her clothing business. She buys used clothes that are sent to the Dominican Republic from America in large shipments called pacas. She buys the clothes in bulk and then sells them out of her home.

Ana’s husband is a butcher. He has a meat stand that he runs out of their home. Ana and her husband’s incomes help support their 6 kids. Ana expresses that if she was not able to receive her micro-loans, their family situation would be much more difficult.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Tu Ángel Lucy Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy inicia su ciclo 13 con 30 socias.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, comidas, frutas, condimentos, prendas D. vestir, cereales, flores, abarrotes en general y celulares.

Como es el caso D.  Maria Luz que es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Maria Luz venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado, también venD. en las ferias.

Por otro lado Mayra es soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Mayra venD. ropa a pedido, sus ventas los realiza al crédito y a los comerciantes D. los mercados, además viaja a las ferias en donD. compra cereales y los venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad.

Mientras que Silvia es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, Silvia venD. accesorios D. celulares en un local alquilado.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, 800 soles, haciendo un total D. 13,300 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. frutas, verduras, quinua, trigo, arroz, azúcar, accesorios D. celulares.

Los sueños D. las socias son comprar un carro, que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y sean profesionales, terminar D. construir su casa y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The communal bank group “Tu Ángel Lucy” is beginning its 13th loan cycle with 30 members. They operate different businesses selling various products such as vegetables, prepared meals, fruits, spices, clothing, cereals, flowers, groceries and mobile phone accessories.

Such is the case with Maria Luz, who is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. She travels to the markets and fairs selling food.

Mayra is a 27 year old single mother of 1 son. She sells clothes upon request. Her sales are maD. on a credit basis to traders in the marketplace. She also travels to fairs where she buys and sells grain at the wholesale food market.

Silvia is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She sells mobile phone accessories from a rented space.

The members need loans of different amounts ranging from 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, and 800 soles, for a total of 13,300 soles for the entire communal bank group.

Their loans will be used to purchase fruits, vegetables, quinoa, wheat, rice, sugar, and mobile phone accessories.

Some of the members’ goals incluD. purchasing a car, financing their children’s education so that they can become professionals, building a home, and improving their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, quinoa, wheat, rice, sugar, and mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga.
Isabel es casada, tiene 59 años y 3 hijos, Isabel vende comida en un local alquilado que se encuentra cerca de un paradero de transporte publico, donde también vende bebidas variadas, Además los días sábados y domingos vende comida en la feria de San Juan.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideo, azucar.
Isabel sueña con tener un restaurante en un local propio.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the communal bank group “Morenita Huamanga”. She is 59 years old, married and has 3 children. Isabel sells food and beverages from a rented space near a bus stop. In addition, she sells food on Saturdays and Sundays at the San Juan market.

Isabel needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy rice, noodles and sugar. She dreams of having her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, noodles and sugar.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga.
Nely es casada, tiene 20 años y 2 hijos, Nely vende comida de manera ambulatoria cerca de los mercados del centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza por las mañana, además Nelly por las noches vende salchipollos en el parque enace. 
Nely necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, papa, huevo.
Los sueños de Nely son tener casa propia, brindar una buena educación y comida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nely is a member of the communal bank group “Morenita Huamanga”. She is 20 years old, married and has 2 children. Nely is a traveling food vendor in the markets near the center of Ayacucho. She works from the markets every morning and also sells salchipollos (chicken & sausages) in the evenings at Enace Park.

Nely needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice, potatoes and eggs. She dreams of having her own home and providing a good education and food for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, potatoes and eggs

loans.name: Rosalia Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosalía es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga.
Rosalía es separada, tiene 51 años y 3 hijos, Rosalía tiene una tienda en un local alquilado llamado Multiservicios Mechita vende abarrotes en general, bebidas, frutas, además vende comida.
Rosalía necesita un préstamo de 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos lácteos.
Los sueños de Rosalía son ampliar sus negocios y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a member of the Morenita Huamanga Community Bank. Rosalía is 51, separated, and has three children. Rosalía has a store called Multiservicios Mechita in a rented location. She sells general groceries, drinks, fruit; and she also sells meals. Rosalía needs a loan for 3,500 PEN to buy dairy products. Rosalía’s dreams are to expand her businesses and to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dairy products

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Maria Margarita es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, un grupo de mujeres que reside en la comunidad de Turi, aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Es un grupo de señoras que se llevan muy bien entre ellas; pasan sus reuniones riéndose y haciendo chistes. Si la risa es la mejor medicina, Mujer y Fortaleza es un grupo bien saludable. También hacen pequeñas fiestas y actividades entre ellas para ocasiones como el día de la madre, y son bien colaboradoras. Hasta toman turnos barriendo después de cada reunión en la casa de la socia donde se reúne el grupo cada 2 semanas.

Maria Margarita tiene 27 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos pequeños de 8, 7, 4 y 2 años. Su esposo trabaja como albañil. Ella se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, cuyes y pollos en su casa, además se encarga de los quehaceres domésticos y cuida a sus 4 hijos. Ella cría los animales en sus casa y los vende los fines de semana en la Feria Libre, un mercado grande en la ciudad de Cuenca. Va al mercado cada dos o tres semanas, dependiendo de cuantos animales tiene para vender. En este momento tiene pocos animales, debido a que recientemente algunos pollos murieron de una enfermedad y algunos cuyes murieron por el frío. Ella dice que esto es la parte más difícil de su trabajo. Por más atención que le de al cuidado de los animales, a veces los animales mueren igual. Pero dice que le gusta el trabajo, y disfruta del pasar tiempo con sus hijos y sus animalitos en su casa de campo. 

Maria Margarita está pidiendo un préstamo de 330 para poder pagar una deuda que tiene por un terreno que se compró pero está pagando todavía. Piensa construir una casa para su familia en este terreno, y también lo ocupará para sembrar algunos cultivos como maíz y lechugas. Su meta para el futuro es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita is a member of the Mujer y Fortaleza Community Bank, a group of women who reside in the Turi community. This community is approximately a half hour outside of the city of Cuenca in the south of Ecuador. It is a group of women who get along very well. At their meetings they laugh and talk. If laughter is the best medicine, Mujer y Fortaleza is a very healthy group. They also have small parties and activities among themselves for special occasions like Mother’s Day. They work well together. After each meeting, they even take turns sweeping the house of the member who held the meeting. The group meets every two weeks. Maria Margarita is 27, married, and has four small children ages 8, 7, 4, and 2. Her husband works as a bricklayer. She raises pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens at her house. Also, she is in charge of the domestic chores and taking care of her four children. She raises the animals at her house, and she sells them on the week ends at the Feria Libre, a large market in the city of Cuenca. She goes to the market every two or three weeks, depending on how many animals she has to sell. At this time, she has few animals to sell because some chickens recently died of a disease, and some guinea pigs died of the cold. She says this is the most difficult part of her work. For all of the attention that she gives to taking care of the animals, sometimes they still die. She likes the work, and she enjoys spending time with her children and her animals in her country house. Maria Margarita is asking for a loan for 330 to be able to pay a debt that she has for a piece of land that she bought but is still paying for. She plans to build a house for her family on this land. She will also use it to plant some corn and lettuce crops. Her goal for the future is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay an outstanding debt and to plant corn and lettuce

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Lucia es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, un grupo de mujeres que reside en la comunidad de Turi, aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Es un grupo de señoras que se llevan muy bien entre ellas; pasan sus reuniones riéndose y haciendo chistes. Si la risa es la mejor medicina, Mujer y Fortaleza es un grupo bien saludable. También hacen pequeñas fiestas y actividades entre ellas para ocasiones como el día de la madre, y son bien colaboradoras. Hasta toman turnos barriendo después de cada reunión en la casa de la socia donde se reúne el grupo cada 2 semanas. 
Ana Lucia tiene 23 años, es casada, y tiene un hijo de 4 años. Su esposo es albañil. Ella trabaja como empleada doméstica para una familia en la ciudad de Cuenca. Ana Maria trabaja en Cuenca de lunes a viernes, allí deja su hijo con los suegros o en el jardín infantil. Además, estudia los fines de semana para poder graduarse del colegio. Ella dejó el colegio cuando tenía 14 años porque se puso a trabajar a esta misma edad. Después de que se casó decidió retomar sus estudios porque tiene como meta ser veterinaria, entonces necesitará estudios superiores. Ya tiene 2 años de estudios completados, y le falta 4 años para terminar el colegio.  
Aparte de su trabajo como empleada, Ana Lucia también cría cuyes, ovejas y una vaca en su casa. Dice que le gusta mucho trabajar con animales, y por eso quiere ser veterinaria.  
Ana pidió 220 dólares para invertir en las  matrículas para el colegio de ella y para pagar el jardín para su hijo. Para el futuro, tiene pensado comprarse un computador porque es una necesidad para los que estudien.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia is a member of the communal bank “Mujer y Fortaleza”, which is a group of women living in the community of Turi, located about half an hour outside the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. These ladies get along well with one another, spending their meeting time laughing and making jokes. If laughter is the best medicine, then “Mujer y Fortaleza” is a very healthy group. They get together to celebrate occasions such as Mother's Day, and they are good members. They even take turns sweeping the home of the group member who is hosting their regular meeting, which takes place every 2 weeks.

Ana Lucia is 23 years, married, and the mother of a 4 year old child. Her husband is a mason. She works as a maid for a family in the city of Cuenca. Ana Maria works Monday through Friday, leaving her son with her in-laws or at kindergarten. In addition, she studies on the weekends to obtain her high school diploma. She left school when she was 14 to start working. After she got married, she decided to resume her studies because her goal is to become a veterinarian, which requires higher education. She has already completed 2 years of study, and will need another 4 years to complete college.

Besides her work as a maid, Ana Lucia also raises guinea pigs, sheep and cows from her home. She says she enjoys working with animals, and therefore wants to become a veterinarian. Ana is requesting $ 220 to pay for her school fees and her son’s kindergarten. In the future, she would like to buy a computer because it is a necessity for her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her school fees & her son's kindergarten

loans.name: Maria Carmita

texts.es:
La señora Maria Carmita es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza perteneciente al barrio Punta Corral, un grupo de mujeres que reside en la comunidad de Turi, aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Es un grupo de señoras que se llevan muy bien entre ellas; pasan sus reuniones riéndose y haciendo chistes. Hacen pequeñas fiestas entre ellas para ocasiones como el día de la madre, y son bien colaboradoras, hasta toman turnos barriendo después de cada reunión en la casa de la socia donde se reúnen cada 2 semanas. 
La señora María Carmita tiene 36 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, 17,13y 9, de los cuales viven con ella todavía, la de 13 estudia en una academia de corte y confección llamada Digna Rodríguez ubicada vía al sector de Baños de cuenca, el de 9 estudia en la escuela Francisco Astudillo del sector de Turi, la señora trabaja como empleada en varias casas de su comunidad, limpiando y haciendo los quehaceres domésticos.   
Pidió 440 dólares para poder invertir en la compra de pollos de cría para la venta, comenta que los pollos que ella cría salen a la venta a partir de los 45 días con un peso de 5 a 6 libras, ella compra pollos que cuesta en el mercado a 2,50 dólares cada uno, también comprará alimentos para las aves que consumen en un porcentaje de dos sacos de chanca y dos de pronaca en un mes por 30 pollos; la pronaca actualmente esta costando 20 dólares y la chanca 16 dólares.
Su meta para el futuro es mejorar de salud y tener estabilidad económica para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María Carmita is a member of the communal bank Mujer y Fortaleza (Women and Strength), in the Punta Corral neighborhood. The group of women lives in the community of Turi, about half an hour outside of the city of Cuenca, in the south of Ecuador. The women in this group get along very well with each other; they spend their meetings laughing and telling jokes. They have small parties with each other for occasions like mother's day, and they are great collaborators. They even take turns sweeping the house where they meet every two weeks.

Maria Carmita is 36, married, and has three children, 17, 13, and 9 years old, who still live with her. The 13-year-old studies in a school for tailoring called Digna Rodríguez, in the Baños sector of Cuenca; the 9-year-old studies at the Francisco Astudillo school in the Turi sector. Maria works in several homes in her community, cleaning and doing domestic chores.

She has requested 440 dollars to be able to invest in buying chickens to sell. She said that the chickens she raises are ready to sell after 45 days, and weigh 5 to 6 pounds. She buys chickens in the market that cost $2.50 each, and also buys bird feed that they eat--two sacks of "chanca" and two of "pronaca" feed in one month for 30 chickens. The "pronaca" costs 20 dollars per sack and the "chanca" is 16 dollars.

Her goal for the future is to improve her health and have economic stability for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in buying chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Maria Carmelina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Carmelina es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, un grupo de mujeres que reside en la comunidad de Turi, aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Es un grupo de señoras que se llevan muy bien entre ellas; pasan sus reuniones riéndose y haciendo chistes. Hacen pequeñas fiestas entre ellas para ocasiones como el día de la madre, y son bien colaboradoras, hasta toman turnos barriendo después de cada reunión en la casa de la socia donde se reúnen cada 2 semanas.
La señora María  tiene 45 años, es casada, y tiene 6 hijos, 3 de los cuales viven con ella todavía. Todos sus hijos ya son grandes y trabajan, menos el menor que está estudiando todavía. La señora trabaja como empleada en varias casas de su comunidad, limpiando y haciendo los quehaceres domésticos.  
Lamentablemente, la Sra. Maria Carmelina tiene algunos problemas de salud, tuvo un derrame cerebral hace un tiempo y todavía está sintiendo los efectos. Sigue trabajando siempre y cuando pueda para poder sustentarse económicamente, porque su esposo no le ayuda mucho en la parte económica. Está pidiendo un préstamo de 440 para poder invertir en los materiales que necesita para poder realizar su trabajo como empleada doméstica. 
Su meta para el futuro es mejorar de salud y tener estabilidad económica para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María Carmelina is a member of the communal bank "Mujer y Fortaleza" (Woman and Strength), a group of women who live in the community of Turi, about half an hour outside of the city of Cuenca, in the south of Ecuador. They are a group of women who get along very well with each other; they spend their meetings laughing and telling jokes. They throw small parties together for occasions like Mother's Day, and they are good collaborators. They even take turns sweeping after every meeting, at the house where they meet every two weeks.

María is 45 years old, married, and has 6 children, 3 of whom still live with her. All her children are grown up and work, except for the youngest who is still studying. She works as an employee in several homes in her community, cleaning and doing domestic chores.

Unfortunately, María Carmelina has had some health problems. She had a stroke a while ago, and is still feeling its effects. She continues to work as much as she can to be able to economically sustain herself, because her husband does not financially help her much.

She is requesting a loan of $440 to invest in the materials she needs to do her job as a domestic employee. Her goal for the future is to improve her health and have economic stability for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials to work as a domestic employee

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo es socio del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga.
Máximo es separado, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Máximo tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir llamado Confecciones M., actividad que realiza con el apoyo de personales, además vende telas.
Máximo necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Máximo son adquirir un local propio, aperturar sucursales en la región sur.
texts.en:
Máximo is a member of the community bank Morenita Huamanga. He is separated, 50 years old, and has three children.

Máximo has a clothing workshop called "Confecciones M." (M. Clothing), a business he carries out with the assistance of staff. He also sells fabric.

Máximo needs a loan of 3000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of cloth. His dreams are to acquire his own shop, and open branches in the southern region.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Cruz Trancito

texts.es:
La señora Cruz es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, un grupo de mujeres que reside en la comunidad de Turi, aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Es un grupo de señoras que se llevan muy bien entre ellas; pasan sus reuniones riéndose y haciendo chistes. Si la risa es la mejor medicina, Mujer y Fortaleza es un grupo bien saludable. También hacen pequeñas fiestas y actividades entre ellas para ocasiones como el día de la madre, y son bien colaboradoras. Hasta toman turnos barriendo después de cada reunión en la casa de la socia donde se reúne el grupo cada 2 semanas. 
Cruz tiene 38 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos pequeños de 11, 7 y 4 años, el mayor estudia en el colegio Fray Vicente Solano en Cuenca, y el otro en la escuela Francisco Astudillo. Su esposo trabaja como albañil. No tienen casa propia viven en casa de sus padres, sus hijos pasan con sus abuelos ya que el horario de Cruz es todo el día, Ella se dedica a lavar ropa en la ciudad, a veces se hace tarde pero otros días llega temprano para dedicarse a sus hijos y animales.
Cruz tiene un hogar estable y lleno de felicidad, todo lo que trabajan se comparte para los gastos de la familia. Ella cría los animales en su casa y los vende los fines de semana en la Feria Libre, un mercado grande en la ciudad de Cuenca. Va al mercado cada dos o tres semanas, dependiendo de cuantos animales tiene para vender. En este momento tiene pocos animales, debido a que recientemente algunos pollos murieron de una enfermedad y algunos cuyes murieron por el frío. Ella dice que esto es la parte más difícil de su trabajo. Por más que pueda ser muy atenta e intentar cuidarles muy bien, a veces los animales mueren igual. Pero dice que le gusta el trabajo, y disfruta del pasar tiempo con sus hijos y sus animalitos en su casa de campo.  
Cruz Tránsito pidió 660 dólares para invertir  comprando pollos y criarlos para vender. Piensa construir una casa para su familia en este terreno, y también lo ocupará para sembrar algunos cultivos como maíz y lechugas. Su meta para el futuro es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Cruz is a member of the communal bank “Mujer y Fortaleza”, which is a group of women living in the community of Turi, located about half an hour outside the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. These ladies get along well with one another, spending their meeting time laughing and making jokes. If laughter is the best medicine, then “Mujer y Fortaleza” is a very healthy group. They get together to celebrate occasions such as Mother's Day, and they are good members. They even take turns sweeping the home of the group member who is hosting their regular meeting, which takes place every 2 weeks.

Sra. Cruz is 38 years old, married and the mother of three young children (ages 11, 7, and 4). The eldest is studying at Fray Vicente Solano School in Cuenca, and the middle child attends Francisco Astudillo School. Her husband works as a mason. They do not own a home, so they are living with her parents. Her children spend time with their grandparents since Sra. Cruz works all day. She spends most of her time in the city washing clothes, but on some days, she comes home early to be with her children and tend to the animals. Sra. Cruz has a stable home full of happiness. Everything that she works for goes toward the family expenses.

She raises animals at home and sells them on the weekends at La Feria Libre, a large open market in the city of Cuenca. She goes to market every 2 to 3 weeks, depending on how many animals she has available to sell. At the moment, she has few animals because some chickens recently died from an illness and some guinea pigs died from the cold. Cruz says this is the hardest part of her work. Even when you invest much time and care into the animals, they sometimes die all the same. Yet she enjoys her job, spending time with her children, and tending to the animals at home.

Sra. Cruz is requesting $660 to buy chickens to breed and sell. Her future goal is to own a home, so she is thinking about building a house for her family in this area. She would also like to plant crops, such as a corn and lettuce.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens to breed & sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga.
Valentina es viuda, tiene 56 años y 10 hijos, Valentina venD. flores variadas D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado magdalena, las flores los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima.
Valentina necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. flores.
Los sueños D. Valentina son sacar adelante a sus hijos y que culminen sus estudios, tener mas capital.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the Morenita Huamanga cooperative bank. Valentina is a widow. She is 56 years old and has ten children. Valentina walks around the Magdalena Market selling many types of flowers. She buys the flowers in Lima. Valentina needs a loan of 600 soles. She will use the money to buy more flowers. Valentina hopes her children are successful and that they finish their education. She also hopes to have more capital.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of flowers

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
Neri es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga.
Neri es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, Neri tiene un puesto en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad en donde vende pescado, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Neri en sus tiempos libres realiza el servicio de llamadas telefónicas.
Neri necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Neri sueña con ser mayorista, tener una cámara frigorífica.
texts.en:
Neri is a member of the Huamanga Morenita Communal Bank. Neri has a domestic partner. She is 27 years old and has three children. Neri has a job in the supply market of the city. They sell fish at this market. She sells fish everyday. In her free time, Niri has a telephone call service. Neri needs a loan for 800 soles. She will use this money to buy fish. Neri dreams of becoming a wholesaler and of having a walk-in refridgerator

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Megy

texts.es:
Megy es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Megy es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Megy es panificadora, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo en un horno alquilado, los panes los comercializa en el mercado central y también reparte por mayor a las tiendas.
Megy  necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y azúcar.
Los sueños de Megy son tener una casa propia y un horno.
texts.en:
Megy is a member of the Lirio Cooperative Bank. She has a partner, is 29 years old and has one child. Megy is a baker. She bakes with her husband in an oven that they rent. They sell their bread in the central market and also sell it wholesale to markets. Megy needs a loan of 2,000 soles. This money she will use to buy flour and sugar. Megy dreams of having her own home and oven.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour and sugar.

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Victoria es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Victoria es panificadora, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo en un horno alquilado, los panes los comercializa en el mercado central .
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar.
Los sueños de Victoria son tener un horno propio y comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Lirio Communal Bank. She lives with her partner, is 26 years old and has 1 child. Victoria is a baker, a business which she runs with her husband in a rented oven. She sells the bread in the central market. Victoria needs a loan of 1200 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of flour, butter, and sugar. Victoria's dream is to have her own oven and buy land to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, butter, and sugar.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Antonia es conviviente, tiene 58 años y 7 hijos, Antonia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Antonia tiene un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de vestir.
Antonia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Antonia son descansar e irse a pasear a Brasil.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the community bank "Lirio" (Lily).

She lives with a partner, is 58 years old, and has 7 children. Antonia has a shop in her house where she sells general groceries, vegetables, and meat, which she does every day. Also, Antonia has a small workshop where she makes clothing to sell.

Antonia needs a loan of 1600 soles that will be invested in buying rice and sugar. Antonia's dreams are to rest and to take a trip to Brazil.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Maria es casada, tiene 42 años y 7 hijos, Maria viaja  a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra quesos, cereales, animales, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también por su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos y cereales.
Los sueños de Maria son mejorar su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the community bank "Lirio" (Lily).

Maria is married, 42 years old, and has 7 children. Maria travels to the different fairs in her region, where she buys cheese, cereal, animals, and products that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho and also in her home.

Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles which will be invested in buying pigs and cereal. Maria's dreams are to improve her house and provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and cereal

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen tiene 20 años, en natural de la ciudad de Tarma, ubicada a 5 horas de la ciudad de Lima. Vive con su pareja Elbert y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta y confección de ropa, tiempo en el cual ha ganado mucha experiencia al lado de su pareja, con quien día a día elaboran las prendas de vestir que comercializan en los diferentes mercados de su distrito. A Karen le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es independiente, puede realizarlo en su hogar y estar al tanto de la educación de sus hijos. Lo bueno de su negocio es que no tiene intermediarios y todas las ganancias son para su familia. Para un futuro cercano, Karen quisiera tener un taller textil muy grande, donde elabore mayor cantidad de ropa y así pueda cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar, como mejorar la estructura de su casa y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre le ha ido muy bien en su banco comunal, denominado “Estrella Azul”, donde todos los miembros son buenos amigos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de tela para cubrir los pedidos que le realizaron en este mes.
texts.en:
Karen is 20 years old and a native of the city of Tarma, which is located 5 hours away from the city of Lima. She lives with her partner Elbert and their 2 children. For 2 years, she has sold and made clothing, during which time she has gained much experience by her partner's side, and day after day they make items of clothing that they sell at various markets in the district. Karen likes her work a lot because she is independent, and she can do it at home and stay on top of her children's education. The good part about her business is that there are no middlemen and all the earnings are for her family. In the near future, Karen would like to have a very large fabric shop where she could make more clothes and therefore be able to fund all the necessities for her home, such as improving the structure of the house and giving her children a better quality of life. This is her fourth loan with MFP and things have always gone well for her with her communal bank, named "Estrella Azul," where all the members are good friends. With the money requested, she will buy a greater amount of fabric in order to fill the orders that she got this month.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es: Lucía tiene 30 años, es natural de Junín (departamento de la sierra central peruana), hace 10 años que vino a radicar a Lima. Actualmente vive con su pareja, Enrique de 31, y sus hijos Maylin de 5 y Kenyi de un añito y medio. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su propio domicilio del distrito de Collique (a 3 horas y media del centro de Lima). Ella está muy agradecida con su trabajo, ya que gracias a él puede brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida, pues con el sueldo de su esposo, quien trabaja como obrero no les alcanza para todos los gastos, es por ello que Lucía le pone mucho empeño para sacar adelante su negocio. Su atención es de 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y no se puede quejar, pues su negocio es muy concurrido, bebido a que ella es muy carismática a la hora de vender sus productos, siendo muy querida por sus vecinos. Todo el esfuerzo de Lucía es porque quiere seguir mejorando su negocio y aumentando sus ventas. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, en su banco comunal, denominado “Estrella Azul”, le ha ido muy bien, ya que todos son muy puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos para su tienda, con lo cual espera satisfacer la demanda de su clientela.
texts.en:
Lucía is 30 years old, originally from Junín (a department of central Peru). Ten years ago she came to live in Lima. Now she lives with her partner, Enrique who is 31, and their two children, Maylin (five years old) and Kenyi (one and a half). For the past six years, she has sold groceries in her own home in the Collique district (three and a half hours from the center of Lima).

She is grateful for her work, because thanks to it she can give her family a good quality of life, since her husband's salary as a worker does not cover all their expenses. This is why Lucía puts forth so much effort to move her business forward. She works from 6:00 in the morning until 9:00 at night, and she can't complain. Her business is very busy, since she is very charismatic when she sells her products, and she is well-liked by her neighbors.

All of Lucía's efforts are directed towards improving her business and increasing her sales. This is her fourth loan with MFP, through her cooperative bank, "Estrella Azul" (Blue Star). These loans have gone well, since everyone is very punctual in their payments. With the money she is requesting, she will buy a greater quantity of products for her shop, with which she hopes to meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vicitación

texts.es: Vicitacion tiene 43 años, es natural de la ciudad de Andahuaylas, vive con su esposa Catalina de 43 y su hijo Andy de 9, ya que sus demás hijos son independientes. Desde hace 18 años se dedica al negocio de la albañilería, aprendió de su tío todas las técnicas para realizar trabajos de calidad y dejar satisfechos a todos sus clientes.
